job.title: Senior Consultant Big Data Management Products Specialist
job.description:
Our Team
Employer Professional Services provide the product expertise, and project management knowledge to deliver the most architecturally efficient and cost effective solution for our customers data integration projects. Because our practice serves the largest and most diverse Employer customer base, our work keeps us on the cutting edge of all forms of data management projects Big Data, B2B, Data Governance, Data Migration and Consolidation, Data Quality Management, Data Synchronization, Data Warehousing, Integration Competency Centers, Master Data Management, Product Information Management and Services Oriented Architectures. Whether it is a short or long-term engagement, we are dedicated to sharing our knowledge to ensure our customers continued success with our products.

Your Opportunity
The Employer Big Data and Cloud Team supports our Professional Services organization through enablement and leadership in targeted technology delivery. As a Big Data Management Product Specialist, you will gain valuable technical and consulting skills in the Employer Big Data Management Platform and related Employer products. You will deliver consulting assistance to critical customer projects providing deep technical skills and enterprise architecture advice regarding Big Data Management in a Hadoop environment. It is important that in this role that you possess technical aptitude, strength in written/verbal communications, ability to create and deliver technical education and strong client management skills to delivery successful projects in this highly visible and fast-moving market.

Your Responsibilities

Big Data Management Senior Consultant/Product Specialist is responsible for highly expert technical services, training and mentoring on Employer Big Data Management, which may include:
Providing input to Product Management to address product enhancements, evolve new capabilities for emerging customer needs, and assist with the roadmap for new products and features.
Execute billable project assignments in both strategic projects and customer escalations to ensure success rates for both customers and sales execution in the Big Data Management market
Participate in knowledge management activities to encapsulate knowledge and provide a foundation for successful Big Data Management integration project execution
Mentor less experienced staff to assist with technical and functional product related questions/issues and provide input for future training activities
Providing special services (for example, performance-related configuration or other proof-of-concept work) for Employer internal projects or for partners or for customers in billable or non-billable situations
Maintain the deepest skill level in Employer Professional Services on the Big Data Management platform
Develop customer implementation Architectures consistent with best practices around the use of Employer Big Data Management Platform

Your Qualifications
Bachelors degree required
Minimum 5+ years of consulting experience
Experience with the Employer Platform
Strong experience with building data integration processes in Employer Power Center, or similar technologies
Strong Linux/Red Hat Skills
Employer B2B, Business Glossary and/or Data Quality experience is preferred
Strong DBMS skills including SQL
Administration skills in Hadoop/Cloudera or strong desire/aptitude to learn these skills
Database appliance skills is a plus including Netezza, Greenplum, Teradata and Exadata
Able to present and address complex architectures and development issues
Ability to troubleshoot complex environments with multiple products used to achieve a solution
Experience leveraging new technologies quickly for customer success
Ability to execute in a quickly changing and dynamic environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Willingness to travel 50-75%
Ability to travel freely within North America including Canada
Possible international travel to support Worldwide customer engagements

job.title: Account Consultant
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

The primary responsibility of the Account Consultant is the sales and sales support of complex communication solutions (IP, data, cloud, hosting, voice, etc.). This is accomplished by understanding the customer's business needs and strategies, building relationships and long term partnerships with the customer and developing and applying Employer solutions to those needs and strategies. The position is responsible for positioning Employer with the customer and positioning Employer strategic products with the customers.

Job Description

  • Primary interface with both internal and external customers this positions requires a complete focus on customer service and perfecting the customer experience.
  • Responsible for attainment of revenue objectives and service quality objectives.
  • Responsible for input to and execution of account plans while leading and managing the development of the Service Plan segment for the overall Account Plan.
  • Actively engages and coordinates with customers in person and remotely, ensuring superior service levels are maintained and leading customer specific quality improvement plans as documented and identified in the Service Plan.
  • Actively works and coordinates activities in support of sales, with numerous teams that support the provisioning, design, installation and billing of sales to customers.
  • Interacts effectively as a team member to support achievement of sales objectives.
  • Makes accurate and timely decisions based on customer needs and business requirements.
  • Develops, maintains and manages customer relationships from the operational to executive levels throughout the organization.
  • Contributes to the attainment of revenue objectives by managing orders from the sales stage through to accurate billing and revenue recognition.
  • Represents Employer to multiple departments and levels within the Account, by understanding how Employers products meet their goals.
  • Assess customer needs and desires and suggest solutions and alternatives; this may involve product offerings, or improved ways of conducting business between Employer and the customer
  • Escalates proactively within interdependent departments to accomplish assigned responsibilities.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience supporting customers as it pertains to telecommunications products and services.
  • Experience supporting a sales team and/or sales support team in the area of Telecommunications solutions to include facilitation of proposals, product offering, agreements, contract review and support, and managing customer priorities with company initiatives.
  • Experience with all Employer Legacy systems including legacy Qwest Local, National and legacy CenturyTel products, processes including all billing care support.
  • Experience and/or technical knowledge in Network ordering, billing and provisioning processes and systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong interpersonal, communication, customer service, account relationship, time management, organizational and negotiating skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills, especially when dealing with incomplete or conflicting information
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
  • Some support activities requires work to be performed in the evening (network cutovers, voice migrations)
  • Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).

Alternate Location: US-Idaho-Boise; US-Oregon-Portland; US-Utah-Salt Lake Ci

Requisition #: 169508

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at Employer

job.title: Sr. Talent Development Consultant (Technical Trainer/Instruc
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Technical Training is a team of training specialists working consultatively with the North American Operation Management organizations.

Our commitment is to provide learning solutions that positively impact how our workforce operates. Technical Training uses a holistic approach to provide learning solutions. People who thrive in our area are self-starters with an inherent sense of urgency and a passion for helping others succeed and providing the right learning solutions to maximize employee performance. These Instructors are problem solvers who think fast and adapt quickly to change. Most importantly, they demonstrate outstanding critical thinking and communication skills.

This position will focus on delivering inside plant (ISP) and Outside Plant (OSP) technical training solutions for the North America Operations organization. Types of training could include TDM, Ethernet, SONET and DWDM systems Layer 1, 2 & 3, xDSL, Installation and Repair (I&R), and safety courses.

This Instructorprovides a broad range of training from entry level to highly technical and contribute technical expertise to the development, evaluation, and implementation of new development projects.

Job Description

  • Creates a culture of safety and customer service focus in all training initiatives.
  • Facilitates classroom, blended and virtual programs in support of current and evolving technologies.
  • Maintains awareness of the Employer technology roadmap to ensure readiness for new technology deployments and to be at the forefront of new and emerging technologies.
  • Maintains a positive learning environment and hold students accountable while being in accordance with union contracts and HR policies.
  • Evaluates effectiveness of training programs through formal and informal evaluation methods by reviewing team resources: including Level 1 feedback, facilitation observations, etc. and identifies, selects, or adapts training courses, tools, and/or training aides to intended audience.
  • Develops relationships with assigned internal customers to establish ongoing consideration of training effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Researches, analyzes, and recommends appropriate training programs. This may include making recommendations regarding modifications to the design of the material being provided.
  • Develops and upgrades training labs to support developed curriculum and maximize hands on learning opportunities.
  • Ensures materials for assigned courses remain updated and proactively initiates necessary modifications.
  • Provides leadership and expertise to peer technical trainers in the delivery and facilitation of training activities.
  • Interacts with management regarding the performance of participants, providing recommendations concerning areas of improvement and/or development opportunities.
  • Provides coaching and counseling to help employees apply new skills and knowledge on the job.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Strong Technical Aptitude, 4 - 8 years of relevant operations experience
  • 3-5 years of progressive professional experience supporting field processes and technologies for outside and/or inside plant.
  • Strong facilitation, presentation, coaching, influencing, problem solving, and communication.
  • Must possess strong attention to detail with excellent prioritization skills.
  • Must demonstrate excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize appropriately.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 2 - 4 years of related experience.
  • HR Learning & Development certifications desired.
  • Knowledge and understanding of Kirkpatrick, Agile methodologies, LEAN.

Education

Alternate Location: US-Arizona-Phoenix; US-Nevada-Las Vegas; US-Utah-Layton; US-Washington-Kent

job.title: SR LEAD SYSTEMS ENGINEER
job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. More customers. More network. More locations. More opportunities for you. With a global presence in 60 countries, service to more than 350 metro areas domestically, and more than 200,000 miles of fiber; Employer is going places. At Employer, we believe in growth and innovation, for ourcustomers and our employees. Discover how Employer can expand your potential and take your career to new places if youre looking to join a company that celebrates diversity and creativity, with industry-leading benefits and commitment to employee advancement. Were committed to bringing great talent to our team to help us change the world. One network connection at a time.

Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

The position:

We have an opening for an experienced Senior Lead Software Engineer to expand our team that is building our Cloud Marketplace. This person will work with internal teams and 3rd party vendors to add software solutions to the Marketplace, with a focus on building automated solutions that will deliver services to our end customers in a matter of minutes.

Job Description

Who we are:

Employer Cloud is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger Employer Corporation. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused dev/ops culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity. We build the cloud, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run. Every day. All the time. Its what we do.

Who we hire:

Just like everyone else, we want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Oh, yeah, they have to love to learn new things, too. On top of that, our ideal candidate also should have a passion for cloud computing and for creating applications and services that make developers lives easier while helping them create their enterprise-ready applications.

Limiting yourself to just one area of the technology stack would be unthinkable for this kind of developer, so we hope that you are comfortable doing everything from creating beautiful, friendly UIs, to crafting logical and easy to use APIs, all the way to writing distributed computing algorithms between applications running on entirely different clouds.

Since our teams operate in an extremely Agile culture, using a combination of XP and Kanban practices and processes, youd be encouraged to collaborate closely, deliver small pieces of working software frequently, work in pairs, write your code test first, and think about things like cycle time and WIP limits. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day.

Who you are:

Youre the type that gets things done and solves problems.You love coding and are passionate about learning new things and expanding your skills. You want to contribute, and hopefully, one day, create something that matters to you. You want freedom to code, without being interrupted by a crazy amount of meetings and interoffice bureaucracy. Youre a direct but open-minded communicator thats also transparent and kind. If youre laid back and appreciate an open door policy that means you can ask anyone anything this is the job for you.

Requirements (must have):

  • Well-versed in development and system administration.
  • Must havestrong Linux (there will be lots of time spent on a Linux command line) and windows systems experience
  • Good shell scripting experience.
  • Python, and Powershell programming.
  • Very strong experience with DevOps and Full Stack development.
  • Experience with configuration management automation (preferably through Ansible).
  • Any cloud experience (AWS, Azure, etc.) is considered a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills are an absolute must as this person will be communicating daily with partners and engineers through email, phone and web conferences.

Alternate Location: US-Missouri-St Louis

Requisition #: 161828

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at Employer style=\"color:black\">

job.title: Embedded Software Engineer (Entry-Level)
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Urbandale
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Embedded Software Engineer (Entry-Level) - 36862

Your Responsibilities

As an entry-level Embedded Software Engineer, for the John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG Urbandale), you will participate on a team to design and develop high quality software for high-tech precision agriculture products. In addition, you will:

  • Perform basic product design, testing and/or analysis work for a defined portion of a project
  • Operate in an Agile software development team, providing input to design solutions and participating in design reviews
  • Develop recommendations within established guidelines (work and decisions are reviewed by technical leads before implementation)

What Skills You Need

  • Experience with software product development gained through practical work experiences, relevant internships or academic experience
  • Experience working with C++ other Object-oriented languages
  • Experience in roles that required demonstration of excellent communication skills

What Makes You Stand Out

  • Experience and expertise with C++ (including modern C++ syntax, patterns, practices)
  • Experience in scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash, etc.)
  • Experience developing Linux software applications
  • Experience or training with multi-threaded systems
  • Experience using Qt, OpenGL, SQL, or GIS software libraries
  • Experience with Agile software development processes
  • Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and software test automation
  • Experience with UDP, TCP/IP, CAN networking communication protocols

Education (or equivalent work experience)

  • Bachelors of Science degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

Visa Sponsorship is NOT available for this position.

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Software Engineer Kelly IT Resources has teamed up with a growing company in the Cyber Security business looking to hire a Software Engineer to develop a SharePoint ERP site. Ideally looking for SharePoint experience but our client will consider individuals with any ERP development experience. Duties: Research, design, develop, and modify enterprise-wide systems or applications software, be involved in the planning of system and development deployment, and maintain responsibility for meeting software compliance standards. Evaluate the interface between hardware and software, operational requirements, and characteristics of the overall system. Test documents and maintain system corrections. Leverage the use and application of technical principles, theories, and concepts and develop solutions to routine technical problems of limited scope. Basic Qualifications: -2+ years of experience with SharePoint development or other ERP applications -2+ years of experience in C#/.NET -2+ years of experience with JavaScript, including JQuery or Angular, HTML, and CSS -Experience with designing and implementing business solutions in SharePoint -BA or BS degree Additional Qualifications: -Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure Cloud services -Ability to communicate effectively with a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders -Experience with using Agile tools, including JIRA, Confluence, and Microsoft Team Services. If this describes you, please apply today!! Why Kelly? With Kelly, youll have direct connections to leading IT organizations in the best companies around the globeoffering you the chance to work on some of todays most intriguing, innovative and high-visibility projects. In a field where change is the only constant, our connections and opportunities will help you take your career exactly where you want to go. We work with 95 of the Fortune 100 companies, and more than 9,000 IT hiring managers turn to us each year to access the best talent: people like you. Last year we found 10,000 opportunities for IT professionals. Let us help advance your career today. About Kelly Services As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to have a role in managing employment opportunities for more than one million workers around the globe. We employ 550,000 of these individuals directly with the remaining workers engaged through our talent supply chain network of supplier partners. Revenue in 2015 was $5.5 billion. Visit kellyservices.com and connect with us on Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter. Kelly Services is an equal opportunity employer including, but not limited to, Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity and is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.]]

job.minor_category0: [Information Technology] Business Systems Analyst And IT Consultant

job.title: Scala Developer (and more) - Dive into Big Data
job.description:
Do you thrive on the exploration of new technologies? Have you found joy in diving deep into an unfamiliar environment and technology and squeezing productive work out of it? Have you done solid work with Scala, Haskell, Clojure or another functional programming language and find yourself eager to keep doing that in a program that believes in experimentation, continuous improvement and personal growth?

Workstate seeks senior developers with 3+ years of experience in any of the above areas and 4+ overall years of technical experience.

You will be part of a team of five developers and QA automation engineers implementing a state of the art pipeline in big data technologies including Kafka, Spark, Flume and HBase. This is a program with the best and brightest in the industry. It is truly a rare environment in the big data or any other domain. You will not be limited to SQL-based analytics here.

You will work in a close-knit team based environment that promotes quality, personal development, and work-life balance above short-term profit. This is aided by a clear path for advancement that results in low turn-over for greater continuity.

This position is with our Columbus, OH office. We are located across from the North Market and close to Short North and Downtown / Arena District lunch and entertainment options. We have a team lunch every Friday where we share what we've been working on throughout the week and discuss new technology, tools and techniques that excite us.

This position is only available to US residents based in the continental US who are eligible to work for any employer without H-1B visa sponsorship or transfer.

Requirements

Technologies of interest include the following. The ideal candidate will have experience with some of these technologies but not necessarily all.

  • Hadoop
  • HDFS
  • HBase
  • Spark
  • Kafka
  • Scala
  • Clojure
  • Haskell
  • R

Experience working in an agile environment is also ideal.


General Attributes

  • Outstanding software development skills
  • Testing / debugging
  • Good written and verbal communication, including with non-technical people
  • Ability and interest to learn new technologies on the fly, as they become needed
  • The ability and interest to learn is one of our most desired attributes in a candidate. If you can demonstrate an aptitude to dig in up to your elbows and build experience in new technologies as you deliver projects utilizing those technologies successfully, your application will move to the top of the pile.

Benefits

Workstate is a technology consultancy with offices in Columbus OH, Pittsburgh PA, Los Angeles CA, Oakland CA and Seattle WA. We specialize in Website Design and Development, Application Development, Mobile Development, and Data Migrations.

Our clients range from growing medium-sized companies listed on Fast Company s Fast 50 to large corporations in the Fortune 500. Banks, telecoms, energy, education, non-profits, our clients and projects are diverse and interesting.

We are focused on long-term success over short term gain. This informs our strategy in selecting and servicing clients as well as team members. We are highly selective because we are committed for the long haul.

Our benefits package for salaried associates includes health, vision and dental insurance, vacation and sick leave immediately available on hire, and a retirement investment plan. We also have a kitchen stocked with snacks and drinks and plenty of coffee to go around.

What are you working forward to?
On our Call Center team, you'll ensure customers succeed and we'll do the same for you: through generous benefits, continuous learning and clear career progression. Because we know you have ambitions of your own. And our job is to help you achieve them.

Client Services Representative
As a Client Services Representative, you will provide quality service to clients and providers by accurately, effectively and consistently handling their telephone inquiries. You will review and analyze credit applications and credit bureau information in order to make credit decisions in compliance with credit policy guidelines. You will provide support for all customer account issues and will communicate processing decisions to clients/providers as well as resolve program/terminal hardware/software issues. You will resolve merchant issues by utilizing several different databases and software systems. You will analyze merchant terminal responses. You will determine when monetary adjustments are warranted and complete adjustments accordingly. You will cultivate and maintain positive relations with the merchant base.

Individuals who have strong negotiation and analytical skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated service-oriented mindset with high level of detail orientation, ability to multi task, excellent PC skills (internet and Microsoft Office), ability to handle sensitive, confidential information, and solid data entry skills preferred.

job.description:
Quality Systems Engineer Pay $40-50 per hour with enhanced benefits #KVETS4JJ Qualifications Experience/Knowledge Required: A minimum of BA/BS is required with a degree concentration preferably in the areas of Science/Technology. Knowledge of ISO and QSR regulations is required Experience with root cause investigation, change management, risk management and technical writing is required Experience in Quality Systems process development, support, integration or enhancement is required Experience in Quality Auditing and notified body inspections is required Strong communication, influencing and leadership skills: ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, and to interact with and influence cross-functional and cross-business teams to drive results is required Strong business acumen, interpersonal skills relating to teams with diverse cultures and business practices is required. Ability to analyze, graph, and present data in a way that facilitates and drives decision making. Strategic and tactical execution abilities, including strong organization skills is required. Experience/Knowledge preferred: Experience in working in a manufacturing / operations environment is preferred Experience with training or coaching others is preferred Experience in working in a manufacturing / operations environment is preferred Key Developmental Areas: Connect collaborates cross functionally, cross-company, and cross MD Sector Shape - defines critical deliverables to support quality, safety, and efficiency objectives Lead leverage analytics to drive product safety and timely Quality System management and reporting. Deliver achieve challenging timelines; drive long term outputs for Quality Systems improvement and efficiency. Summary of Assignment Oversee and manage the execution of Quality Systems (QS) at site level, including Nonconformances (NC), Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA), Internal Audit (IA) Observations, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigations, Product Quality Escalation, Quality Progress Review (QPR), Quality System Management Review (QSMR), and other assigned QS activities to ensure systems are effective and in compliance. Manage the performance and communication of QS metrics at site level. Ensure site readiness in the deployment of QS initiatives. Support compliance and document control areas, and continuous improvement of the Quality System. Key Responsibilities Responsible for the consistent and correct execution of QS procedures at the site to ensure the quality and compliance of processes and records for NC, CAPA, IA Observations, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigations, Product Quality Escalation, QPR and QSMR, Develops competency of resources at the site that execute NC, CAPA, IA Observations, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigations, Product Quality Escalation, QPR and QSMR, by providing training and guidance on the execution and documentation of these processes, Responsible for the timely and compliant execution of site NCs, CAPA, IA Observations, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigations, Product Quality Escalation, QPR and QSMR, by championing cross-collaboration across functions, sites, and operating companies; identifying barriers for the progress; and elevating issues for resolution, Supports on-site QPR and QSMR, including coordination, preparation, execution, and tracking of activities, Manages Product Quality Escalations for nonconformances or issues originating at the site, including the initiation, escalation, coordination, tracking, and closure of activities Manages on site the timely collection, escalation and reporting of all Quality System metrics to management Maintains original documentation for site NC, CAPA, IA Observations, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigations, Product Quality Escalation, QPR and QSMR as quality records, Identifies site needs to meet and improve system performance of NC, CAPA, IA Observation, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigation, Product Quality Escalation, QPR and QSMR at the site level, and escalates to appropriate representative and management in a timely manner, Collaborates with Franchise Quality in the deployment (design, implementation, and post-monitoring) of QS initiatives impacting the site that promote the continuous improvement of the QS and ensure continuity of the application of globally shared processes and systems at site level, Supports compliance activities by participating in audit readiness; assists in Internal and External audits; serves as Subject Matter Expert for NC, CAPA, IA Observation, Site Complaint Manufacturing Investigation, Product Quality Escalation, Document Control, QPR and QSMR processes during audits; job.title: Sr Program Operations Manager
job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. More customers. More network. More locations. More opportunities for you. With a global presence in 60 countries, service to more than 350 metro areas domestically, and more than 200,000 miles of fiber; Employer is going places. At Employer, we believe in growth and innovation, for ourcustomers and our employees. Discover how Employer can expand your potential and take your career to new places if youre looking to join a company that celebrates diversity and creativity, with industry-leading benefits and commitment to employee advancement. Were committed to bringing great talent to our team to help us change the world. One network connection at a time.

Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

Job Description

The Sr. Program Operations Manager demonstrates leadership in communicating business goals / programs / processes focused around improving effectiveness and efficiencies of the pre-sales support roles (Sales Engineering, Sales Operations and Sales Support Associates). The Pre-Sales PMO Sr. Program Operations Manager will leverage effectiveness and LSS best practices to solve problems, develop and execute objectives for self and others, and have the ability to effect short-term and some long-term business goals.The Sr. Program Operations Manager will support initiatives enabling the pre-sales support roles to achieve operational excellence in order to gain overall competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide leadership and direction to cross-functional team empowered to execute process best practices (ex. LSS, STM, PM) for data quality & process improvement.
  • Working with pre-sales, sales and supporting organizational leaders to understand productivity challenges, propose approaches, and implement changes to improve pre-sales support role effectiveness
  • Deliver breakthrough levels of improvement in process and role capability, reproducibility of designs and business processes to reduce data defects and attain world-class levels of quality through completion of effectiveness initiatives
  • Facilitate, train, and coach team members in the use of pre-sales PMO best practices
  • Work with operating leaders and teams to uncover and assess lean pre-sales support effectiveness and improvement opportunities
  • Communicate teams' progress to Champions and Business Leaders
  • Identify potential process improvement projects and lead Pre-Sales PMO programs through managing, planning, and monitoring key initiatives from conception through implementation
  • Support Pre-Sales PMO projects / programs including but not limited to the management of all program management activities, oversight for program schedules and key milestones, reporting of program status, issue management, change management and risk management

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Experience developing strategic project portfolios leveraging improvement best practices such as Lean Six Sigma, PMP best practices, etc.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and manage though challenges in a data driven approach.
  • Ability to prioritize projects, navigate challenges, and communicate changes and support needed.
  • Strong executive-level presentation skills.
  • Strong change management and coaching skills.
  • Strong analytical ability.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence and build a collaborative environment.
  • Previous Sales/SE & Project / Program Management knowledge
  • Mix of pre-sales and post-sales experience
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem solving skills
  • Excellent leadership, mentoring, and coaching skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills as well as negotiation, coordination, organization, facilitation, and conflict management skills

Education and Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent education and experience. Typically with 5-7 years related experience
  • 2+ years previous manager level leadership experience preferred.
  • Certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt is a plus
  • Sales, Sales Operations, Order Management experience is a plus
  • Telecommunications experience
  • PMP Certification desirable but not required

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Broomfield; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Missouri-St Louis; US-Texas-Dallas

Requisition #: 167913

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at Employer style=\"color:black\">

job.title: Senior Web / Cloud Developer
job.description:
Vanguard, one of the world s largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks career-oriented individuals for experienced Software Engineers.

Vanguard IT resources are central to the success of our business goals. IT resources work on meaningful and impactful projects. We have pride in what we do and know we are making a difference to Vanguard investors.

We believe that IT is a trusted partner that:

  • Delights clients and prospects through exceptional technology-based experiences,
  • Helps business partners envision possibilities and reach their goals through innovative solutions that drive Vanguard s core purpose,
  • Enables Vanguard to be a best place to work and, is driven by a highly engaged and effective workforce.

The latest methodologies and IT practices are used

  • Lean Scrum/Agile and Kanban Project Management Processes
  • Test Driven Development and Automated Testing, Unit, Regression, Performance, Application Vulnerability
  • Continuous Delivery
  • Ideation and Innovation

Vanguard IT uses the latest technologies and programming languages

Web Technologies

Java, JavaScript, and AngularJS

MEAN stack

Test tools: JUnit, Protractor, Jasmine, Cucumber

C++

PHP, Rails, Grails, and Django frameworks

Visual Basic .NET

Mobile Technologies

Adobe AIR

Java (Android)

Objective-C, Swift

Capability Technologies

Source Code Repository: Bitbucket & GIT, Subversion & Tortoise SVN

Continuous Integration: Jenkins

Build Pipeline: Bamboo

CachingLocal: EhCache, Gemfire

Runtime Environment: tcServer, Pivotal Cloud Foundry to host Spring Boot Apps Running Embedded Tomcat

Requirements: Cucumber

Document Management: Confluence

Project Management: JIRA/JIRA Agile

Other Technologies

DB2 and IDAA, Exadata

COBOL, Easytrieve , JCL, MQ Series

Hadoop Spark

Java on the Host

Matlab

Oracle PL/SQL

Perl, Python

R

SAS

Scala

SQL

Unix/Linux, Shell Scripting

We are a digital first company that invests significantly on technology to achieve our business goals. Vanguard s growth has led to an increased need for talented software engineers and technology leaders.

The prospective candidates:

  • will have an opportunity to join a team that is highly collaborative and is staunched in finding innovative solutions to business problems, and
  • will join a team that build products and solutions for the Retail and Advisory business in one or more of the following:
  • Web development
  • Mobi Apps
  • Data Analytics & Client Insights
  • Business Process Automation
  • Digital Transformation for all client contacts
  • Gaining operational efficiency

We have invested heavily in the following architecture and the prospective candidate will join a team that uses these paradigms to meet business imperatives:

  • Client Side Architecture using Angular JS and REST
  • Spring Framework
  • Reactive Principles
  • Cloud Native Applications
  • DevOps and Continuous Delivery
  • Distributed applications and microservices

We are looking for highly motivated and passionate candidates to join a full stack team that will deliver business outcomes rapidly, drive process changes, standardization of tools and establish best practices and join a team that has a culture of embracing change and dynamic as we go through the large scale transformation in Vanguard IT. Most project teams follow agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban; some are adopting LEAN principles.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of five years software engineering and developer experience
  • Excellent problem solving skills and willingness to work with others is essential
  • High aptitude and very strong analytical skills

Advanced knowledge in one or more of the following tools and programming languages:

  • Java stack of technologies
  • REST and Jersey
  • Spring Framework
  • Distributed Caching Framework
  • Node JS
  • Unit Testing Frameworks such jUnits, Protractor Jasmine etc.
  • Automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Collaboration tools such as Cucumber
  • Design patterns and Software engineering principles such as SOLID and Domain Driven Design

Below are some of the qualifications that are preferred

  • Very strong written, oral and interpersonal communications skills
  • Knowledge of Financial services industry
  • Emergent Technologies and FinTech

Vanguard does not provide sponsorship for this role.

job.title: Senior Developer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Illinois (US-IL) - Milan
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Senior Developer - 33645

Your Responsibilities

As a Senior Developer for John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG), you will serve as Tech Lead for the team and develop software, testing or related analysis for a product which will interface with other customer facing applications. You will operate within an Agile team and participate in all aspects of the team s work. In addition you will:

  • Work on Java, Scala, Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies and Big Data concepts.
  • Establish guidelines such as coding standards, workflow, or tool standards.
  • Perform hands-on code development and delivery and ensure that coding standards, patterns and approaches are appropriate, consistent and of high quality.
  • Be considered an expert within the team on tools and technology in use.
  • Provide guidance to other team members for designing solutions and coding practices within the team.
  • Work with junior and peer members of the team by pairing, coaching and review.
  • Assist the development team in breaking out technical tasks from business requirements.
  • Lead new technology adoption for betterment of product reliability.
  • Provide input into the product development strategy and roadmaps as needed.

*** U.S. visa sponsorship is NOT available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • Four or more years of experience in designing and developing web applications using languages Java/J2EE or Scala.
  • Experience with Spring or Play frameworks, HTML5 and JavaScript.
  • Experience developing in RESTful web services.
  • Experience writing unit and integration test.
  • Experience building automation/deployment jobs using Jenkins or other similar CI/automation tools.

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Experience building large scale applications using Scala, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Node.js.
  • Experience with Agile processes and Extreme Programming (XP) practices (such as: Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Delivery).

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Arts/Science in a Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other relevant discipline other relevant discipline.

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

job.title: Senior Infrastructure Architect Advisor
job.description:
Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Senior Infrastructure Architect Advisor to provide the vision, strategic direction, and initiative roadmap for enterprise-wide, transformational, technology imperatives. To define the reference and implementation Architectures for enterprise-wide, transformational, technology imperatives. To persuade and influence senior Business and Information Technology (IT) leaders on the architectural direction for enterprise-wide, transformational, technology imperatives.

Duties and Responsibilities

1. Provides the architectural leadership in shaping enterprise-wide, transformational, technology imperatives, which focus on both Business of IT (e.g., ITaaS) and firm-wide, business technology initiatives (e.g., Digital Business), critically dependent on emerging technology.

2. Continuously pursues expert-level technical acumen:

  • Establishes working relationships with strategic and boutique technology providers.
  • Leverages knowledge capital available through subscription research services.
  • Leverages the Internet as a critical resource for related knowledge capital, inclusive of blogs, podcasts, webinar, etc.
  • Attends conferences and engages in associated activities (e.g., conducting presentations, leading workshops, etc).
  • Consumes and contributes content from and to Open Source communities.

3. Defines reference and implementation architectures.

4. Produces technology roadmaps in support of IT s vision and strategy.

5. Develops proof-of-concept prototypes and initial implementation models.

6. Monitors implementation activity to ensure architecture and design principles are upheld.

7. Ensures implementation solutions support architecture objectives (e.g., availability, scalability, performance, security, etc.), as appropriate.

8. Participates in governance team discussions and provides a strong voice on critical decisions.

9. Communicates complex technical concepts effectively to a broad group of stakeholders.

10. Establishes relationships with senior IT leaders, architects, and technical specialists for the purpose of advancing proposed architectural solutions.

11. Coaches and mentors more junior enterprise architects.

12. Utilizes general understanding of the competitive landscape and corporate and business unit strategies to provide context for architectural decision making.

13. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.
  • Minimum eight years relevant work experience.

Special Factors
Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

job.title: Associate Director, SDTM Programming
job.description:
Pharmacyclics is committed to the development and commercialization of novel therapies intended to improve the quality and duration of life and to resolve serious unmet medical needs for cancer patients. Pharmacyclics is a wholly-owned subsidiary of AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV), a global, research-based biopharmaceutical company. Oncology is a key therapeutic area for AbbVie, with a portfolio consisting of three marketed products and a pipeline containing multiple promising new molecules that are being studied in more than 200 clinical trials for over 20 different types of cancer.

More than 1,200 Pharmacyclics and AbbVie research scientists, clinicians, marketing, operations and corporate professionals work in the San Francisco Bay Area. They combine their expertise in immuno-oncology, stem cells, and cell-signaling with their knowledge of bispecific antibodies, antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), and covalent-inhibitor technologies to discover and develop novel cancer treatments. Together, we are striving to outsmart cancer.
Pharmacyclics is seeking for an Associate Director, SDTM Programming.
General Position Summary/Purpose:
Responsible for the planning and tracking the Standard Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Programming staff and CRO activities
Manage and coordinate the SDTM Programming staff to ensure efficient use of the resource and work flow
W orks collaboratively with Data Management and Biostatistics and Programming personnel to establish Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and standardized tools to maximize efficiencies across Biometrics and to facilitate the creation and maintenance of high quality standardized datasets.
Key Accountabilities/Core Job Responsibilities:
  • Manage SDTM programming activities.
Address SDTM resourcing to adequately staff projects as needed
Conduct CDISC Standardization activities for clinical research projects from study start-up through submission to regulatory agencies.
Develop and maintain standardized SDTM migration programming procedures to create quality SDTM compliant SAS datasets and Define.xml documents in concordance with relevant versions
Coordinate with the management team in Statistical Programming Department in the build and maintenance of an internal SDTM global standard library.
Provide leadership and training on implementing SDTM standards.
Ensure review of applicable project deliverables (e.g., protocol, case report forms, annotated case report forms, database structure, and statistical analysis plan) for consistency with data standards and consistency of application.
Responsible for SDTM compliance and validation using current software accepted by the FDA (e.g., OpenCDISC, Pinnacle 21)
Ensure effective communication and collaboration with other functional groups impacted by data standards
Work collaboratively with team members across departments to produce quality deliverables in a timely fashion within an agreed project timeline and budget.
Assist with development and maintenance of optimal strategies (standard programming routines and utilities) to increase productivity and quality, while decreasing cycle times and costs.
Supervise SDTM programmers in the performance of their duties.
Establish career development plan, including goals and objectives, for assigned personnel.
Provide performance feedback and conduct performance reviews for assigned personnel.
Report performance deficiencies and corrective action recommendations to management.
Mentor and coach personnel regarding client/customer communications, work planning/priority setting, and problem-solving regarding programming issues
Perform administrative management activities including
o Assist in the development of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and standard documents related to the implementation of data standards
o Assure adherence to Pharmacyclics policies and standard operating procedures including performance of all necessary validation and documentation to assure high quality deliverables
o Ensure that personnel are trained and compliant with Pharmacyclics SOPs, computer systems, and applicable regulatory requirements
Qualifications:

job.title: Implementation Project Manager - UCC - Broomfield, CO
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

The UCC Implementation Project Manager III has a full competency on systems, advance technical competency on products/network, advanced consultative skills, sales/management background. Responsible for implementing enterprise level/complex solutions for UCC customers. With direction, leads implementation project team including customer contacts with regards to account set up, branding, customization, and number ordering, and capacity assurance.

Job Description

  • Effectively uses internal systems and tools to manage setup and branding of all product features and configuration of capabilities. Requires detailed knowledge of unique internally designed tools, and excellent attention to details to avoid negative impacts or omissions.
  • Manages the weekly implementation meetings and onboarding of customer solutions, using Microsoft Project and/or a project activity log, to fully implement and customize solutions per customer requirements. Includes Audio, Web, Video and On-Net network solutions. Includes managing projects for new customers and enhancements/changes for existing customers to maximize revenue.
  • Quality checks requirements, places orders, and configures third party services (i.e. WebEx, Web Meeting, Blue Jeans, Lync, Event Studio, Wallet cards, etc. Manages frequent updates and termination of same services.
  • Provides consultation on solution options to sales staff and customers. Must continually enhance level of knowledge with constantly developing products. Serves as liaison with internal resources to facilitate technical designs/communications to implement the most efficient and cost effective solutions for Level 3 and the customers. Develops, documents, and communicates processes for team effectiveness as well as Sales staff and customers.
  • Participates on product development teams to ensure customer provisioning requirements, processes and internal system integration limitations/requirements are accommodated in the new product development projects. Provides expertise to design workable solutions for internal and external customers. Also acts as a liaison to Product Management and Sales Engineering for development of existing product enhancements.
  • Investigates customer issues to determine root cause being production flaws or configuration settings. Communicates with internal resources, Sales, and customers directly.

Qualifications

Experience

  • 7+ yrs

Education

  • Education Level:Bachelor's Degree
  • Field of Study:Project Management, Business

Other Job Requirements

  • Sales, Account Management, and or Project Management experience. Minimum 3 years experience with UCC Services, thorough knowledge of Employer UCC service offerings.
  • Familiarity with Employer UCC functional area processes.
  • Working knowledge of Employer UCC internal systems, such as CIS/Client Mgr, Rules RAAG, Ready-Access, Pactolus, etc.
  • Knowledge of IPVPN, VoIP. Knowledge of SIP and WebEx a plus.
  • Exceptional verbal and written skills. Must be able to effectively communicate details to customers. Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Strong Attention to detail required. Must be able to multi-task and manage fast paced environment and work load.
  • Presentation skills. Comfortable with small to medium size audiences.
  • Strong computer skills: Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel a must. Microsoft Project experience desirable.
  • Technical attitude required.

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Broomfield

job.title: Release Engineer II (DevOps)
job.description:
Release Engineer

The Opportunity

We're looking for driven and talented software engineers with a passion for everything needed to operate a sophisticated SaaS product. As a Release Engineer at Marketo, you will help with the continued automation of build & deployment processes, participate in scheduled releases, develop tools to improve scalability and reliability, while incorporating new technologies and requirements. In the coming months, Marketo will begin the migration from our own data centers to Google Cloud Platform. The Release Engineering Team will be an integral part of this transformation which will require significant tooling changes and implementation of technologies such as Kubernetes and Ansible.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and configure C.I. using Jenkins and related tools
  • Manage multiple code repositories, helping with branching and tagging at both tactical and strategic levels
  • Develop best in class tools to support scalability and reliability
  • Improve and evolve the build, release and deployment processes in support of Marketo's diverse product platform
  • Evolve existing processes to support the move to GCP
  • Interface with engineering and production groups

Required Skills / Experience:

  • 2+ years of related work experience, including working with cloud technology
  • B.S. Degree or higher studies in Engineering or Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
  • Proficient with bash/Ruby/Python or comparable scripting languages
  • Build and release experience of SaaS products running in LAMP or similar technology stack
  • Experience with DevOps tools like Jenkins and Artifactory
  • SCM proficiency using SVN and Git
  • Knowledge of *nix OSes, concepts, tools, shells, etc.
  • Exposure to relational databases and SQL desirable
  • Excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proven ability to be a productive and flexible team member in a fast-paced environment

Marketo is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job.title: BI Solutions Architect-Open location
job.description:
Support the design and development of CH2M s Program Performance Portal application and other custom applications for our clients in delivering some of the world s most complex programs.
As a business solutions expert, you will be part of a team focused on developing applications and tools required for collection, integration, analysis and presentation of business information to support better business decisions. Working independently, and with other team members in a consulting environment, and with internal and external clients, you will design and develop solutions required to deliver some of the world s most complex programs. In addition to supporting the evolution of the Performance Portal, you will design and develop new software applications and/or major enhancements to existing software applications to support the clients business requirements and technical environment. The successful candidate will act as a recognized technology thought leader and industry expert.
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Provide technical consulting on complex projects.
  • Design information management solution(s) that must consider a variety of IT and business-related planning issues.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of information solution/system implementations supporting a broad array of business processes.
  • Provide consulting expertise in conducting and gathering functional requirements and translating these into technical solutions.
  • Work with program management teams to define business and system requirements in order to ensure successful completion by meeting client needs on budget and schedule.
  • Establish clear lines of communication with project team and client to ensure project deliverables meet defined quality standards.
  • Provide consulting expertise in design, development and implementation of IT architectures.
  • Provide technical input and support to CH2M business development teams as required.
  • Identify additional performance metrics and applications to enhance or supplement existing tools.
This role can be performed from any of our US offices or by telework. If you re up for the challenge and want to deliver innovative, unique and unexpected solutions, join our team and help us successfully deliver some of the world s most challenging programs.

The minimum qualifications for this position are:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Math, or Engineering or an additional 4 years experience
  • 15 years work experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experienced designing, developing, deploying, maintaining, and supporting web applications and implementing innovative technical solutions in a consulting environment or as a Consultant.
  • Thrives working both independently and collaborative with a remote team.
  • Strong data management, analytical and technical troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving, design, development and debugging skills.
  • Ability to work independently or within a team to meet aggressive deadlines.
  • Skilled in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS with a working knowledge of responsive design techniques for multiple platforms.
  • Experience developing modern web applications using frameworks and other client-side libraries, e.g. Backbone, React, Angular.
  • Knowledgeable in MVC, MVVM, and other software development patterns.
  • Demonstrated web design and UI/UX experience.
  • Experience with a variety of hardware, software, networks, and operating systems.
  • Strong can-do attitude.
  • Adept at recognizing client needs and coordinating/executing activities that respond directly to these needs.
  • Experience working with clients to define requirements, develop estimates for the level of effort, scheduling milestones and releases

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:In addition to the Basic Qualifications, the ideal candidate will have demonstrated expertise working on a wide variety of software development projects including web/cloud-based and mobile business solutions and underlying technologies. The successful candidate will possess strong technical troubleshooting skills and excellent problem-solving, design, development and debugging skills in a software development capacity. Additional areas of benefit include broad experience in use and development of Geographic Information Systems and developing Business Intelligence solutions including reports and dashboards.
At CH2M, the greatest challenges provide the biggest rewards. Each day, your drive and creative ideas will be providing solutions that help build a better tomorrow. Whether it is the pride that comes with accomplishment, personal growth or making a difference in the world, you will discover true success in a career that brings out the best in you at CH2M. Ready? Let s get to work. Developing People through Challenging Projects CH2M is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.
CH2M will not sponsor a work visa such as a H1-B to fill this position.
CH2M is an Equal Opportunity Employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

job.title: Manager IT Strategic Sourcing
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Responsible and accountable for the proper creation and execution of key outsourcing contracts and ensuring adherence to financial, operational, and legal standards. Creates and maintains a best in class governance team which delivers IT Solutions, while meeting the changing needs of Employer business. This position will have a direct impact on efficiencies by establishing and maintaining quality service provider relationships via defined processes, contract requirements and oversight practices.

Job Description

  • Creates and delivers solutions to bring best practices to sourcing for IT initiatives. Works with IT teams to elicit their requirements for sourcing.
  • Develops and implements program and profit/negotiation strategy to achieve best price and/or enhancement consideration with suppliers, supporting the specific needs of the client.
  • Develops, tracks, and manages vendor performance and metrics, including over 300 SLAs.
  • Manages contract audits and/or benchmarking activities to establish appropriate corrective and preventative actions for any significant contract or program related issues.
  • Manages IT Asset Management best practices and policies to drive integration, improvements, and content compliance/ accuracy in order for critical data to be available throughout the company.
  • Defines, implements, and continuously improves operational core competencies and processes with a focus on success and customer satisfaction through the implementation of metrics to ensure daily operations meet all customer and division requirements in a predictable and repeatable manner.
  • Pursues cost reduction through cross functional management of metrics, processes, reduced rework, reduced cycle time, etc. while fully achieving objectives.
  • Understands and applies disciplined root cause analysis techniques and designs and employs detailed monthly operations reviews that are dependent on an appropriate metric set to ensure fast, steady progress in operations performance and continuous improvements.
  • Liaises and promotes collaboration with all other functional elements of the business, specifically including IT operations, IT development/ test, and the PMO to drive service delivery to meet customer, system, and cost requirements. Leads the prioritization and work efforts for the vendor teams.
  • Manages escalations and disputes with the vendors and Employer business units to ensure focus on successful delivery and budget within the terms of the contract.
  • Develops and manages budget plans including tracking monthly charges, credits, and forecasts Provides input to annual budget planning.
  • Develops and implements tools, reports and processes to assist in the successful management of outsourcing agreements.
  • Ensures vendor compliance with all corporate policies and procedures, including SOX and security requirements.
  • Supports all sourcing negotiations and re-negotiations directly with vendors, in collaboration with procurement, legal, finance, HR, and risk management. Leads negotiations for any updates and changes to existing terms.
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Required

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Subject matter expertise in the Outsourcing and /or Offshoring industry (3+ years)
  • Understanding of Vendor landscape
  • Ability to interact at all levels of the business and vendor organizations
  • IT Development and Operations experience (10 years)
  • Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements
  • Exemplifies critical thinking, troubleshooting and strong analytical skills
  • Experience managing to and interpreting Contracts
  • Basic accounting and experience managing large budgets
  • Excellent written and verbal skills, ability to create and present proposals to Leaders (5 years)

Preferred

  • Experience with large-scale outsourcing contract management
  • Previous experience negotiating and transitioning an organization to a sourced or offshore model (2 years)
  • Ability to travel 10-20%

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Denver; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Nebraska-Omaha; US-Utah-Salt Lake City

job.title: Program Senior Analyst - R&D
job.description:
Pharmacyclics is committed to the development and commercialization of novel therapies intended to improve the quality and duration of life and to resolve serious unmet medical needs for cancer patients. Pharmacyclics is a wholly-owned subsidiary of AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV), a global, research-based biopharmaceutical company. Oncology is a key therapeutic area for AbbVie, with a portfolio consisting of three marketed products and a pipeline containing multiple promising new molecules that are being studied in more than 200 clinical trials for over 20 different types of cancer.

More than 1,200 Pharmacyclics and AbbVie research scientists, clinicians, marketing, operations and corporate professionals work in the San Francisco Bay Area. They combine their expertise in immuno-oncology, stem cells, and cell-signaling with their knowledge of bispecific antibodies, antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), and covalent-inhibitor technologies to discover and develop novel cancer treatments. Together, we are striving to outsmart cancer.
Pharmacyclics is seeking for a Program Sr. Analyst - R&D
General Position Summary/Purpose:
Pharmacyclics is seeking a IT R&D Sr. Operations Analyst who will play a critical role in R&D client engagements and in core operational activities for the IT R&D projects.

Accomplishes objectives by designing and monitoring the planning, configuration, and deployment of our Clinical Trials Management System (CTMS), Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS), Quality Management Systems and other systems in support of associated core R&D functions and processes. This resource will be the Technical Lead for above systems and will collaborate closely with various R&D Business functions, other IT resources, IT Infrastructure, Project Management, vendors, end users and QA and IT Validation groups .
Strong GxP knowledge, and technical, organization, analytical and communication skills are key to successful performance in this position, which is under the direction of the IT R&D Clinical Apps Manager, who provides leadership on each client engagement.
Core Job Responsibilities:
  • Technical Lead for GxP applications such as LIMS, CTMS, MasterContol and other similarly classified IT R&D applications
  • Work closely with Clinical Apps Manager of IT & R&D Applications to lead initiatives to improve IT R&D effectiveness and efficiency
  • Responsible for maintaining the validated state of IT R&D applications to ensure compliance to regulatory standards
  • Leading a team of staff including programmers, analysts, and support specialists
  • Selection and procurement of appropriate hardware and software
  • Implementing and managing security or integrity and backup procedures
  • Identify the criticality of selected application functions and the expected service level goals for application operations and support
  • Identify the priority of IT R&D support and project requests that impact the system
  • Knowledge of validation lifecycle of GxP computerized systems.
  • Ability to develop solutions to complex problems that require a high degree of ingenuity, creativity, and innovation within the boundaries of industry compliance regulation.
  • Consulting computer users to ascertain needs and to ensure that facilities meet user or project requirements
  • Ensuring corporate software licensing policies and procedures are followed
  • Guide IT R&D as Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the event of Regulatory Audits and Inspections
  • Testing and modifying systems to ensure that that they operate reliably
  • Provide expertise in technologies such as SQL, SharePoint solutions, advanced InfoPath design, Workflows, and web programming languages such as HTML, CSS, XML, Visual Basic, and Java.
  • Oversee R&D administration and operational support including user and security management.
  • Responsible for timely closure of IT R&D Exception Reports, CAPAs and Deviations
  • Responsible for review and approval of vendor agreements
  • Participate in troubleshooting, root cause analysis and impact assessment of R&D production computer applications
Other Skills:
  • Familiar with drug discovery, translational medicine, and the regulatory submissions process
  • Experienced with Enterprise wide LIMS/ CTMS/ QMS implementation and support
  • Familiar with Computer System Validation and the Change Control Process in Life sciences industry
  • Should be comfortable working with Business Owners, QA, and users across the organization and with differing levels of technical expertise
  • Advanced understanding of relational databases, database programming skills and tools
  • Strong understanding of the SDLC and Computer System Validation (CSV) and current technology platforms and trends
  • Expected to deliver documentation and training with all solutions
  • Ability to plan and coordinate multiple simultaneous application efforts
  • Quick learner, Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong technical skills
  • The ability to work well under pressure
  • Attention to detail
  • Self-starter / tenacious problem solver / highly motivated
  • Ability to take projects from design to long-term maintenance
  • Ability to work on a team or independently
  • Management and leadership capability
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills
Qualifications, Experience, and Education Requirements (degree, certifications, etc.):
  • Minimum of 8 to 10 years' experience as a IT R&D Analyst, well-versed with SDLC & iterative systems development methodologies, in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry.
  • Strong experience on relational databases, database programming skills and tools
  • Technical Expertise on SAS/SQL is highly preferred.
  • Strong knowledge of information systems & workflows for processes related to ClinOps, Medical Affairs, CDM, Biostatistics, Clinical Science, and Informatics.
  • Responsible for maintaining the validated state of IT R&D applications to ensure compliance to regulatory standards
  • Working knowledge of FDA, EMA regulations such as Annex 11, 21 CFR Part 11, Part 210, 211; Computer Systems Validation and GAMP framework.
  • Familiar with electronic ticketing and document management systems such as: Service NOW, Track wise, SharePoint and Microsoft Projects
  • Well-developed business partnering & collaboration skills, adept at establishing & sustaining effective working relationships, both within & between departments.
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills, with the ability to interact with business users, technical IT groups, project managers, senior management, outsourced service providers, and vendors.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a matrix environment; team player yet able to work independently with minimal direction.
  • Education Minimum BA or BS in relevant life science or computer science required. Advanced degree preferred.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled
