job.title: LEAD PROJECT MANAGER
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Develops, plans and manages implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for external/internal customers.

Job Description

Employer has an immediate need for a Lead Project Managerwith the Governance team, whose responsibilities include ensuringthat IT and business unit needs are fully aligned with the companys primary objectives while improving collaboration and strategic partnerships. This position is responsible for processing all IT intake for new efforts, managing the approval, prioritizationand Business Case process for IT investment work, Run the Business (RTB)requests, business case metrics reporting to all business units, and performing after action reviews for targeted programs.

  • Responsible for budget and expense control forprogram and strategic alignment of program to business unit objectives.
  • Analyzes work plans and schedules.
  • Develops methodologies, procedures, and systems to produce financial reporting.
  • Acts asprogram team leader for material change to programs after approval.
  • Developsprogress and status reports.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the companys IT investment budget is applied to system enhancements that align to corporate strategic initiatives and provide the highest return on investment.
  • Manage the companys business case approval process for IT investments while complying with corporate Finance approval standards and guidelines.
  • Lead regular meetings between cross-functional business and IT teams to review new IT program requests (intake), assess business purpose and benefits, and ultimately determine overall business priority.
  • Conduct financial after action reviews on targeted IT programs and present those findings to IT/Business Governance Director and senior management.
  • Analyze program worthiness by comparing financial metric information such as Net Present Value, Payback, Internal Rate of Return and others.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of the tactical and strategic business objectives of the company and be able to effectively communicate these to all levels.
  • Enhance the flow of information and communication across multiple organizational boundaries.
  • Demonstrate leadership to identify programs at risk and work with business and IT teams to mitigate with minimal budget and schedule impacts.
  • Lead ad hoc meetings between business and IT to expedite issue resolution and enable faster solution delivery.
  • Display basic knowledge and understanding of Software Development Lifecycle methodologies, concepts and best practices.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • 6 - 8 years of related experience.
  • PMP Certification or equivalent preferred.
  • Minimum of five years of program & portfolio management or IT Management experience.
  • Fundamental knowledge of financial principles such as NPV, Payback, IRR, ROI and others.
  • Minimum of three years experience coordinating and/supporting IT business processes.
  • Experience managing program schedules, budgets and communications.
  • Ability to negotiate and reach agreements between business organizations and IT.
  • Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
  • Ability to solve complex problems through analytical approach.

job.title: Data Analyst
job.description:
To lead and implement department reporting solutions for resource planning and analysis of department scorecard metrics. Analyzes data and leads efforts to implement process enhancements that improve operational efficiency for the business.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develops robust project management system-based reporting solutions for ad-hoc and/or repeating requests. Completes analysis of the information and makes data driven recommendations to support department management and leadership including ongoing projects, staffing model, and annual planning.
  • Monitors, forecasts and analyzes department-wide resource demands. Partners with management to provide timely, data-driven staffing recommendations, using sophisticated statistical methods to ensure the department can accommodate the project demand and facilitates prioritization of projects when necessary.
  • Serves as technical system expert for project management system and primary relationship manager with the vendor for any system updates or enhancements. Establishes good working relationships with system users across the organization.
  • Independently or collaboratively builds or enhances department system workflows including documenting requirements, designing, testing, and elevating enhanced workflows to the production environment.
  • Creates and maintains effective channels and mechanisms for reporting, including but not limited to standardized reports, department dashboards, scorecards, and power point presentations, to enable department decision making on resource capacity and utilization.
  • Works with peers to develop reporting solutions of moderate to high complexity to meet department metrics, reporting, workflow, and automation needs in accordance with development standards. Develops an in-depth understanding of various demand channels and partner needs.
  • Provides management with regular updates on the progress of projects and capacity projections. Creates and delivers presentations on the status of the operation as needed. Lead the meetings for cross-departmental project team members.
  • Engages with other technical system experts across the organization to maintain a best in class data collection plan with monitors and controls to sustain accurate and reliable data throughout the system.
  • Seeks out opportunities to improve business analytic capabilities to inform continuous improvements in operational efficiency.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience developing reports in financial services and IIG preferred.
  • Proficient knowledge of Sharepoint and the ability to update and upload information.
  • Advanced knowledge of current versions of the Microsoft Office Suite including VBA and Excel.
  • Experience using one or more of the following data sources: MINITAB, Cognos 8, Tableau.
  • Strong, demonstrated analysis and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong planning and organizational skills.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently with attention to detail, while managing multiple tasks.

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Urbandale
Function: Data Science & Analytics
Title: Data Scientist - 37004

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for data collection, data transformation, and analysis to support ISG's advanced engineering team. In addition, you will:

  • Support on-farm field research of various internal teams and conduct statistical analysis of the research results
  • Create and implement algorithms which manage the data to enable it to be analyzed in an efficient manner to support the agronomic validation and verification analysis process
  • Support the communication of derived insights, especially through appropriate visualization techniques
  • Support the identification of the required data sources and work with ata Wranglers and/or IT to implement methodologies to retrieve and use this data
  • Stay abreast of the latest appropriate analytical techniques and recommend these where needed

U.S. visa sponsorship is NOT available for the role.

What Skills You Need

  • 1 or more years of experience with Python or ArcPy
  • 1 or more years of experience with GIS analysis
  • Experience conducting analysis and developing models in R or SAS
  • Ability to travel up to 30% (sometimes on short notice to respond to field conditions)

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Experience working in AWS
  • Experience in analyzing data from on-farm field trials

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Agronomy, or other Earth Sciences

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

job.title: User Experience Researcher
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Urbandale
Function: Product Engineering
Title: User Experience Researcher - 36607

Your Responsibilities

As a User Experience (UX) Researcher for John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG) located in Urbandale, IA, you will work across ISG UX teams to support our User Experience metrics strategy, including the System Usability Scale (SUS), for Precision Ag Technologies. In addition, you will:

  • Perform subjective and objective research both qualitatively and quantitatively, to gather deep end-user understanding.
  • Provide support to the UX Research Lead to help maintain the integrity of the metrics database, appropriately design statistical controls to filter out biases in data collection, and provide insights and feedback to product teams.
  • Provide guidance or input regarding metrics strategy and support integrated solutions in tracking, analyzing, and reporting findings to product teams in this space.

*** U.S. visa sponsorship is NOT available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • Two or more years of experience planning and conducting concept validation activities such as usability tests, interviews, focus groups, and contextual inquiry.
  • Two or more years of research or practical experience collecting user data, including the methodology design, statistical analysis, and interpretation of the results.
  • Two or more years of experience applying basic, theoretical Human Factors and/or Human-Computer Interaction principles to complex engineering problems to create innovative solutions with an intentional User Experience.
  • Two or more years of experience using statistical software packages tailored to the behavioral sciences (e.g. regression, ANOVA, modeling).

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • One or more years of experience applying Human Factors and/or Human-Computer Interaction principles in the Agriculture, Heavy Machinery, or Transportation industries.
  • Experience analyzing and providing insights using the System Usability Scale (SUS) metrics to product engineering groups.
  • Experience researching and measuring the user experience of digital products (web, mobile, app).
  • Experience with user-centered design principles and practices.
  • Experience working with multi-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, and business leaders.
  • Experience communicating research design, analysis, and results to a broad range of stakeholders (e.g., technical reports, conference proceedings, and peer reviewed articles).
  • Experience contributing to basic research in the field of Human Factors and/or Human-Computer Interaction.
  • Experience creating statistical tests to control for common behavioral biases and providing recommendations towards trends, study design, and design.

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Arts/Science in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Cognitive Psychology, Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related field.
  • Master s degree strongly preferred in any of the following: Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Cognitive Psychology, Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related field.

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

job.title: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Risk Analyst
job.description:
PwC/LOS Overview
PwC is a network of firms committed to delivering quality in assurance, tax and advisory services.

We help resolve complex issues for our clients and identify opportunities. Learn more about us at www.pwc.com/us.

At PwC, we develop leaders at all levels. The distinctive leadership framework we call the PwC Professional (Employer provides our people with a road map to grow their skills and build their careers. Our approach to ongoing development shapes employees into leaders, no matter the role or job title.

Are you ready to build a career in a rapidly changing world? Developing as a PwC Professional means that you will be ready
- to create and capture opportunities to advance your career and fulfill your potential. To learn more, visit us at www.pwc.com/careers.

PwC Advisory helps our clients with their most challenging imperatives from strategy through execution. We combine the breadth of knowledge of over 48,000 global professionals with deep industry knowledge to deliver custom solutions for our clients. We work with the world's largest and most complex companies and understand the unique business issues and opportunities our clients face.

Job Description
PricewaterhouseCoopers is committed to a global sourcing strategy that leverages the strength of our worldwide network.

Our Advisory Global Sourcing and Delivery (GSD) model is a set of capabilities resident outside our core US practice that supports us in performing client service activities anywhere in the world, where the appropriate mix of talent and knowledge is available at the best value. Working together with our client service engagement teams, we tailor a plan that combines the best resource and pricing options for a specific piece of work, based on the client business drivers, delivery requirements, and value factors.

The Financial Services Delivery Center plays an integral role by supporting projects and PwC engagement teams across the US in delivering distinctive service to clients through standardization and optimization, increased flexibility, and enhanced quality.

Analysts within the FS Delivery Center specialize in:



-

Business Process Analysis reviewing, measuring, analyzing, assessing, and reporting on the operational performance of clients business operations.

-

Business Requirements
- creating business requirements documents consisting of data flows, system context diagrams, process flows, and detail business requirements. reviewing, measuring, analyzing, assessing, and reporting on the operational performance of clients business operations

Position/Program Requirements
Minimum Year(s) of Experience: 1


Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's degree


Knowledge Preferred:

Demonstrates proven success in roles or technical training that indicates thorough levels of knowledge to use issued technology and effective written and verbal business communication know-how to complete compliance-related consulting engagements, which includes the following areas:

- Implementation of AML/BSA and OFAC Laws and Regulations in a business environment;
- Familiarity with the requirements of the FFIEC BSA/AML Examination Manual;
- Knowledge of common AML Typologies;
- Banking-related products and services, operations, processes. commercial, retail, private banking, broker dealers and transactional flows;
- Common and emerging issues impacting Financial Services clients;
- Corporate compliance program development, analyses;
- Program construction, monitoring and auditing, emphasizing the management of internal risk assessments and/or investigations;
- Management of multiple work streams or project teams to execute against an existing project or work plan;
- Promotion, management and delivery of the continuous improvement of activities and service e-delivery;
- Attention to details in executing and reviewing work products to establish the highest quality deliverables in the allotted timeframe;
- Integration and synthesis of information from multiple sources, including business domain knowledge, in order to analyze complex data and results, anticipate issues and solve problems; and,
- Promotion and driving toward standardization of service and/or solutions delivery and activities to provide efficient client service.

Proven success in prior roles within the professional services industry is preferred.


Skills Preferred:

Demonstrates proven thorough abilities and success with utilizing Microsoft Office Suite
e.g. Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Access, and/or SharePoint
Lotus Notes, and other firm-issued technologies to think analytically when addressing and resolving issues and create deliverables.

Demonstrates some proven abilities and success with interpreting and applying BSA/AML and Sanctions regulations and interacting with related regulatory authorities.

Demonstrates some proven abilities evaluating, implementing and developing the following results:

- Customer on-boarding procedures, including CIP, CDD, and EDD;
- Investigation of potential suspicious activity, leveraging transaction monitoring solutions; and,
- OFAC/Sanctions and screening programs.

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. job.title: Senior Systems Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Urbandale
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Senior Systems Engineer - 36830

Your Responsibilities

As a Senior Systems Engineer, for the John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (Urbandale), you will lead the system design activities for the infrastructure sub-systems of our advanced in-vehicle displays. In addition, you will:

  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team to identify and capture stakeholder and system requirements that are essential for defining and managing the behavior, scope, context, and complexity of the system.
  • Lead the evaluation of technical options and decision making for a cross functional development team.
  • Provide engineering direction concerning the integration of electronic sub-systems into John Deere machines and other OEM equipment.
  • Be the organizational technical expert for assigned systems.
  • Analyze field data and customer feedback to understand and quantify performance/quality gaps and drive them to closure.

Visa sponsorship is NOT available for this position.

What Skills You Need

  • 5 or more years of software centric product engineering experience
  • 2 or more years of demonstrated technical leadership
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams

What Makes You Stand Out

  • Experience with systems engineering principles
  • Experience with embedded software engineering principles
  • Experience with Agile software development practices
  • Experience with vehicle electrical systems, ISO11783-based CAN networks, Ethernet, and GPS based guidance systems
  • Experience with Agriculture or Construction vehicles

Education (or equivalent work experience)

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Agricultural Engineering, or Computer Science
  • Additional coursework or certificate related to Systems Engineering is a plus

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.


Associated topics: infrastructure, ip, maintain, maintenance, network, principal systems engineer, senior engineer, server, system architect, system integrator

job.title: Datacenter Engineer
job.description:
Kelly IT Resources is currently seeking a Datacenter Engineer for a contract to hire opportunity located in Sunnyvale, CA. The Datacenter Engineer will play a key role in helping launch the customer briefing center datacenter in the companys newly created lab facility. The Datacenter Engineer will be responsible for planning and implementation of key server, storage, and converged solutions in the datacenter. The role is a hands-on role and will require physical installation and integration of datacenter and interfacing with other facility technicians on various site planning topics. The Datacenter Engineer will be working with a team on the IT project as well as interfacing with key constituents in the Lab team as well as Engineering and other cross-functional departments. Must be able to work independently and have a strong network infrastructure background in both hardware and software. Tasks/ Responsibilities: Design layout of server and storage racks, including required cabling and other connectivity requirements. Server installation & maintenance (rack & stack, HDD, memory, CPU, RAID batteries, NICs) Storage array installation & maintenance (controller, expansion disk and SSD/NVMe drives) Network installation & maintenance (rack & stack, cabling, parts replacement) Site builds & refreshes, while meeting current quality standards Create required planning documentation on the site requirements and communicate effectively with other parties on the implementation project Interact with onsite staff and vendors for: hardware replacement, diagnostics, reconfiguration Lift equipment weighing 50 lbs.+ Other miscellaneous site activities may include setup of WiFi for the briefing center, rollout of VDI clients, and connecting A/V for the training center Basic Qualifications & Experience: Familiar with network cabling (types, distance limitations, testing, connectors, handling) Familiar with electrical & optical transceivers (SFP+, QSFP+, DAC, CFP2, DWDM) General working knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMware, and on security products (firewalls, IPS, endpoint security, ADCs, load balancing) Familiar with electrical standards, connector types, power budget calculations, AC vs. DC, single phase vs. three phase Familiar with datacenter design in relation to heat dissipation and air flow Meticulous about organized cabling Detail oriented and organized General knowledge on datacenter and IT industry best practices Preferred Qualifications Operational experience as a Systems or Network Administrator Hands-on experience with x86 servers, storage arrays, hyperconverged systems. Knowledge of Enterprise products a plus Networking experience with CCNA and/or Network+ certifications is a plus. Knowledge of wireless networking as well Previous experience working in a Data Center environment (racking & stacking gear, cable management, hot & cold aisle containment) Experience with setting up Proof of Concept datacenter environment a plus Min. 7 years IT datacenter experience Education Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical field Why Kelly? With Kelly, youll have direct connections to leading IT organizations in the best companies around the globeoffering you the chance to work on some of todays most intriguing, innovative and high-visibility projects. In a field where change is the only constant, our connections and opportunities will help you take your career exactly where you want to go. We work with 95 of the Fortune 100 companies, and more than 9,000 IT hiring managers turn to us each year to access the best talent: people like you. Last year we found 10,000 opportunities for IT professionals. Let us help advance your career today. About Kelly Services As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to have a role in managing employment opportunities for more than one million workers around the globe. We employ 550,000 of these individuals directly with the remaining workers engaged through our talent supply chain network of supplier partners. Revenue in 2015 was $5.5 billion. Visit kellyservices.com and connect with us on Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter. Kelly Services is an equal opportunity employer including, but not limited to, Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity and is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.]]

job.title: QA Engineer (Lead)
job.description:
Position: QA Engineer (Lead) Location: Chandler, AZ 85226 Duration: Long Term Contract Visa Status: Only able to work on a W2 basis due to federal and government requirements. Job Description: The Quality Assurance Lead for Source to Pay Transformation leads planning, scheduling, and execution of all test phases over the program roadmap and will assist in the design and potentially development of test automation using Parasoft and SOA Test In collaboration with the project team, devise the test objectives, organizational test policies, test strategies and test plans Estimate testing and negotiate to acquire the necessary resources. Devise the approach for test automation, when test automation is appropriate and plan the effort, provide input into tool selection, and ensure team training occurs Lead, guide and monitor the analysis, design, implementation and execution of the test cases, test procedures and test suites. Ensure proper configuration management of the testing software and traceability of the tests to the critical business capabilities. Ensure the test environment and associated test data is put into place before test execution and managed during test execution. Schedule tests for execution and then monitor, measure, control and report on the test progress, the product quality status and the test results, adapting the test plan and compensating as needed to adjust to evolving conditions. Write summary reports on test status. Provide a recommendation prior to code release based on testing results. Requirements: Experience with SAP On Premise and Ariba On Demand software is a must. Experience with test automation using SAAS solutions, preferably Ariba Competent with SOA Test and Parasoft Possesses a basic understanding on Mulesoft Expert in the use of Rally for managing testing, features Extremely familiar with Agile concepts, has worked on agile teams and able to make recommendations for improvements Able to lead a small team that will be implementing test automation Experience with at least five SAP upgrades Experience with at least three SAP implementations At least 6 months of availability to work at Intel Preferred Experience leading and managing a group of analysts Familiarity with HP Quality Center test management software Is familiar with the Intel environment Why Kelly? job.title: Senior Consultant Master Data Management
job.description:
Location: Eastern region of the U.S.; Remote

Our Team
Employer Professional Services (IPS) provides the product expertise, and project management knowledge to deliver the most architecturally efficient and cost effective solution for our customers data integration projects. Because our practice serves the largest and most diverse Employer customer base, our work keeps us on the cutting edge of all forms of data management projects B2B, Data Governance, Data Migration and Consolidation, Data Quality Management, Data Synchronization, Data Warehousing, Integration Competency Centers, Master Data Management, and Services Oriented Architectures. Whether it is a short or long-term engagement, we are dedicated to sharing our knowledge to ensure our customers continued success with our products.

Your Opportunity
The Senior Consultant will work closely with customers, partners and Employer staff to deploy best-of-class Employer MDM solutions. This position requires a highly skilled principal level consultant with Data Architecture, RDBMS and Java experience. The successful candidate will work in a wide variety of pre-sales and post-sales activities, including pre-sales due diligence, post-sales customer deployments and third-level customer support.

Your Responsibilities

Deliver high quality customer solutions in adherence to Employer/Siperian methodology
Develop logical and physical database schemas, stored procedures, interfaces (in Java or XML), and extensions to customer proprietary solutions
Provide technical depth concerning Employer/Siperian solutions in discussions with customers, partners and internal resources

Your Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
7+ years of Enterprise Data Warehouse and/or Master Data Management (MDM) - functional and/or technical experience
7+ years development/analysis/design/administration
5+ years experience with either Oracle and/or DB2/UDB
Experience with J2EE environment including experience with application servers (WebLogic, WebSphere and/or JBoss)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to facilitate discussions and drive toward quick decisions, be a team lead
Professional on-site customer integration experience, preferably with a large systems integration firm or for an enterprise software services arm
Experience developing conceptual and physical solution architectures for solutions incorporating heterogeneous applications, technologies and platforms
Strong understanding of data modeling, physical schema properties, triggers, and stored procedures
Experience designing and deploying in a Services Oriented Architecture and/or an Events Driven Architecture
Ability to \"think big\" and grasp the overall picture, including the business drivers
Must be able to solve problem outside your areas of expertise
Willingness to travel 75%

Desirable
Experience with UNIX and shell script programming
Ability to automate administration tasks, perform capacity planning, performance monitoring and tuning and administer security
Experience with optimization of high volume databases (>300GB) and large, distributed J2EE applications
Experience with Linux /Solaris/HP/Windows/AIX Server administration
Strong understanding of CRM and/or ERP packages (SAP, Oracle, Siebel and Peoplesoft)
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL tools


Associated topics: data integration, data integrity, data management, data quality, data scientist, data warehouse, database, erp, mongo database administrator, sql

job.description:

job.title: Lead Project Manager
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Looking for a highly motivated leader to develops, plan and manage implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for external/internal customers.

Job Description

  • Develop, plan and manage implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for consumer contact centers.
  • Responsible for budget and expense control for project and strategic alignment of project to business unit objectives.
  • Accountable for timely project completion and delivery. Analyzes work plans and schedules.
  • Responsible for resource requirements/allocation.
  • Develops methodologies, procedures, and systems to produce financial reporting.
  • Acts as project team leader.
  • Develops project progress and status reports
  • Completes all necessary project documentation in a timely manner.
  • Coordinate and facilitate project meetings. Develop and distribute timely meeting minutes, to include track/manage action items and verify they are incorporated into the program schedule and that deliverables are met on time.
  • Assess/Manage risk, impacts and potential alternatives and escalate as required to the appropriate level of management.
  • Set program objectives and establish clear measures to successfully define and meet project deliverables and timelines. Utilize the change control process to track schedule changes.
  • Through partnership with other staff organizations, define Key Performance Indicators (KPI), training, process standards, policies, and procedures. Associated with complex projects.
  • Provide executive level status updates.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent education and 6+ years related experience.
  • Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams such as Sales, Marketing, Finance, Product, Operations and Support.
  • Ability to deal with remote client relations through phone, email & online sources in order to enhance the Partner experience.
  • Ability to quickly understand technical aspects of product/service, both from a functionality perspective but also from an operations/set up perspective and be able to articulate it to a less technical audience.
  • Strong program/project management skills.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills with ability to identify business needs and make solution recommendations.
  • Self-motivated, able to manage and prioritize multiple tasks, projects, and clients in parallel in a time sensitive environment.
  • Proficient with common office applications.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Masters degree with 4+ years experience.
  • Project Management certification
  • 4+ years contact center experience

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent

Masters or Equivalent

Alternate Location: US-Alabama-Montgomery; US-Arizona-Flagstaff; US-Arizona-Phoenix; US-Arkansas-Bentonville; US-California-Los Angeles; US-California-Sacramento; US-California-San Fran; US-Colorado-Broomfield; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Colorado-Littleton; US-Connecticut-Hartford; US-District of Columbia-Washington; US-Florida-Apopka; US-Florida-Jacksonville; US-Florida-Miami; US-Georgia-Atlanta; US-Idaho-Boise; US-Illinois-Chicago; US-Indiana-Indianapolis; US-Indiana-Warsaw; US-Iowa-Davenport; US-Iowa-Des Moines; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Kansas-Overland Park; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Maryland-Columbia; US-Massachusetts-Framingham; US-Michigan-Ann Arbor; US-Michigan-Grand Rapids; US-Minnesota-Minneapolis; US-Missouri-Jefferson City; US-Missouri-Kansas City; US-Nebraska-Omaha; US-Nevada-Las Vegas; US-New Jersey-Jersey City; US-New York-New York; US-North Carolina-Charlotte; US-North Carolina-Raleigh; US-North Carolina-Wake Forest; US-North Dakota-Grand Forks; US-Ohio-Dublin; US-Ohio-Mansfield; US-Oklahoma-Oklahoma City; US-Oregon-Medford; US-Pennsylvania-Harrisburg; US-Pennsylvania-Philadelphia; US-South Carolina-Myrtle Beach; US-South Dakota-Sioux Falls; US-Tennessee-Johnson City; US-Tennessee-Nashville; US-Texas-Dallas; US-Utah-Provo; US-Utah-Salt Lake City; US-Virginia-Charlottesvi; US-Virginia-Reston; US-Virginia-Richmond; US-Washington-Seattle; US-Washington-Vancouver; US-Wisconsin-La Crosse

job.title: Application Security Architect - IAM
job.description:
To assist in the execution of the vision, future direction, and initiative roadmap for strategic, application technology programs for the IT Security Office (ITSO) organization. To help define the reference and implementation architectures for strategic, application technology solutions for the ITSO organization. This position will specifically be part of the Identity & Access Management (IAM) transformation team and will be driving major architecture changes that will impact how Vanguard provisions access/authorizations across the enterprise. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with IAM systems like SailPoint and be familiar with the entire lifecycle (joiner, mover, leavers) of access management for internal and external users across various platforms, databases, privileged access, reconciliation, cloud and integration with credential stores.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provides the architectural leadership in shaping strategic, application security technology programs for the ITSO organization.
  • Enhances security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaches improved processes.
  • Assists in determining security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researches information security standards; conducts system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studies application architecture/platform; identifies integration issues.
  • Participates in the plan and design of security systems by evaluating and applying world class application security frameworks and technologies; develops security requirements for the SDLC, source code classification, authentication, authorization, designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as software; adhering to industry standards.
  • Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and software; directs software installation and calibration; prepares preventive and reactive measures. Creates, transmitts, and maintains keys; provides technical support; completes documentation.
  • Verifies application code security by developing and implementing code review test scripts. Maintains security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures. Conducts incident response analyses; develops and conducts training programs.
  • Upgrades security systems by monitoring security environment; identifies security gaps; evaluates and implements enhancements. Prepares system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.
  • Updates job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging security practices and standards; participates in educational opportunities; reads professional publications. Maintains personal networks and participates in professional organizations.
  • Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; explores opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Communicates complicated technical concepts effectively to a broad group of stakeholders. Establishes relationships with IT leaders, architects, and technical specialists for the purpose of advancing proposed architectural solutions.
  • Utilizes a general understanding of the competitive landscape and corporate and business unit strategies to provide context for security architectural decision making.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Centreville, VA

Employer Cyber Operations is hiring a Systems Integration Engineer to join a large technical program in Centreville, Virginia. Qualified candidates must demonstrate the ability to integrate multipledispersed components into a seamless system in a software environment. job.title: Digital Transformation Architect
job.description:
Our Team

We play a vital role not only with regard to revenue generation, but also with Employers reputation in the marketplace. Were the frontline evangelists, the direct line to our customers. Our success is due to the knowledge that we can confidently stand behind every product we offer as well as the unlimited potential for personal and professional growth that a position in Sales affords us.

Your Opportunity
The Principal Architect role works hand-in-hand with both area and national sales leadership to guide our largest customers in thinking around data fabrics, data platforms, and how to shift systems and processing from on-premise to cloud. In addition, the Principal Architect is always on the lookout for new trends within our customers and identifying/creating initial materials on how to pitch our stack to address the trend. As a respected technical sales professional, you are highly self-motivation to further the effectiveness of both the presales architecture team as well as field sales consultants in general, to drive increased company revenues.

Our Ideal Candidate
Youre a natural leader who strives for excellence and is known for your resourcefulness and collaboration, with expert skills in solutions positioning. Youre technically sophisticated and have the patience and passion to guide customers and stakeholders through all the capabilities of our products and solutions. You have that unique blend of technical aptitude and broad thinking to both understand our wide product portfolio at a hands on, technical level and understand how that entire portfolio can be put to use solving enterprise scale problems. You possess superb communication and customer-relationship skills responsiveness, sensitivity, diplomacy and are comfortable working both independently and collaboratively. Youre advanced problem-solving skills and technical aptitudes allow you to adapt to new circumstances and learn quickly when facing new problems and challenges. You have a track record of quickly becoming highly respected among your peers and constituents.
You possess extremely deep knowledge in at least two critical solution areas for Employer and have a strong aptitude for absorbing new areas quickly.

In addition to the attributes mentioned, youll also be able to/have:
Learn or already understand the broader technology ecosystems our products and solutions work within, in areas such as Big Data, Data Governance, Master Data Management, and Cloud.
Rapidly understand and align technical solutions to our customers broad scope data management challenges.
Persuasive communication skills for presenting to all customer levels, primarily focusing on CTOs/CIOs, Enterprise Architects, and Line of Business owners.
Communicate a compelling and inspired vision, articulating what is possible beyond today, helping our customers see a future state architecture based on Employer technologies.
Inspire and motivate people to rally support behind the vision, and make it sharable by everyone.

Your Responsibilities
You will work with sales management and direct management to identify strategic accounts or opportunities to engage in broad thinking and vision setting for our entire product portfolio.
You will maintain strong technical knowledge of both the Employer portfolio as well as relevant ecosystem technologies the portfolio interacts with.
You will spend a defined portion of time working on identifying and building new technical messaging that other architects, as well as sales consultants, can adopt, and enable those groups on that messaging. This may include identifying and building demonstration scenarios which show the power of the platform with multiple Employer and external technologies working together.
You will provide guidance for sales teams on opportunities where a broader solution may be applicable.
You will present to, and establish critical relationships with, targeted accounts/opportunities to drive broad solutions and larger revenue results.
You will help define, build, deliver, and enable the field team on forward-thinking workshops which allow prospects to get hands on with technology in the context of a new area to drive net new opportunities
You will provide feedback and perspective to both product marketing and product management to inform future direction of our products.

Your Qualifications
B.S. degree in computer science strongly preferred
Enterprise software implementation experience in a related technical discipline. Knowledgeable in a variety of skills related to the data integration market space which includes data warehousing, business Intelligence, data quality, metadata management, master data management, RDBMS skills.
Ability to understand customer requirements and translate that information to a solution leveraging working knowledge of the companys products
Strong preference for existing deep knowledge on multiple Employer products.
Strong preference for prior implementation experience with Employer or related technologies in the areas of Big Data, Data Governance, Data Security, Master Data Management, or Cloud/Hybrid data fabrics.

job.title: Senior Staff Systems Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - North Dakota (US-ND) - Fargo
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Senior Staff Systems Engineer - 36415

Your Responsibilities

As the Senior Staff Systems Engineer for John Deere Electronic Solutions (JDES) located in Fargo, ND, you will: provide technical expertise to define and develop system architecture for power electronic products used on robust on/off road hybrid electric vehicles for harsh environments. You will gather new product requirements from enterprise platforms and OEM customers for all engineering functional areas. In addition you will:

  • Define systems architecture and re-use strategies for power electronic products using innovative architectural designs, detailed design, advanced modeling and simulation. Systems will include analog / digital electronics, software operating systems, advanced control theory / methods, electro-hydraulic control, electric motor control and displays / instrumentation.
  • Develop and document requirements that drive common solutions and re-use that enables the most cost effective products based on total lifecycle cost
  • Apply advanced modeling, design and simulation techniques to develop, test, and verify concepts.
  • Work closely with other product development team members as needed to ensure the final combined product has compatible software, electronic hardware, and mechanical hardware which functions properly together and performs at levels specified in the product requirements.
  • Perform and/or coordinate detailed unit, integration, and systems verification and validation testing using software tools including emulators, debuggers, hardware in the loop and simulations.
  • Review others' testing and suggest additional test cases.
  • Support marketing as they grow power electronics capability and market share by developing superior technical concepts and implementing innovative production solutions.

    *** U.S. visa sponsorship is NOT available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • Ten or more years of experience in Embedded Controller development including Hardware, Software and/or Test.
  • Five or more years of experience using MatLab/Simulink in the development of embedded controllers.
  • Demonstrated expertise in developing power electronics and systems applications with an understanding of motor controls and machines.
  • Experience implementing systems based on an understanding of controls for power conversion equipment and an understanding of electric machines and modulation methods for inverters and converters.
  • Experience developing microcontroller based electronic systems using microcontroller peripherals such as: PWM outputs, A/D converters, watchdog timers, interrupt and trap functions, serial and parallel interfaces, memory organization, boot loaders, etc.
  • Experience implementing systems that use common vehicle communication protocols (e.g. J1939, ISO11783, Broad-R-Reach Ethernet, etc.)
  • Experience in roles that required an understanding of industry standards (IEC, UL, ISO, SAE) as related to electrical systems design, functional safety, and components.
  • Experience in roles that required demonstration of a high degree of technical judgment, independent thinking, experience and unique development approaches to solutions.
  • Demonstrated effective written and verbal communication skills.

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Experience with various programs and tools for requirements development, such as: PTC Integrity, Doors, PREEVision, etc.
  • Experience with high speed communication protocols and hardware, such as: Ethernet, EtherCAT, TCP/IP, etc.
  • Industry experience with control of PM, IPM, Induction, and SR machines.
  • Experience with auto-code generation using MatLab/Simulink, Real-Time, etc.
  • Experience developing controls using FPGAs.
  • Experience with developing electronic control systems for on-highway and/or off-highway vehicle applications.
  • Experience with developing electronic power conversion systems that may connect to the grid.

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Science in an Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or other relevant discipline.
  • Advanced degree in Electrical Engineering or Power Electronics or certificate in Systems Engineering, highly preferred.

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

You will work directly with customers in the automotive and consumer products industry. If you value a close knit team that believes in team work and continuous improvement then this is the opportunity for you. Due to growth, our client is searching for a Product Development Engineer and a Sr. Product Development Engineerwith experience ininjection molding and decorative finishing processes. job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

Job Description

The Sr. Program Operations Manager demonstrates leadership in communicating business goals / programs / processes focused around improving effectiveness and efficiencies of the pre-sales support roles (Sales Engineering, Sales Operations and Sales Support Associates). The Pre-Sales PMO Sr. Program Operations Manager will leverage effectiveness and LSS best practices to solve problems, develop and execute objectives for self and others, and have the ability to effect short-term and some long-term business goals.The Sr. Program Operations Manager will support initiatives enabling the pre-sales support roles to achieve operational excellence in order to gain overall competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide leadership and direction to cross-functional team empowered to execute process best practices (ex. LSS, STM, PM) for data quality & process improvement.
  • Working with pre-sales, sales and supporting organizational leaders to understand productivity challenges, propose approaches, and implement changes to improve pre-sales support role effectiveness
  • Deliver breakthrough levels of improvement in process and role capability, reproducibility of designs and business processes to reduce data defects and attain world-class levels of quality through completion of effectiveness initiatives
  • Facilitate, train, and coach team members in the use of pre-sales PMO best practices
  • Work with operating leaders and teams to uncover and assess lean pre-sales support effectiveness and improvement opportunities
  • Communicate teams' progress to Champions and Business Leaders
  • Identify potential process improvement projects and lead Pre-Sales PMO programs through managing, planning, and monitoring key initiatives from conception through implementation
  • Support Pre-Sales PMO projects / programs including but not limited to the management of all program management activities, oversight for program schedules and key milestones, reporting of program status, issue management, change management and risk management

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Experience developing strategic project portfolios leveraging improvement best practices such as Lean Six Sigma, PMP best practices, etc.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and manage though challenges in a data driven approach.
  • Ability to prioritize projects, navigate challenges, and communicate changes and support needed.
  • Strong executive-level presentation skills.
  • Strong change management and coaching skills.
  • Strong analytical ability.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence and build a collaborative environment.
  • Previous Sales/SE & Project / Program Management knowledge
  • Mix of pre-sales and post-sales experience
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem solving skills
  • Excellent leadership, mentoring, and coaching skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills as well as negotiation, coordination, organization, facilitation, and conflict management skills

Education and Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent education and experience. Typically with 5-7 years related experience
  • 2+ years previous manager level leadership experience preferred.
  • Certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt is a plus
  • Sales, Sales Operations, Order Management experience is a plus
  • Telecommunications experience
  • PMP Certification desirable but not required

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent

job.title: Associate Software Engineer
job.description:
Associate Software Engineer

We have an exciting opportunity for two Associate Software Engineers to join our team. This role offers the ability to learn and grow within our engineering team. This position works within our Austin, TX headquarters located at 360 and 222, which is about 8 miles from downtown and beautifully situated on the edge of Central Texas Hill Country.

About Jobs2Careers

Jobs2Careers is the leading programmatic job advertising marketplace with more than 20 million registered users and over 2 billion monthly searches. What makes Jobs2Careers stand out? We re mission-driven: we help people find work. We connect the best talent with the right opportunities in the most efficient way possible. We believe that to be the best, we must hire the best - and help them become even better. At Jobs2Careers, you ll find an environment of collaboration, encouragement, transparency, and fun.

As an Associate Software Engineer, you will:

  • Coordinate with team members to maintain and grow existing codebase.
  • Produce utilities for internal and external use.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues in software.
  • Develop unit-testable code to meet business needs.

What we're looking for in a highly competitive candidate:

  • Bachelor s degree in engineering, software, information technology, or related field.
  • Exposure to Java or a similar object oriented language.
  • Familiarity with algorithms and algorithmic complexity.
  • Knowledge of data structures.
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills.
  • Sharp analytical skills.
  • Bonus: 6+ months of industry Java experience.

Benefits:

  • Highly competitive salary
  • Company-paid gym membership
  • Comprehensive, company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance premiums for you and your dependents
  • 401(k) retirement plan with 3% employer contribution
  • Paid company holidays and paid Vacation and Sick Time
  • Fully-stocked kitchen
  • Awesome company events

Jobs2Careers is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

job.title: Senior DevOps Manager
job.description:
Point B is an employee-owned management consulting firm that is looking for talented individuals who want to be part of a dynamic, growing firm and make an impact with world-class clients.

What makes Point B different? An employee-ownership model that gives you a voice in directing your career and building our firm. Diverse leadership opportunities to expand your skills, along with the support needed to deliver great results. A unique culture that recognizes the importance of flexibility and collaboration.

It s no wonder that Point B has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by Fortune magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Consulting magazine, Vault.com and many others.

What you ll get to do:

  • Lead and plan the assessment, design and implementation of DevOps capabilities in complex, multiple application, production environments
  • Drive initiatives to help clients introduce or improve DevOps capabilities, including software testing, software deployment, configuration management, and operations
  • Exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and contribute to the firm s growth as an employee-owner

What we offer our Senior Managers:

  • Opportunity to help a variety of clients succeed with key strategic initiatives that have critical impacts to their operations and business success, helping them reinvent the way they manage their business
  • Challenging and diverse project work to grow your software development skills and experience
  • Support and mentor Point B emerging leaders
  • The opportunity to build and be part of a fun and collaborative culture, with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their clients

What we expect you ve already done:

  • A minimum of 8 years of demonstrated success as a leader of complex business or technology initiatives, particularly software development
  • Quantitative undergraduate degree preferred (e.g. BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics)
  • Proven capability with end-to-end management of projects from concept and requirements gathering to development, testing and deployment
  • Familiarity with system and software development concepts and methods, such as the software development life cycle, agile, and waterfall
  • Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery Models such as Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Octopus Deploy, TFS Build Server, VSTS
  • Previous consulting experience and ability to lead project teams is desirable
  • Available 80%+ travel within the Midwest; Preferred locations: Atlanta, Chicago, or Dallas

The kind of people we look for:

  • Versatile consultant who thrive on variety and challenge
  • Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture
  • Engaging leaders who make a positive impact on their firm, clients and communities
  • Talented consultant with a growth mindset who want to use their networking and relationship building skills to help grow the firm

Equal Opportunity Employer / Protected Veteran / Disability

job.title: Systems Engineer
job.description:
Systems Engineer

Centreville, VA

Ready for a challenge that will keep you on the cutting edge of cyber-security? Employer works on top level cyber-security for national defense programs and is hiring experienced Systems Engineers with a focus on research, innovation andsolving mission critical challenges.

POSITION OVERVIEW :

The Systems Engineer will be supporting the Lead Systems Engineer of a large multi-disciplinary team of engineering professionals that are helping solve the most critical cyber challenges for the United States Government. The candidate will implement and improve upon established procedures while performing a variety of tasks related to leading the technical execution of a high-visibility program. The candidate will be relied upon for their detail-oriented approach towards accurately understanding the complex system. The ideal candidate thrives on being challenged. Overall, the candidate will become a key part of elevating the efficiency and performance of the entire growing team.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

The Systems Engineer must have extensive experience in the following areas:

Processes
  • Possess strong KSA (Knowledge, Skill, and Ability) for the following processes
    • Various SE processes
    • JCIDS process
    • Agile Software Development LC process
  • Support establishing, implementing and executing the processes


Requirements
  • Analyze customer requirements that are often generic and abstract
  • Derive requirements down into testable thresholds and objectives
  • Support the presentation / defense of the derived requirements to the customer


Design
  • Functional and physical decomposition of complex hardware/software systems
  • Creation of various types of diagrams using tools like Microsoft Visio
  • Support the presentation / defense of the designs to the customer


Research
  • Provide consultation to teams performing research on the next-gen system
  • Review incremental progress and technical reports for completeness
  • Support the presentation / defense of the research to the customer


Writing
  • Develop SE documentations, processes and plans
  • Review user guides and test documents for accuracy and completeness
  • Support the editing / delivery of artifacts to the customer





EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field along with 2+ years of related work experience.
  • Good written and oral communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills are required
  • Strong working experience with the cloud-based technology is required
  • Strong working experience with Windows and Linux operating systems is required
  • Strong background in software engineering and networking is required
  • Candidate must meet eligibility requirements for a security clearance by the U.S. Government within a reasonable time after commencement of employment.


SKILLS/COMPETENCIES :
Good written and oral communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills are required. Additionally, a demonstrated proficiency in keyboard skills and the utilization of Microsoft Office are required. Strong working experience with Windows and Linux operating systems. Strong background in software engineering and networking is preferred.

***** All candidates must be US Citizens to be considered for the position *****

Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials.

job.title: Principal Presales Consultant
job.description:
Our Team

The Sales team plays a vital role not only with regard to revenue generation, but also with Employer's reputation in the marketplace. We're the front line evangelists, the direct line to our customers. We are committed to understanding our customers' challenges and how our solutions can maximize their return on data. Our quality products and customer service is why we continually rank #1 in customer loyalty or personal andprofessional growth that a position in Sales affords us.

Your Opportunity

We are seeking a technically adept, collaborative sales engineering professional to join our team. You will work with other members of the pre-sales team to address the technical needs of potential customers and close new business deals from sales leads. In this role, you will serve as a counselor and advisor to customers and a technical coach to coworkers, providing advice and guidance throughout the sales cycle. Since the pre-sales team is responsible for capitalizing on new business leads and opportunities, members of the pre-sales team are instrumental to Employers future growth in the region.

Our Ideal Candidate

You are technically sophisticated and have the patience and passion to guide customers and stakeholders through all the capabilities of our products and solutions. Whether it is an initial product evaluation, competitive proof point, or addressing technical pain points, you are willing to take the time to provide deep explanations and find solutions where needed. You find a collaborative work environment rewarding, yet are equally adept at and content working independently. As an influential and effective sales consultant, you are eager to share your knowledge and best practices and to develop and sustain an open line of communication with your supervisor and teammates. If your team members or customers are in remote locations, you are comfortable with frequent travel in order to engage face-to-face.

In addition, you have the following attributes:
- An ability to rapidly understand and translate clients business challenges and concerns into a solution oriented discussion.
- Persuasive communication skills for presenting to all customer levels, from CTOs and CIOs to engineering managers and programmers and from CMOs to business analysts.
- Resourcefulness, creativity, and strategic thinking for troubleshooting database and application problems.

Your Responsibilities

You will serve as the master of the technical agenda with responsibility for analyzing, explaining and selling the technical aspects of the solution to customers. Working with Sales Account Managers, you will manage the technical sales cycle to ensure new business opportunities come to fruition and generate revenue for the company. On a weekly basis, you will proactively engage with customers and prospects to demonstrate our products and effectively communicate the key differentiators. To set the stage for successful implementations you will assist customers with initial product evaluations and share relevant customer success stories. Connecting the dots between the technical requirements of a project and the business requirements is elemental to the success of this position. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

-Respond promptly to customer questions with deep, detailed technical explanations of product features and capabilities
-Serve as a technical coach to your colleagues in sales, professional services, product management and engineering
-Prepare and deliver differentiated solution presentations or technical proposals
-Deliver and/or coordinate differentiated product and solution demonstrations to prospective customers
-Manage technical validation activities including proof of concepts

Your Qualifications

-BS degree or equivalent experience in product applications, ability to understand and explain related technologies, working knowledge of company products, all potential applications, and effective communication skills.

- Experience selling to Media, Automotive, Manufacturing, and High Tech a plus

-Minimum of one to three years in pre-sales OR enterprise software implementation experience at a software vendor.

-Excellent presentation abilities and composure in front of all levels of technical and business customers or prospects.

-Excellent hands on Relational Database skills.

-Experience in Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Data Quality, Business Intelligence

-Experience in Big Data and Hadoop technologies a BIG plus

-Willingness to travel 30%

Additional Information

Employer offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical/dental, 401(k), flexible time off and more. Our generous benefits vary depending on your geographic work location. It is an exciting time to work at Employer, you can learn more about our company, and our products and services at www.informatica.com. Employer is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

job.title: Technical Lead - UI
job.description:
To provide expert level IT technical lead services, including the direction, evaluation, selection, configuration, implementation, and integration of new and existing technologies and tools.

Are you looking to stretch your conceptual thinking muscles? Do you want to further Vanguard s business goals while leveraging latest technology?

This could be the place for you! The Institutional Contribution Maximizer project is looking for an innovative and highly engaged tech lead. This project will be utilizing NGA technologies for UI and Rest Services to allow participants to meet their maximum contribution payroll deferral, while considering the employer's contributions, plan limits and government limitations. The project team will enhance the Institutional PEX website for this new capability. A person with strong Conceptual Thinking skills will find this opportunity a fit for their background, as the team and business works through this broad view request, looking for ways to experiment while tackling problems.

The ideal candidate should:

  • Have technical acumen with Rest Services, UI and NGA.
  • Experience and ability to grasp NEW technologies (Cloud - AWS, DevOps)
  • Coach and mentor the team on cutting edge technology
  • Enjoy driving solutions from complex business scenarios to deliver business value
  • Have experience working within an Agile Team, using Shift Left concepts to help identify technical strategy to deliver business value with a continuous delivery strategy
  • Embrace promoting development in others
  • Work with multiple project teams and leverage different perspectives and cultures to actively draw out all team members in technical sessions

Current teams members and management have strong sense of orienting work to common goals so the sum of the team's diverse skills are maximized to deliver strong business results. The ideal candidate should possess a team oriented mindset to ensure team success.

Qualifications:

1. Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience

2. Eight years experience in technical specialty. For development technical leads, includes three years' developer experience.

3. Strong, demonstrated analysis and problem solving skills

4. Broad knowledge of the financial services industry

5. Expert knowledge of the following technical lead practices and concepts:

  • Full product life cycle
  • IT vendor product assessment
  • Architecture design
  • Wide range of technologies within technical specialty - from state of the art to legacy systems
  • Performance and stress testing
  • Security
  • Quality assurance methodology and Inspections
  • Technical standards and deliverables
  • Migration and integration
  • Estimating, including design, development/purchase, and installation
  • For development only: Production acceptance (including elevations), data modeling, data sharing, reusable components, and related advanced development practices

6. Expert knowledge of one or more IT platforms.

Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Provides expert level IT technical lead services and direction for critical software, middleware, and/or hardware projects (e.g., applications, networks, communications, and client server technologies) on multiple platforms. Provides technical expertise in systems, technical infrastructure, tools, modeling, external interfaces, and other technical areas. Completes complex development, design, implementation, architecture design specification, and maintenance activities.

2. Ensures the viability of IT deliverables. Recommends development options, including design, build/buy, and vendor purchase. Approves the team's technical deliverables. Conducts testing, including functionality, technical limitations, and security.

3. Identifies potential solutions, including the cost/benefit of each option. Approves technical solutions proposed by team members. Elevates complex technical issues to IT experts, including architects and vendors. Resolves technical problems discovered by testers and internal clients. Responds to and resolves technical issues in a timely manner. Researches issues and performs root cause analysis.

4. Communicates with project manager on a frequent basis. Identifies tasks and issues that may have an impact on service levels or schedules. Provides realistic task and cost estimates. Screens resumes of team members, interviews, makes hiring and assignment recommendations, and writes reviews.

5. Maintains a current and working knowledge of IT development methodology, architecture design, and technical standards. Mentors IT staff and identifies training needs. As new standards are instituted, ensures their usage by team members. A Technical Lead II should be able to perform as a Developer III.

6. Communicates with other technical leads, IT groups, and clients so they understand the project's technical implications, dependencies, and potential conflicts. Evaluates the impacts of change requests on own/shared technologies and effectively persuades and influences others on ideas.

7. Reviews and approves documentation and diagrams created by IT team members (e.g., system specifications). Writes documentation, including technical standards and processes.

8. Identifies opportunities for continuous quality improvement of technical standards, methodologies, and technologies.

9. Participates in design, code, and test inspections throughout product life cycle to identify issues. Participates as a technical consultant at other project meetings. Presents technical status and issues at milestone reviews.

10. For teams without a BSA, performs this staff member's duties, including interviewing business liaisons to diagram process flows and to write functional requirements. In the absence of the project manager, performs this staff member's duties, including coordinating daily systems analysis and development activities.

11. Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures, and verifies deliverables meet Information Security requirements.

12. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Special Factors:

1. Weekday coverage: Regularly scheduled 5-day week, Mon. - Fri., normal business hours.
2. Remote and off hours support:
3. On call:

Scope:

1. Works on multiple, medium size projects or one large project with timelines of 6 - 15 months
