job.title: Mobile Platform Developer - Multiple Openings
job.description:
As the financial landscape grows and evolves, Vanguard s systems must remain state-of-the-art and keep pace with emerging technologies. We employ IT teams to work with the newest technologies and create mobile applications that provide the best experience for our clients. We are currently seeking a Mobile Platform Developer to help us define and develop the next generation mobile application architecture.

As a member of the mobile engineering and platform team, you will be a part of the transformational effort to shape how mobile solutions are created across the enterprise. In this role, you will have impact on the engineering life cycle, including the processes, tools, and configuration used by mobile solutions teams across the enterprise. Applying enthusiasm, creativity, and inventiveness, you ll find new ways to solve challenging problems, improve existing tools and processes, and remove impediments.

How you ll spend your days...

As a Mobile Platform Developer, you ll spend your days supporting the mobile software engineering life cycle through the definition and implementation of processes and tools. You ll recommend and configure tools and services that facilitate mobile development and software engineering. Using your strong knowledge of software engineering fundamentals, you ll write, develop, analyze, and elevate code that is well structured, with a focus on testability, maintainability, security, and performance.

Mobile Platform Developers have an impact everyday by creating prototypes for experimentation with new languages, frameworks, and techniques, and participating in tests and systems analysis activities throughout the life cycle. Establishing architectural principles, and defining recommended design patterns is also part of your daily functions.

Working closely with other mobile teams, you ll propose changes to the existing methodology and technical environment, help them overcome technical challenges, and improve the quality of their solutions. Mobile Platform Developers also partner with mobile engineering teams as they onboard to the platform, and define and promote best practices and methodology across the enterprise in concert with Vanguard Next Generation Application (NGA) processes, tools, and methodology.

For this role, you are ...

  • A graduate with a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or the equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Experienced with iOS and/or Android frameworks.
  • Experienced with software engineering fundamentals including object-oriented design, data structures, dependency injection, testable code, and algorithms.
  • Experienced with at least one native mobile programming language (Java, Kotlin, Swift, Objective-C).
  • Experienced with software engineering tools, such as Xcode, Android Studio, Git, and others.
  • Able to write clean, maintainable code, and read code created by others.

To really excel in the role, you will ...

  • Be Innovative, creative, flexible and passionate about mobile software engineering, the engineering lifecycle, and creating great usable mobile solutions
  • Have a working knowledge of or proficiency with hybrid and cross-platform development approaches (Cordova, Ionic, etc.).
  • Have experience with networking and infrastructure in the context of multi-tiered software solutions across network boundaries
  • Have a demonstrated ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality
  • Be skilled in communicating technical information with both technical and non-technical peers
  • Have a working knowledge of the macOS operating system including the UNIX command line (ksh, bash, etc.).

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position.

job.title: Quality Assurance (QA) Associate II, Duarte, CA
job.description:
Quality Assurance (QA) Associate II, Duarte / Los Angeles, CA Immediate opening for a Quality Assurance (QA) Associate II with biological product manufacturing experience to work with one of our top clients in Duarte, CA. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Performs quality assurance activities for equipment, building, processes and products to ensure compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Reviews and compiles master production batch and control batch records QA project lead for manufacturing campaigns Conducts and reviews routine facility monitoring tasks. Writes, Review and process controlled documents. Provide validation/preventative maintenance support for critical equipment and write associated protocols. Maintains and creates QS tracking databases. Participate in the efforts in achieving compliance with all Federal and State accrediting agency requirements. Performs quality assurance activities for equipment, building, processes and products to ensure compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Assist QS in establishing and maintaining Quality Systems as they pertain to facility operation. Writes, reviews and processes the approval of Standard Operating Procedures. Assists in internal inspections and audits (manufacturing, QC, safety) to ensure compliance with Federal Drug Administration (FDA) regulations and company and QS policy requirements. Reviews production output batch records and assures that the proper procedures and processes have been used in the production of the products prior to approval by QA Manager. Assists QC in the review of product COA. Compile master production and control batch records. Initiate OOS/CAPA investigations, propose resolutions and process related forms. When necessary, assist with receiving, acceptance, handling, and storing of raw materials. Assist in QS streamlining activities. Responsible for the continuous operation of the facility's mechanical systems, monitoring systems and equipment. Responsible for co-coordinating preventative maintenance and maintaining cGMP compliance of all building systems and major process equipment (e.g. autoclaves, dishwashers, depyrogenation oven), as directed by QA Manager. Serve as department safety representative as directed by the QA Manger. Cooperates with other performance improvement and compliance activities in the institution. Represents Quality Assurance function through interaction with Principal Investigators as directed by QA Manager. Maintains knowledge of current regulatory/accreditation requirements, changes and issues, inspection citations, quality assurance training, management, and organizational development activities. Maintains and creates databases to track and trend monitoring data including environmental monitoring, equipment maintenance, excursions in facility operations. Analyze trends and generate reports/updates from these databases. Internal Contacts: Communicate with all manufacturing, QC and QS staff as it relates to document review & approval, master production and control batch record compilation, release test coordination, materials release/storage and facility/equipment maintenance issues. Conduct internal audits, follow-ups and write report for QAM or Senior QA Associate. Conduct internal cGMP and safety training. Train new QS personnel. Communicate with limited companydepartments for project related issues. Present project updates at project meetings and to management as requested. Present routine updates at QS team meetings. May be required to archive documents. Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. Job Requirements: Bachelor of Science (BS) degree with3 - 5 years of experience, OR Masterof Science (MS) with 0 4 years of experience. Preferred Courses/Training: Basic Biology (Molecular and Cellular) Chemistry (Inorganic, Organic and Biochemistry). Autonomous and self directed. Excellent writing skills required, including grammar and spelling. Able to correctly use technical terms and abbreviations Excellent organizational skills. GMP facility operations. job.title: Global Data Center Manager
job.description:
Description:Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications, and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com. The Agilent IT Computing Services landscape includes approximately 2500 servers (about 75% virtualized) in about 35 data centers and computer rooms around the world and in the cloud, running Microsoft Windows, RedHat Enterprise Linux or IBM AIX - all integrating with IBM, NetApp, EMC or local disk storage. Our largest Enterprise Data Center is located in Colorado Springs, CO which hosts about 80% of Agilent Critical Production Environment.

The successful candidate for this position will manage the delivery of information technology services or lead key organizational processes to meet business needs. You will identify, qualify, recommend and support solutions using external vendors and internal partners. You will manage the relationship and monitor the performance of information technology vendors contracted for the delivery of outsourced services, including assessing performance and establishing and monitoring service level agreements. May create, improve and test information technology solutions including business applications, infrastructure services and company web pages.

In coordination with Work Place Services (WPS/facilities), maintain data center standards including physical layouts, cabinet designs, electrical power configuration, hot/cold aisles, and physical security
Maintain relationships with internal WPS and external Co-Location providers in support of Agilent data center operations including account management and service levels
Review, plan & implement infrastructure for new or acquired data centers and computer rooms
Review & plan needed remediation of existing computer rooms
Asset Management including accounting for newly acquired equipment, updating records as equipment moves, fully depreciates, or is decommissioned & disposed (including proper data destruction and electronic recycling per country rules)
Drive improvements to operations by creating and implementing tools & automated solutions
Drive productivity improvements in data center & computer room operations while maintaining business continuity & performance
Ensure compliance to standards, policies & regulations (e.g. architecture, Security, SOX, FDA, PII, Privileged Access Management)
Determine and develop innovative approaches to assignments
Lead design and delivery of IT processes requiring coordination with internal and external partners
Work independently & solve a broad range of problems of varying scope and complexityDescription:Qualifications:Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or relevant technical degree
4+ years experience and in-depth knowledge of Data Center Operations & Management
Understanding of environmental requirements of IT hardware: cooling, power, service clearance, etc. Typical hardware vendors are Cisco, Dell/EMC, IBM and NetApp
Understanding of data center related components of standards such as Ashrae or Uptime Institute
Must be able to work with a global team of subject matter experts, directing activities of an outsourced support provider in day to day incident management and maintenance activities and projects
Assist in managing/driving resolution of incidents impacting the computing infrastructure
Must be willing to adjust hours of availability according to Agilent priorities in order to address matters of urgency that occur during non-standard working hours; occasional weekend and holiday coverage will be required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to communicate effectively and understand basic terminology related to Server, Storage, Database, Backup and Network technologies
Good analytical and organizational skills with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, results-driven environment
Ability to occasionally lift up to 50 pounds
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel & SharePoint


Agilent Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We value diversity at all levels. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, religion or religious creed, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, local law, ordinance, or regulation and will not be discriminated against on these bases.

job.title: Business Architect
job.description:
To provide greater clarity and structure to business objectives and help operationalize business objectives into reality by influencing and delivering creative solutions that enhance technology and process capabilities and business performance. Responsible for improved visibility into the future state of business strategies and identification of synergies between projects to ensure effective execution. To ensure improved collaboration between technology architecture and business leading to increased credibility with business partners.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Creates and maintains strategic roadmaps in alignment with technology roadmaps and business priorities and strategies
  • Collaborates with process owners to help define the desired end state for each component of the investments lifecycle
  • Contributes to business architecture principles, ensuring harmony with IT architecture principles and implementation via business processes and solution design
  • Identifies synergies between upcoming projects and in-flight projects and ensures clear communication with technology and BMO to ensure process/engineering builds are done effectively and efficiently. Ensures that the current initiatives are in line with the desired end state and/or IMG's flywheel
  • Creates and maintains heat maps/health of the business systems by ideating and collaborating with Technology Solution architects to ensure consistency in delivery in accordance to business roadmaps and strategies. Ideates and collaborates with IMFS to ensure innovation is injected into the project/program delivery pro-actively
  • Maintains strong awareness and acumen of the investments industry trends
  • Ensures vendor's capabilities are used to full state and ensures appropriate decisions are made in conjunction with technology and business to build in-house vs. use vendor solutions and evaluate pros and cons of the build vs. buy
  • Contributes to vendors roadmaps that develop capabilities to enhance Vanguard's desired end state. Reviews vendor release notes and analyze against desired end state roadmap to recommend next target release upgrade and other opportunities
  • Ensures roadmaps are documented and maintained for in-house applications. Helps define the underlying operating model
  • Participates in or leads special projects and performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree preferably in accounting, finance, economics, or related field. Graduate degree highly regarded.
  • CFA preferred. Certifications in Project Management, Six Sigma, Lean are highly regarded.
  • Minimum of twelve years business experience, five years plus project management and business analysis, five years plus in business architecture experience in Portfolio Management and/or Trading, Risk Management and Data Management, and five years plus leadership/crew development preferred.
  • Strong experience in business architect, business requirements definition and process mapping skills. Strong knowledge of industry best practices.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of the investment management lifecycle and securities markets and practices. Strong knowledge of Asset Management processes and Vanguard s processes and technology.
  • Ability to define business architecture principles and concepts. Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, ambiguous environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities with varying scope and impact.
  • Deep Knowledge of equity, fixed income and investment data and systems.
  • Proven ability to develop and manage crew. Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills. Exceptional conceptual thinking and technical skills.
  • Strong analytical skills and understanding of processes and technology.
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate at all levels including external providers and internal business clients.
  • Highly organized with a strong attention to detail. Strong persuasion and influence skills; ability to navigate and build buy-in across a matrix structure.
  • Strong knowledge in process re-engineering and quality management framework required. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications required.

Special Factors

Ability to work beyond regular business hours supporting global initiatives.
Limited international travel may be required.

job.title: Intern - IT Web/Customer Service
job.description:
Pharmacyclics is committed to the development and commercialization of novel therapies intended to improve the quality and duration of life and to resolve serious unmet medical needs for cancer patients. Pharmacyclics is a wholly-owned subsidiary of AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV), a global, research-based biopharmaceutical company. Oncology is a key therapeutic area for AbbVie, with a portfolio consisting of three marketed products and a pipeline containing multiple promising new molecules that are being studied in more than 200 clinical trials for over 20 different types of cancer.
More than 1,200 Pharmacyclics and AbbVie research scientists, clinicians, marketing, operations and corporate professionals work in the San Francisco Bay Area. They combine their expertise in immuno-oncology, stem cells, and cell-signaling with their knowledge of bispecific antibodies, antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), and covalent-inhibitor technologies to discover and develop novel cancer treatments. Together, we are striving to outsmart cancer.
Value to the Intern
Responsibilities for the IT intern will be diverse. In particular, the IT intern system analyst activities may include the following duties/aspects (individually or as a team) for small projects:
  • Work with internal customers to solve a wide range of IT requests/support issues.
  • Proactively monitor IT support areas in support of management and suggest potential fixes (prevention, training.) Areas range from infrastructure, applications, desktop, and connectivity.
  • Work with internal customers to clarify business requirements, map them to systems capabilities, and recommend technical solutions.
  • For potential Web and Mobile applications, help convert business requirements into technical terms and participate / lead the development depending on the complexity.
  • Document changes and create troubleshooting guides.
  • May need to work on several projects simultaneously in teams with other Systems Analysts and developers.
Meaningful skills developed include
  • Communication and ability to provide great customer service
  • Solving an issue from A to Z by leveraging proper planning, organization and project management
  • Wide exposure to technologies
Value to Pharmacyclics
  • Idea is to potentially convert to hire especially in the customer support area (one req to be open in Q4 2014)
  • Projects and accountabilities of the IT intern will be a mix of a helpdesk resource as well as web/mobile analyst
Education Requirements
  • Complete at least second year of university studies prior to internship start date
  • Currently enrolled and in good standing at an accredited college/university
  • BS Degrees: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, technical MBA or similar degrees.
  • Maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or equivalent
Final Presentation
Each Intern is expected to prepare a short presentation to their team to share what they have learned through their internship and how they hope their new knowledge will help them secure their future career. Presentations should be 10 - 15 minutes long and should include visual aid (posters or PowerPoint).
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

job.title: User Experience Architect
job.description:
To provide information architect services for Vanguard's web applications. To specify how users will find and use information in the site by defining its organization, navigation, labeling, page frameworks and searching systems.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provides information architect services for Vanguard's web applications. To assist in clarifying the mission and vision for the web, balancing the needs of the business and users. Identifies and resolves issues and risks before proceeding into the planning and requirements phases.
  • Works with other Information Architects, designers, coders, business representatives and usability engineers to define site functionality, organization and navigation solutions, and participates in research efforts to identify user goals and tasks.
  • Develops and writes UI Architecture Strategy and UI Design Principle documents and supporting material. Specifies how users will find and use information in the site by defining its organization, navigation, labeling, page frameworks and searching systems.
  • Conducts architecture reviews to assess impact of proposed systems on UI infrastructure. Reviews project team architecture choices. Monitors project team compliance with architecture principles and strategies and resolves UI issues elevated from project teams.
  • Manages the UI Architecture tasks, activities and deliverables for projects by planning and integrating project schedules, resources, and deliverables with all business, IT and vendor partners.
  • Uses analysis of qualitative and quantitative data such as usage reports, voice of client feedback and competitive data to drive decisions. Maps out how the site will accommodate change and growth over time.
  • Develops, governs and ensures compliance to Vanguard UI Principles and Strategies.
  • Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience in human/computer interaction, library/information science, information management or design, or technical communications. Graduate degree preferred.
  • A minimum of five years experience as an Information Architect or User Experience practitioner for large scale web sites with a diverse users.
  • Strong written, oral communication and persuasion skills.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills.
  • Experience applying qualitative and quantitative data analysis techniques to improve and enhance site, and using site usage data in creating website revisions or enhancements.

Advanced knowledge of the following UI design practices and concepts:

  • Information structure strategy creation
  • Taxonomy
  • User Research
  • Personas and user scenarios
  • Usability Testing
  • Common UI Heuristics and Principles
  • Technical writing
  • Business and user work flows
  • Logical information organization and navigation
  • Prototyping
  • Use case scenarios
  • Quality assurance methodology and Inspections
  • Thoroughly scoped functional requirements and documentation deliverables

Knowledge of the following information technologies:

  • Web Browser Infrastructure (including version compatibility, javascript, DHTML and CSS )
  • Object Oriented and Traditional Programming languages
  • Database Design
  • Internet Infrastructure
  • Web Server Infrastructure

Advanced knowledge of one or more IT platforms:

  • Microsoft Windows NT
  • Web

Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products:

  • Visio
  • Dreamweaver
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Internet Explorer

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

job.title: Senior Electric Drives Systems Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - North Carolina (US-NC) - Cary
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Senior Electric Drives Systems Engineer - 36407

Your Responsibilities

As a Senior Electric Drives Systems Engineer, for John Deere, you will plan, coordinate, and carry out the product analysis, design, and/or test activities for electric drive components and systems in Deere products. Electric drive system components include motors, generators, power inverters, safety protection devices, control systems, conductors, and connectors. In addition, you will:

  • Serve as a technical lead for turf, utility, and riding lawn equipment electric drive projects and execute product engineering development on components and systems into vehicle programs while meeting budget, schedule, and quality metrics. Product scope includes golf, commercial, and consumer products.
  • Work with the turf, utility, and riding lawn equipment engineers to define and develop the engineering requirements of electric drive systems and components Design and select the electric drive components and systems. This includes analysis of electric drive components such as electric machines, power conversion electronics, and power harnesses. This engineer will deliver electric drive solutions across multiple Deere products. Emphasis will be placed on electric machines, motor control, system control, and system design. Power electronics and wiring system detailed design knowledge is not required.
  • Work to achieve commercial goals, for example cost targets, for electric drive components and will strive to reduce development time and expense by leveraging knowledge, components, and suppliers across the enterprise.
  • Work with the turf, utility, and riding lawn equipment team to execute vehicle development by completing product design and broader functional area deliverables required for electric drive projects. This involves being part of the vehicle core teams and vehicle design teams and working closely with program management. Work with turf, utility, and riding lawn equipment engineers to integrate the electric drive system into the vehicle. This involves designing electric drive system interfaces and specifying the related vehicle systems to meet the platform's vehicle requirements.
  • Support the on-site build, commissioning, and testing of the vehicle integration aspect of the electric drive system.
  • Help commission new systems and vehicles, including trouble shooting vehicle system problems, making recommendations on software parameters, and giving technical guidance to product platforms.
  • Focus on business aspects and will strive to execute the projects according to the unit cost, NRE and capital goals.
  • Develop strategies for new products with electric drives to grow Deere market share. This includes benchmarking the competition and assessing value propositions.

US Visa sponsorship is available for this position.

What Skills You Need

  • Experience working on product development cross-functional teams and to lead the product design function for electric drives.
  • Understanding of electric drive components and systems with ability to design electric drive systems achieving vehicle program technical and financial goals in a production environment. Emphasis will be placed on electric machines, motor control, system control, and system design. Power electronics and wiring system detailed design knowledge is not required.
  • Experience working with suppliers in the application and design of electric drive system components.
  • Experience working with teams having diverse skills and from different cultural backgrounds.
  • Experience leading project teams meeting project performance, schedule, and budget goals.
  • Communication skills: Must have excellent listening skills. Chooses appropriate communication vehicle for a given situation and uses it appropriately. Written communication requirements include generating product/system requirements documents of significant magnitude, creating technical reports suitable for long-term archiving, and creating presentations. Verbal communication requirements include making presentations and participating in meetings.
  • 4+ years Product Engineering experience
  • 3+ years Product Design experience
  • 1+ years experience leading technical projects

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • 1-3 years Deere product development experience relating to vehicle programs (or equivalent industry product development experience)
  • 3-5 years Technical experience relating to the design and development electric drive systems
  • 2-4 years experience in component development of electric machines and algorithm development for motor control and system control
  • Experience in project management
  • Knowledge of vehicle systems interfacing with electric drives. Examples include engines, gearboxes, and vehicle controllers..
  • Advanced technical degree in electric drive field
  • Experience with vehicle engineering (examples include golf, utility, and riding lawn equipment)

Education (or equivalent work experience)

  • Ideally you will have a Bachelor s degree in Electrical Engineering with emphasis on power conversion, electric machines, power electronics, electric drive control, and/or similar technologies.
  • Strong practical experience in electric drive technology product application.
  • Advanced technical degree, Masters level or greater, is desired.

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Quality Director East Texas Area Direct Hire! Kelly Scientific Resources is currently seeking a Quality & Regulatory Director for one of our top manufacturing dietary supplement/pharmaceutical client located in East Texas area. job.title: Lead Marketing Database Analyst
job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. More customers. More network. More locations. More opportunities for you. With a global presence in 60 countries, service to more than 350 metro areas domestically, and more than 200,000 miles of fiber; Employer is going places. At Employer, we believe in growth and innovation, for our customers and our employees. Discover how Employer can expand your potential and take your career to new places if youre looking to join a company that celebrates diversity and creativity, with industry-leading benefits and commitment to employee advancement. Were committed to bringing great talent to our team to help us change the world. One network connection at a time.

Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

This position is critical in maintaining the quality and efficiency of information within Consumer Marketing infrastructure. Responsibilities include delivering code, conducting research, and checking quality control and assurances that will result in high quality data processing and data integrity.

This position will help incorporatethe processes that will result in accelerated sales, increased market awareness and high levels of customer loyalty. The position is instrumental in helping maximize revenue and profitability through contribution to or ownership of targeting strategies designed to acquire, grow and retain consumer customers.

Job Description

  • Responsible for supporting corporate strategy and managing marketing data marts.
  • Develops and enhances applications, whichsupport high-level objectives for acquisition, retention, and cross-selling.
  • Experienced translator of custom data requests into deliverable technical support.
  • Collects, adjusts, augments, and organizes large and detailed marketing requirements into logical technical requirements; manages a unified marketing data platform that will provide a comprehensive basis for lead generation, reporting and analysis.
  • Source data would include internal as well as external data sources that may contain demographics, product availability, customer subscription, and prospect attribute information.

Qualifications

Required

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and relevant experience
  • 6 - 8 years related experience.
  • 3 - 5 years experience in database marketing, in IT, preferably with BI applicationsenvironment
  • Advanced Skills in various Database extracts leveraging PL / SQL, Perl, Kornshell
  • High level knowledge of relational datamart strategy

Preferred:

  • 5+ years of database experience with a Master's Degree
  • 3 + years experience with Qlikview, Tableau, or other BI Dashboard
  • Ability to break down complex problems into manageable goals
  • Experience data modeling and analyzing data within a data warehouse environment to support specific marketing plans

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent in Marketing

Alternate Location: US-Arizona-Phoenix; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Florida-Apopka; US-Louisiana-Monroe

job.minor_category0: [Information Technology] Business Systems Analyst And IT Consultant

job.title: BI Solutions Architect-Open location
job.description:
Support the design and development of CH2M s Program Performance Portal application and other custom applications for our clients in delivering some of the world s most complex programs.

As a business solutions expert, you will be part of a team focused on developing applications and tools required for collection, integration, analysis and presentation of business information to support better business decisions. Working independently, and with other team members in a consulting environment, and with internal and external clients, you will design and develop solutions required to deliver some of the world s most complex programs. In addition to supporting the evolution of the Performance Portal, you will design and develop new software applications and/or major enhancements to existing software applications to support the clients business requirements and technical environment. The successful candidate will act as a recognized technology thought leader and industry expert.
Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical consulting on complex projects.
  • Design information management solution(s) that must consider a variety of IT and business-related planning issues.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of information solution/system implementations supporting a broad array of business processes.
  • Provide consulting expertise in conducting and gathering functional requirements and translating these into technical solutions.
  • Work with program management teams to define business and system requirements in order to ensure successful completion by meeting client needs on budget and schedule.
  • Establish clear lines of communication with project team and client to ensure project deliverables meet defined quality standards.
  • Provide consulting expertise in design, development and implementation of IT architectures.
  • Provide technical input and support to CH2M business development teams as required.
  • Identify additional performance metrics and applications to enhance or supplement existing tools.

This role can be performed from any of our US offices or by telework. If you re up for the challenge and want to deliver innovative, unique and unexpected solutions, join our team and help us successfully deliver some of the world s most challenging programs.

The minimum qualifications for this position are:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Math, or Engineering or an additional 4 years experience
  • 15 years work experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experienced designing, developing, deploying, maintaining, and supporting web applications and implementing innovative technical solutions in a consulting environment or as a Consultant.
  • Thrives working both independently and collaborative with a remote team.
  • Strong data management, analytical and technical troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving, design, development and debugging skills.
  • Ability to work independently or within a team to meet aggressive deadlines.
  • Skilled in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS with a working knowledge of responsive design techniques for multiple platforms.
  • Experience developing modern web applications using frameworks and other client-side libraries, e.g. Backbone, React, Angular.
  • Knowledgeable in MVC, MVVM, and other software development patterns.
  • Demonstrated web design and UI/UX experience.
  • Experience with a variety of hardware, software, networks, and operating systems.
  • Strong can-do attitude.
  • Adept at recognizing client needs and coordinating/executing activities that respond directly to these needs.
  • Experience working with clients to define requirements, develop estimates for the level of effort, scheduling milestones and releases

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:In addition to the Basic Qualifications, the ideal candidate will have demonstrated expertise working on a wide variety of software development projects including web/cloud-based and mobile business solutions and underlying technologies. The successful candidate will possess strong technical troubleshooting skills and excellent problem-solving, design, development and debugging skills in a software development capacity. Additional areas of benefit include broad experience in use and development of Geographic Information Systems and developing Business Intelligence solutions including reports and dashboards.
At CH2M, the greatest challenges provide the biggest rewards. Each day, your drive and creative ideas will be providing solutions that help build a better tomorrow. Whether it is the pride that comes with accomplishment, personal growth or making a difference in the world, you will discover true success in a career that brings out the best in you at CH2M. Ready? Let s get to work. Developing People through Challenging Projects CH2M is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.
CH2M will not sponsor a work visa such as a H1-B to fill this position.

CH2M is an Equal Opportunity Employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

job.title: Domain Expert - Data Governance
job.description:
Data Governance Domain Expert

Our Team

Youll be part of the data governance domain expert team that support our sales organization.

  • Part of history at Employer with the Industry's first Enterprise Data Governance platform
  • Built upon Employers successful track record
  • In dynamic and fast-growing environment withour new family of data governance products. Be part of a team and put your fingerprints on shaping our message, product, customer implementations, sales, etc

If you are passionate about the following, this job is for you:

  • Working directly with business leaders to help solve business challenges
  • Strong understanding of the data governance discipline, with experience driving adoption and roll-out
  • Proponent of New Data Governance dynamic, flexible, and collaborative. Supporting business outcomes and digital transformation
  • Data Quality
  • Data Management
  • Technology as an Enabler

Your Responsibilities

Conduct Discovery and Build Key Relationships
  • Seek to understand our customers data governance challenges, opportunities
  • Understand their business drivers, use cases, roles and personas that need to be addressed during the sale
  • Inspire them on the value of Data Governance by sharing customer success stories, sharing your own experiences, and showing them the art of the possible related to their business
  • Develop key relationships with the customer at all levels of the organization
Support the Sales Cycle with Account Management
  • Conduct the discovery calls with customers and develop key relationships from the start
  • Demonstrate solving today's challenges and the art of the possible
    • Demosconduct demo that resonates with customers objectives
    • DG consultinghow to get started, implementation planning, getting buy in
    • POCsoversee the POC objectives, content to align to use case stories, POC read out, success/outcomes reporting
    • RFPsoversee responses and support Pre-Sales team
  • Advise/consult on how best to win the opportunity
    • Provide account team with details to win the opportunity
    • Provide advice on the account plan steps
    • Provide competitive intelligence
  • Transition the Customer from Sales to Post-Sales
    • Intro to GCS, IPS and Product Management
  • Post sale checkpoint
    • Opportunity to expand DG footprint
    • Collect Success Stories to share publicly
Work collaboratively with R&D
  • Share feedback from the field about features to increase product attraction
  • Contribute to the roadmap.
    • Features requested by prospects and customers
    • Trends in market
    • Share feedback on roadmap
  • Align in consistent messaging and positioning
    • Create/modify presentation material
Work collaboratively with Professional Services
  • Seamless working relationship with adoption services
  • Feedback on services and delivery approach
  • Feedback on delivery performance
  • Seek feedback on preparing customer and PS on adoption
Work collaboratively with Partners
  • Support Partners during their sales cycle with customers
  • Support sales cycle as identified by Strategic Account Managers

Qualifications

At least 10 years of leadership experienceas a customer, software vendor, consultant. Experience with defining the vision and strategy, influencing peers and senior leadership to buy into strategy and responsibility for implementing a holistic solution (organization roles, processes and technology).

At least 5 years in leading a Data Governance Program by working across the organization to establish a sustainable, collaborative data governance program.

  • Demonstrate experience successfully implementing holistic data management/governance solutions with technology as an enabler data governance, analytics, data quality, cataloging, metadata management, etc.
  • Highly desirablehands-on Data Governance software experience.
  • Have a public presence with written pieces on Data Governance and public speaking at conferences.
  • Energetic and enthusiastic about Data Governance and enjoy working with customers to solve business challenges
  • Ability to traverse across strategic and tactical workstrategic conversations to hands-on demonstrations
  • Ability to work with a diverse set of customer rolesC-Suite to trenches
  • Experience \"selling\" concepts, solutions within an organization or formal sales position
  • Travel is expected to be anywhere from 50-80% across North America

Additional information

Employer LLC offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, retirement, flexible time off and more. Our generous benefits vary depending on your geographic work location. Its an exciting time to work at Employer. You can learn more about our company, our products and services at www.informatica.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

job.title: Sr. Facilities QA Specialist
job.description:
Pharmacyclics is an AbbVie company focused on developing and commercializing innovative small-molecule therapies for the treatment of certain cancers and immune-mediated diseases. Our hope is that we can change or improve the standard of care for the disease areas we treat or study to continually advance cancer care for patients. Pharmacyclics and its partner, Janssen Biotech, developed and commercialize IMBRUVICA (ibrutinib), a first-in-class, oral, once-daily therapy that inhibits a protein called Bruton's tyrosine kinase (BTK). BTK is a key signaling molecule in the B-cell receptor that plays an important role in the survival and spread of malignant B cells. IMBRUVICA blocks signals that tell malignant B cells to multiply and spread uncontrollably. To date, more than 65,000 patients around the world have been treated with IMBRUVICA in clinical practice and clinical trials. The IMBRUVICA clinical development program is one of the most robust for a single molecule in the industry with nearly 30 company sponsored trials underway, 14 of which are Phase 3. In addition, there are more than 100 investigator-sponsored ibrutinib trials taking place around the world. Pharmacyclics is located in Sunnyvale, California, in Silicon Valley.

Pharmacyclics is adding to its Facilities team a Facilities QA. The ideal candidate will implement best practices to streamline QA compliance operations within the facility department. This individual Performs documentation reviews thoroughly, with a high attention to detail, using extensive working knowledge of quality concepts and internal procedures and controls. Supports GMP compliance. The candidate will also assist with the implementation of a CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System), EMS (Environmental Monitoring System) application to support assets, and work orders, and monitor critical equipment for the site. The position is responsible for providing a wide range of critical support for Facilities Services. The focus of the position will be QA coordination, planning, scheduling and communication of non GxP and GxP work. Review and update company guidelines, procedures.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and Procedures
  • QA review for Deviations, Change request, NCR, and CAPA, and investigations associated with cGMP compliance. Supports change controls related to Quality topics.
  • Writes new documents and revises existing documents, independently.
  • Develops and provides training on department-specific procedures and systems.
  • Participates in internal or supplier audits as needed.
  • Maintenance of the Equipment Qualification and Equipment Maintenance / Calibration Program.
  • Train employees on Quality System Procedures.
  • Review Calibration, Maintenance, and Unscheduled Work Orders for the Facilities Group and outside vendors.
  • Providing a clear understanding of the Core Technology quality management system requirements (provided by standards, business partners, and regulations)
  • Writing defensible rationales that follow good technical writing practices (background, supporting evidence, broader justi cation and a decisive conclusion)
  • Participating in selection, qualification, and management of suppliers and service providers
Preparing for and participating in customer, third party, or regulatory audits
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks, prepare metrics and meet deadlines.
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team environment to accomplish goals.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate effectively with site personnel, peers and management.
  • Experience with supplier quality systems and performing internal audits
  • Solid understanding of GMP utility systems and manufacturing process equipment.
  • Previous experience with CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System), EMS (Environmental Monitoring System) and BMS (Building Automation Systems) is a plus.
  • Experience working within QSI Released Documents, Engineering Change Request, Corrective action and NCMR databases
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years of experience as a QA Specialist within cGMP regulated industry.
  • Must have Pharmaceutical industry experience.
  • Computer proficiency on CAD, Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and Microsoft Project preferred.
  • Must have experience writing AND reviewing SOPs
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft office (Excel/Word)

job.title: User Experience Interaction Designer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Urbandale
Function: Product Engineering
Title: User Experience Interaction Designer - 36648

Your Responsibilities

*** Please Note: This posting may serve to fill multiple positions. ***

As a User Experience Interaction Designer for John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG) located in Urbandale, IA, you will be responsible for creating User Interaction task flows, as well as developing mock-ups, storyboards and prototypes to effectively communicate designs to product owners and development teams. In addition you will:

  • Apply knowledge of usability, human factors, and UI processes to create intuitive user experiences.
  • Work with development teams to ensure that new features are implemented according to specifications.
  • Assist team members in pre and post-development usability testing.
  • Create and maintain project and overall system design artifacts.

*** U.S. visa sponsorship is NOT available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • Experienced in the use of at least two of the following design and prototyping tools: Sketch, InVision, Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Axure, Balsamic or Hype.
  • Demonstrated strong visual design aesthetics
  • Demonstrated use of typography principles
  • Demosntratred ability to translate customer needs into designs and present to technical team members.
  • Ability and willingness to travel domestically and/or internationally.

Please note: Prior to selection for interview, candidates will be required to provide a portfolio of work.

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Experience with Sketch and InVision.
  • Experience with agriculture, construction vehicles or similar industry.
  • Working knowledge of software development and testing practices.
  • Experience working with remote development teams.
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies.

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Arts/Science in a Design or User Experience related field (Graphic Design, Industrial Design, Interaction Design, etc.).

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Illinois (US-IL) - East Moline
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Electric Drive Systems Engineer - 36408

Your Responsibilities

As an Electric Drive Systems Engineer, for John Deere, you will plan, coordinate, and carry out the product analysis, design, and/or testing activities for electric drive components and systems used on vehicles worldwide. Electric drive system components include motors, generators, power inverters, safety protection devices, control systems, conductors, and connectors. You will:

  1. Perform analysis and design of the electric drive system design consisting of electric machines, power electronics, control systems, wiring systems, and related systems. Make recommendations to optimize system performance, while meeting the application requirements.
  2. Work with product platform groups to translate customer needs and platform requirements into electric drive system and component requirements while taking particular care at interfaces, meeting program requirements (performance, cost, quality and schedule), diagnostic needs, environmental requirements, and applicable industry standards.
  3. Work with platform product engineering to execute product design through technology development, critical component development, and product development formal processes.
  4. Work with product platform engineers to integrate electric drive systems on Deere vehicles. This involves designing and defining mechanical, signal, fluid, and electrical power interfaces.
  5. Within EDSG, execute the critical component development process. Duties include managing work flow, supporting documentation creation, and common practices such as FMEAs, design reviews, FGRs, change management, product validation, product verification, and diagnostic development.
  6. Collaborate with Deere platforms, Tech Center India (TCI), consultants and suppliers for system and component analysis, design, and development. This will include interfacing with other analysis functions such as heat transfer modeling, dynamic modeling, noise and vibration analysis, finite element analysis, etc.
  7. Contribute to identifying potential electric drive applications with differentiating value to customers, working with vehicle platforms.
  8. Lead problem resolution with technology on vehicle platform applications. Works closely with platform engineers to understand, define and correct technical problems.

US Visa sponsorship is available for this position.

What Skills You Need

  • 2+ years experience with simulation/modeling tools such as MATLAB/Simulink.
  • Excellent communication and listening skills. Written communication requirements include generating product/system requirements documents of significant magnitude, creating technical reports suitable for long-term archiving, and creating presentations.
  • 1+ years technical work experience relating to the design or testing of electric drive systems
  • 2+ years product engineering experience
  • 1+ years product design experience
  • 1+ years work experience relating to the design or testing of electric drives components such as electric machines, power electronics, connectors and conductors

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Lab experience in electric drive technology including power electronics and electric machines.
  • Advanced technical degree in the electric drives technical area
  • Knowledge of diesel engine systems and control.
  • Knowledge of mechanical drives that interface with electric motors and generators
  • Knowledge of power electronic inverter construction and cooling
  • Knowledge of different electric machine types and forms
  • Knowledge of testing electric drive systems and components
  • Knowledge of control system design both at motor control and system control level

Education (or equivalent work experience)

Ideally you will have:

  • Bachelor s degree in engineering with supporting studies in electric drive control, electric machine components and/or power electronics (or equivalent experience)
  • Advanced technical degrees are desired

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

As a User Experience Interaction Designer for John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG) located in Urbandale, IA you will be responsible for creating navigation structures, User Interaction task flows, as well as developing mock-ups, storyboards and prototypes to effectively communicate designs to product owners and development teams. In addition you will:

  • Demonstrated use of typography principles.
  • Experience translating customer needs into designs and presenting that design to technical team members.
  • Experience in roles that demonstrated an ability to work on multiple projects.
  • Demonstrated effective communication and presentation skills, including the ability to lead design discussions and workshops.

What Makes You Stand Out

  • Two or more years of experience influencing stakeholders to drive an intentional design philosophy.
  • Two or more years of experience understanding and applying visual brand guidelines/style guides.
  • Experience working with remote development teams.
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies.
  • Experience applying a broad range of User Research tools.

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Arts/Science in a Design or User Experience related field (Graphic Design, Industrial Design, Interaction Design, etc.).

job.title: CAD designer - Mechanical Design - Corvallis, OR
job.description:
Support our water clients across the U.S. and have a hand in transforming tomorrow.
Our Mechanical CAD Technician position is your chance to work on exciting and engaging large-scale construction designs for industrial, water, government, and military projects. Each day, you will work on a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team preparing drawings and sketches using CAD workstations, appropriate design criteria, and technical manuals often working closely with engineers to coordinate designs. You will have deep knowledge of procedures and technical concepts within the electrical and telecom disciplines, and understand regulations and standards for your area. You will also evaluate and resolve problems by reviewing multiple sources of information and drawing conclusions. You should be a self-motivated professional with an interest in electrical design, and have a desire to grow personally as well as professionally with each job.
Our CAD Technicians:
Have knowledge of basic drafting practices.
Are familiar with CAD principles (i.e., text placement and editing, layering, snap, precision input, etc).
Have the ability to perform basic geometric and trigonometric calculations and use basic drafting equipment.
Are able to communicate with team members to understand objectives, expectations, and preferred methods, proactively identify changes or issues, and ask questions that foster the development of self and team.
Organize their own assignments to ensure deadlines are met.
Work under direct supervision, prepare electronic drawing files within project standards, using sketches, layouts, project instructions and notes.
Have experience working with AutoCAD, Revit, or Microstation, and Microsoft Office.

The minimum qualifications for this position are:
Associate s Degree in in CAD drafting
5 years experience working with AutoCAD or Microstation or both
0.5-2 years experience with 3D modeling software such as Microstation, Revit, or AECOsim
0-6 months experience with Microsoft Office
Experience in drafting of piping

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:8-10 years working with Microstation, Revit, and/or Projectwise preferred
Relocation will not be offered

job.description:
Location: Idlewild Ave, Tampa, FL

Reporting to: S Mgr, Operations

Department: Ops-Provider Operations

Provides functional business knowledge and technical support to the business unit through developed and ad hoc analysis/reporting , as well as designing and programming new processes/reports. Acts as subject matter expert for department or business unit on business systems/applications. Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people. Performs application/system design and implementation. Documents development requirements. Consults with end users to test and debug applications to meet client needs.

Essential Functions:

  • Develops ad-hoc reports to conduct data analysis and validation.
  • Confers with area/department to analyze current operational procedures and trends and identify problems.
  • Conducts business analysis and recommends technical alternative solutions to management as to course of action that best meets the organization's goals.
  • Research, evaluate and assess the financial impact of issues identified in data/processes.
  • Supports, troubleshoots, and maintains systems and applications as required, optimizing performance, resolving problems, and providing timely follow-up on identified issues.
  • Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems.
  • Creates multiuser, real-time, robust database solutions.
  • Acts as content expert to provide business and technical expertise in requirements solicitation, system analysis, technical design, programming and documentation of business applications/systems.
  • May be responsible for monitoring and reporting to management on the status of departmental projects: Anticipates and identifies issues that could inhibit achieving the project goals and objectives, and implementing corrective actions and mitigation strategies.

  • Intermediate Demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skills

job.title: Mac OSX Software Engineer
job.description:
MAC OSX Software Engineer

Woodbridge, VA

**U.S. citizens ONLY due to government or federal requirement**

Can you perform neurosurgery on a MAC? Do you know the relationship between GCC and Xcode? Do you want to be part of a team heavily involved in keeping our nation secure every day? If so, we have a job for you.

Description:

Employer is seeking top-notch software engineers to develop specialized software within a first-class team of developers, computer scientists, and cyber specialists. You will want to have tinkered with OSX internals ( Xcode IDE, GCC development, debugging Mac applications/drivers, and the like ) to be successful in this position.

Your work will give you direct access to the federal customer, as well as other contractors, who participate in the software tool design and development process, product deployment, and support of new and ongoing operations. Employer is determined to provide our customers with unique capabilities and expertise that other company's lack. We operate as a high-performance team dedicated to maintaining the top technical talent to perform the customer's mission - our number one priority. If you are enamored by technology and eager to sink your teeth into something new, we want to meet you.



Qualifications:
  • A minimum of 4 years of computer engineering experience
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience working with MAC OSX internals including memory management, security features, and MAC API
  • Proficiency programming in Objective-C
  • Experience with Shell Scripting

Applicants selected for employment may be subject to a federal background investigation and may need to meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials.

Desired Experience:
  • Ability to program using Assembly, Python, and C/C++
  • Knowledge of how operating systems work from \"user mode\" code right through to the kernel; Operating Systems Architecture
  • Experience using IDA Pro to determine how an application works and processes data. This could include x86, ARM, ARM64 etc.
  • Experience with mitigation techniques (ASLR, Stack cookies, non-executable memory).
  • Encryption - A good understand of how symmetrical and asymmetrical encryption works, certificate chain of trust, crypto weaknesses etc.

job.title: Manager IT Strategic Sourcing
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Responsible and accountable for the proper creation and execution of key outsourcing contracts and ensuring adherence to financial, operational, and legal standards. Creates and maintains a best in class governance team which delivers IT Solutions, while meeting the changing needs of Employer business. This position will have a direct impact on efficiencies by establishing and maintaining quality service provider relationships via defined processes, contract requirements and oversight practices.

Job Description

  • Creates and delivers solutions to bring best practices to sourcing for IT initiatives. Works with IT teams to elicit their requirements for sourcing.
  • Develops and implements program and profit/negotiation strategy to achieve best price and/or enhancement consideration with suppliers, supporting the specific needs of the client.
  • Develops, tracks, and manages vendor performance and metrics, including over 300 SLAs.
  • Manages contract audits and/or benchmarking activities to establish appropriate corrective and preventative actions for any significant contract or program related issues.
  • Manages IT Asset Management best practices and policies to drive integration, improvements, and content compliance/ accuracy in order for critical data to be available throughout the company.
  • Defines, implements, and continuously improves operational core competencies and processes with a focus on success and customer satisfaction through the implementation of metrics to ensure daily operations meet all customer and division requirements in a predictable and repeatable manner.
  • Pursues cost reduction through cross functional management of metrics, processes, reduced rework, reduced cycle time, etc. while fully achieving objectives.
  • Understands and applies disciplined root cause analysis techniques and designs and employs detailed monthly operations reviews that are dependent on an appropriate metric set to ensure fast, steady progress in operations performance and continuous improvements.
  • Liaises and promotes collaboration with all other functional elements of the business, specifically including IT operations, IT development/ test, and the PMO to drive service delivery to meet customer, system, and cost requirements. Leads the prioritization and work efforts for the vendor teams.
  • Manages escalations and disputes with the vendors and Employer business units to ensure focus on successful delivery and budget within the terms of the contract.
  • Develops and manages budget plans including tracking monthly charges, credits, and forecasts Provides input to annual budget planning.
  • Develops and implements tools, reports and processes to assist in the successful management of outsourcing agreements.
  • Ensures vendor compliance with all corporate policies and procedures, including SOX and security requirements.
  • Supports all sourcing negotiations and re-negotiations directly with vendors, in collaboration with procurement, legal, finance, HR, and risk management. Leads negotiations for any updates and changes to existing terms.
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Required

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Subject matter expertise in the Outsourcing and /or Offshoring industry (3+ years)
  • Understanding of Vendor landscape
  • Ability to interact at all levels of the business and vendor organizations
  • IT Development and Operations experience (10 years)
  • Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements
  • Exemplifies critical thinking, troubleshooting and strong analytical skills
  • Experience managing to and interpreting Contracts
  • Basic accounting and experience managing large budgets
  • Excellent written and verbal skills, ability to create and present proposals to Leaders (5 years)

Preferred

  • Experience with large-scale outsourcing contract management
  • Previous experience negotiating and transitioning an organization to a sourced or offshore model (2 years)
  • Ability to travel 10-20%

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Denver; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Nebraska-Omaha; US-Utah-Salt Lake City

job.title: LEAD PROJECT MANAGER
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Develops, plans and manages implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for external/internal customers.

Job Description

Employer has an immediate need for a Lead Project Managerwith the Governance team, whose responsibilities include ensuringthat IT and business unit needs are fully aligned with the companys primary objectives while improving collaboration and strategic partnerships. This position is responsible for processing all IT intake for new efforts, managing the approval, prioritizationand Business Case process for IT investment work, Run the Business (RTB)requests, business case metrics reporting to all business units, and performing after action reviews for targeted programs.

  • Responsible for budget and expense control forprogram and strategic alignment of program to business unit objectives.
  • Analyzes work plans and schedules.
  • Develops methodologies, procedures, and systems to produce financial reporting.
  • Acts asprogram team leader for material change to programs after approval.
  • Developsprogress and status reports.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the companys IT investment budget is applied to system enhancements that align to corporate strategic initiatives and provide the highest return on investment.
  • Manage the companys business case approval process for IT investments while complying with corporate Finance approval standards and guidelines.
  • Lead regular meetings between cross-functional business and IT teams to review new IT program requests (intake), assess business purpose and benefits, and ultimately determine overall business priority.
  • Conduct financial after action reviews on targeted IT programs and present those findings to IT/Business Governance Director and senior management.
  • Analyze program worthiness by comparing financial metric information such as Net Present Value, Payback, Internal Rate of Return and others.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of the tactical and strategic business objectives of the company and be able to effectively communicate these to all levels.
  • Enhance the flow of information and communication across multiple organizational boundaries.
  • Demonstrate leadership to identify programs at risk and work with business and IT teams to mitigate with minimal budget and schedule impacts.
  • Lead ad hoc meetings between business and IT to expedite issue resolution and enable faster solution delivery.
  • Display basic knowledge and understanding of Software Development Lifecycle methodologies, concepts and best practices.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • 6 - 8 years of related experience.
  • PMP Certification or equivalent preferred.
  • Minimum of five years of program & portfolio management or IT Management experience.
  • Fundamental knowledge of financial principles such as NPV, Payback, IRR, ROI and others.
  • Minimum of three years experience coordinating and/supporting IT business processes.
  • Experience managing program schedules, budgets and communications.
  • Ability to negotiate and reach agreements between business organizations and IT.
  • Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
  • Ability to solve complex problems through analytical approach.
  • Ability to use web conferencing, teleconferencing, and video conferencing tools.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite.
  • Strong organizational, presentation, and customer relationship skills.
  • Process knowledge with regard to estimation, development methods such as Agile, Dev Ops etc and process improvement background a plus.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Data analytics and/or business objects skills a plus
  • Strong group presentation skills.
  • Some occasional travel may be required on a limited basis.
