job.title: AWS - Cloud Architect
job.description:
To assist in the execution of the vision, future direction, and initiative roadmap for strategic technology projects. To help define the reference and implementation Architectures for strategic technology projects. To persuade and influence Business and Information Technology (IT) leaders on the architectural direction for strategic technology projects.

Duties and Responsibilities

1. Provides the architectural leadership in shaping strategic technology projects, which focus on both Business of IT (e.g.,TBD) and LOB-specific (e.g., TBD) strategic technology projects.

2. Continuously pursues strong technical acumen:

  • Establishes working relationships with strategic and boutique technology providers.
  • Leverages knowledge capital available through subscription research services.
  • Leverages the Internet as a critical resource for related knowledge capital, inclusive of blogs, podcasts, webinar, etc.
  • Attends conferences and engages in associated activities (e.g., conducting presentations, leading workshops, etc.).
  • Consumes and contributes content from and to Open Source communities.

3. Provides architecture thought leadership and expertise.

4. Defines reference and implementation architectures.

5. Develops proof-of-concept prototypes and initial implementation models.

6. Monitors implementation activity to ensure architecture and design principles are upheld.

7. Ensures implementation solutions support architecture objectives (availability, scalability, performance, security, etc.), as appropriate.

8. Communicates complicated technical concepts effectively to a broad group of stakeholders.

9. Establishes relationships with IT leaders, architects, and technical specialists for the purpose of advancing proposed architectural solutions.

job.title: Captioning Specialist
job.description:
GET TO KNOW ALORICA.

Alorica is one of the biggest companies you ve never heard of. We only do one thing make lives better, one interaction at a time. We re a global leader in customer service and experience, serving the world s biggest brands with over 90,000 employees in more than 100 locations around globe.

Working at Alorica means having the freedom to explore all kinds of career opportunities. You can choose from several positions customer service, tech support, management serving a wide variety of clients in healthcare, insurance, finance and consumer technology. And you can choose to work at a site, work from home, stay where you are or transfer to a totally new location.

Alorica offers fun, challenging opportunities for personal and professional development. We want you to have fun and succeed, because when you re at your best, that s when we re at our best.

Let s make lives better. Let s defy the status quo. And let s go beyond thinking outside the box and decide to obliterate the box instead.

You ready? Let s do this.

Our client, is a federally funded telecommunications relay program that provides assistance to the deaf and hard of hearing community by efficiently and accurately re-voicing telephone conversations between a hearing party and a person with hearing loss via speech recognition software.

Captioning Agents send real time text captions to customers using voice-to-text transcription software. This service allows Americans with hearing loss to use the telephone for their daily communication needs.

This job requires the Captioning Agent to use their voice with the software to capture conversations. The agent must accurately repeat the conversation verbatim in real time.



This position is located in Omaha, Nebraska (9910 Maple St, Omaha, NE 68134) and is not available as a work-at-home.

Minimum Qualification Requirements

  • Maintain quality standards for speed and accuracy
  • Abide by strict Confidentiality Agreement
  • Ability to focus and repeat heard language clearly in order to provide fast and accurate captioning on telephone calls
  • Ability to enunciate clearly while separating words and emphasizing word endings
  • Outstanding English grammar skills and vocabulary
  • Excellent hearing and ability to discern meaning from a variety of accents, regional dialects and areas of knowledge
  • Strong short-term memory recall and focus with ability to re-voice verbatim what is heard in real time
  • High work ethic standards. Ability to self-monitor to meet individual and team quality and attendance goals

Benefits of the Captioning Agent Position:

  • Low Stress Environment
  • No Sales
  • No Customer Interaction
  • No Escalations
  • Fun Work Environment

About Alorica:

Alorica is an equal opportunity employer and committed to diversity in its workforce. Alorica recruits qualified applicants and makes all employment-related decisions based exclusively on job-related qualifications, without regard to characteristics such as race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other status protected by law.

job.title: Senior Consultant Master Data Management
job.description:
Location: Eastern region of the U.S.; Remote

Our Team
Employer Professional Services (IPS) provides the product expertise, and project management knowledge to deliver the most architecturally efficient and cost effective solution for our customers data integration projects. Because our practice serves the largest and most diverse Employer customer base, our work keeps us on the cutting edge of all forms of data management projects B2B, Data Governance, Data Migration and Consolidation, Data Quality Management, Data Synchronization, Data Warehousing, Integration Competency Centers, Master Data Management, and Services Oriented Architectures. Whether it is a short or long-term engagement, we are dedicated to sharing our knowledge to ensure our customers continued success with our products.

Your Opportunity
The Senior Consultant will work closely with customers, partners and Employer staff to deploy best-of-class Employer MDM solutions. This position requires a highly skilled principal level consultant with Data Architecture, RDBMS and Java experience. The successful candidate will work in a wide variety of pre-sales and post-sales activities, including pre-sales due diligence, post-sales customer deployments and third-level customer support.

Your Responsibilities

Deliver high quality customer solutions in adherence to Employer/Siperian methodology
Develop logical and physical database schemas, stored procedures, interfaces (in Java or XML), and extensions to customer proprietary solutions
Provide technical depth concerning Employer/Siperian solutions in discussions with customers, partners and internal resources

Your Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
7+ years of Enterprise Data Warehouse and/or Master Data Management (MDM) - functional and/or technical experience
7+ years development/analysis/design/administration
5+ years experience with either Oracle and/or DB2/UDB
Experience with J2EE environment including experience with application servers (WebLogic, WebSphere and/or JBoss)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to facilitate discussions and drive toward quick decisions, be a team lead
Professional on-site customer integration experience, preferably with a large systems integration firm or for an enterprise software services arm
Experience developing conceptual and physical solution architectures for solutions incorporating heterogeneous applications, technologies and platforms
Strong understanding of data modeling, physical schema properties, triggers, and stored procedures
Experience designing and deploying in a Services Oriented Architecture and/or an Events Driven Architecture
Ability to \"think big\" and grasp the overall picture, including the business drivers
Must be able to solve problem outside your areas of expertise
Willingness to travel 75%

Desirable
Experience with UNIX and shell script programming
Ability to automate administration tasks, perform capacity planning, performance monitoring and tuning and administer security
Experience with optimization of high volume databases (>300GB) and large, distributed J2EE applications
Experience with Linux /Solaris/HP/Windows/AIX Server administration
Strong understanding of CRM and/or ERP packages (SAP, Oracle, Siebel and Peoplesoft)
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL tools

job.title: Production Manager
job.description:
Company Summary

Employer Title Insurance Companys National Commercial Services division provides single-point service for simple to multi-property/multi-state national commercial real estate transactions. One of the largest title insurers in the nation, Employer traces its history to 1889 and was named one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and 2017. For more information, visit www.firstam.com

Job Summary

At the direction of the NCS Florida State Manager, this position ensures that all title search and examinations for Florida commercial orders are competently, accurately and timely completed in accordance with Company guidelines and client expectations. This position requires a high output production individual to develop and lead a commercial production team, execute on all commercial title production initiatives, personally examine and underwrite a workload of customer orders (particularly complex files) as needed, and efficiently exploit existing customer resources and personnel to achieve the Florida production and national production needs of National Commercial Services.

Essential Job Performance Objectives - Leadership Goals:

Selects, trains and develops exam staff to optimize competency levels and combination within the work team. This may include creating and conducting a training program for Commercial Real Estate Title Examiners, as well as creating a training manual for the training program.

Constantly evaluates personnel staffing levels; to include monthly staffing reviews with NCS Florida State Manager and peer management partners.

Gives clear direction to work team members about team goals, work priorities and individual responsibilities.

Meets with all reports to discuss and negotiate annual goals for performance, outcomes and professional conduct with individual team members

Ensures work is delegated appropriately to prioritize and balance workloads across NCS Florida production team to ensure on time delivery of title commitments/reports.

Coaches, mentors or counsels work team members as necessary to develop skills, knowledge and techniques, including timely performance appraisals.

Reviews and provides honest and constructive feedback on work team and individual performance and encourages a work environment in which employees feel able to admit to and learn from mistakes.

Values the contribution of team members and encourages participation and collaboration within the work team to create a positive and productive work culture.

Essential Job Functions:

a) Timely respond to and satisfactorily resolve new title order priorities, resource conflicts, outside searcher engagements for title reports or commitment orders made by Owning offices throughout the division, NCS Florida customers, their attorneys or company agents.

b) Establish workflows, performance standards, etc. for all Florida production employees and monitor same. Motivates leads and mentors other Florida production employees to ensure high productivity levels.

c) Assists Underwriting Manager and other underwriting personnel with title comments requiring examiner knowledge, amend title requests, product consultations, etc. on commercial transactions.

d) Demonstrate power-user proficiency in FAST production and workflow technologies. Fully leverages NNC and NPS capabilities to generate cost-efficiencies for National Commercial Services.

e) Demonstrates fluent proficiency with NCS Florida's established paperless environment, paperless transaction folder organization, and file labeling protocols.

f) Serve as principle liaison for operations with NCS Florida State Manager with sister NCS offices for the efficient and timely delivery of title commitments/reports, creating and maintaining high-performance culture within the NCS Florida production team, and recommending and implementing changes in operational structure and personnel additions/reductions as business volumes dictate (including participation in recruiting efforts associated with same).

Job Qualifications:

Previous commercial title examination experience and underwriting required.

Exceptional knowledge of commercial title examination practices in Florida; along with commensurate construction of title commitment requirement and exceptions in the most complex of transactions.

Ability to abstract and compile data from public property records and the ability to work well with others are important in this position.

Willingness to commit the time necessary to meet commercial customer/law firm agent demands

Knowledge and comfort in making underwriting decisions

Confidence and comfort working under pressure and with deadlines

Must be motivated and a team player

Proficient ability to evaluate, learn, and implement production systems and resources to ensure highest service levels in all facets of commercial title production within the FAST platform.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills required. Superior customer service skills required.

Must be able to work with various levels of personnel within the organization. Must be organized and results-driven.

Fluency with available industry technology, including but not limited to MS Word, Excel, Outlook and Employer's FAST enterprise platform or similar industry platform mandatory.

job.title: Front-End Web Developer
job.description:
Our client is an Internet-based eCommerce company aiming to become the leading online retailer in the Tire industry. Our goal is to build a rich customer experience platform for the end-to-end (shop, buy, install) lifecycle. Our client will lead the industry in providing innovative solutions to the consumer simplifying a complex shopping cycle that integrates a national tire purchase with localized install process.


Position Purpose:

  • This position is responsible for enterprise level front end web development for high volume consumer facing web app, and native iOS app.
  • The Front end Web Developer is responsible for code development using JavaScript, React, AJAX, CSS3 and HTML 5.0 responsive web design and Mobile app development.
  • This position is responsible for architecting & implementing flexible/scalable/reusable UI & page templates using best practices and current web development standards to be shared across development teams.
  • This position interfaces with internal and external developer teams, designers and business users.
  • Collaborate effectively with Creative UX team, Product Management and Engineering to create concept development, prototypes, technology innovations and process improvements.
  • Research and identify evolving media, technology and design innovations and opportunities; work with partners across the organization to assess and implement new ideas.
  • This position will demonstrate and build an understanding of web application performance, scalability, reliability & security.


Requirements

  • Ability to work independently while collaborating with a cross-functional team
  • Passionate about building relevant software
  • Demonstrate exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrate strong computer science skills & experience
  • Ability to plan, schedule, execute, and complete work in a self-directed mode from inception through to production
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, meeting different schedules and deadlines
  • Ability to understand and apply best practices
  • Comfortable working/sharing development on applications with several layers.
  • Participate in writing detailed level technical and functional specifications documentation
  • Success Factors/Key Metrics:
  • Successful implementation of new products and solutions to Web and Telesales channels. (on time deliveries; on budget projects; business case benefits realized)
  • Performance in meeting SLAs for resolving Production issues identified with solutions supported by development team.
  • Site performance, page load times, page weight & element counts implemented with designed solution all meet standards set by technical teams

Experience(s) that Best Prepares You:

  • Education: Degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or relevant experience.
  • Experience:
  • o 6+ years of web development experience working with Fortune 500 companies
  • o 4+ years of web development experience, including CSS, HTLM, Javascript and jQuery
  • o 2+ years of Mobile Web development including responsive design
  • o 2+ years of web ecommerce platform (ATG, Hybris, IBM WebSphere)
  • o 2+ years working in Agile environment
  • Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Company, in its discretion may find appropriate and acceptable.

Key Competencies:

  • Expertise in core web technologies including HTML5, CSS3, and vanilla JavaScript.
  • Experience building production web apps using React and Redux
  • Mobile Web application development with React Native
  • Experience using static type checking and unit tests
  • Knowledgeable in modern build, tooling, and version control tools like npm, yarn, Webpack and git.
  • Experience creating pixel-perfect implementations from mockups with CSS libraries like Bootstrap and Tachyons.
  • Experience with Object-oriented and Functional Programming in JavaScript.
  • Solid understanding of modularized/componentized development process.
  • Extensive cross-browser and cross-device development experience.
  • Knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a fast-paced Scrum environment.
  • Experience developing and troubleshooting RESTful APIs.

Nice to Have:

  • Development experience for eCommerce.
  • May need to rapidly produce interim deliverables (such as style guide components, prototypes, proofs of concept, etc.) in addition to the final live site or application

Preferred:

  • Development experience for eCommerce solutions, & content management systems
  • May need to rapidly produce interim deliverables (such as style guide components, prototypes, proofs of concept, etc.) in addition to the final live site or application

Associated topics: ajax, asp.net, css, css2, front end, jscript, php, reactjs, web application programmer, web design

job.title: Program Manager, Enablement
job.description:
Our Company

Employer is the only Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader that accelerates data-driven digital transformation. Employer enables companies to unleash the power of data to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market disruptions. With over 7,000 customers worldwide, Employer is the trusted leader in Enterprise Cloud Data Management.

Your opportunity

The Field Enablement team sits at the heart of Employers growth operations, serving as a key function in effecting go-to-market excellence. In this very visible position, you will have the unique opportunity to interface with all internal Employer teams and key leaders in order to optimize sales productivity.

The ProgramManager provides support to enablement programs and initiatives in the delivery of in-person, online, and virtual training across the sales organization. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining the global training calendar, which includes coordinating and managing all associated enablement event logistics. Further, you will be responsible for assisting program leads in the production and distribution of training content, which includes managing a sophisticated online content and delivery platform. The ideal candidate is self-disciplined, organized, and detail-oriented, with an ability to successfully execute project plans with deadlines consisting of many moving parts. At Employer, you will work alongside an elite team of passionate and driven individuals out to change the world.

Your responsibilities

The following responsibilities and attributes equate to success in the role:

  • Learns quickly and can handle a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • Self-disciplined: adheres to structured work plans and can anticipate team needs
  • Organized: process oriented but always looking for ways to make it streamlined and more efficient where needed
  • Able to manage global training calendar and scheduling
  • Able to manage logistics associated with multiple, simultaneous training events
  • Able to manage the production and distribution of all training materials
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to create and maintain relationships with external teams
  • Ability to navigate conversations with high-profile leaders
  • Actively seeks opportunities for self-development and implements coaching feedback

The ideal candidate will also have:

  • College degree required: business, marketing, communications degree preferred
  • 2-3+ years of relevant internships or working experience in enablement, training, marketing, or event management role
  • Strong record of academic or professional achievement
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office products: PowerPoint, Word, Excel, OneDrive, Outlook
  • Experience planning and organizing complex events
  • A high level of personal integrity
  • 25% travel

Employer is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

Employer LLC offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, retirement and flexible time off and more. Our generous benefits vary depending on your geographic work location. Its an exciting time to work at Employer. You can learn more about our company, and our products and services at www.informatica.com.

job.title: Technical Support Engineer
job.description:
Overview

Are you a person with strong communication skills who enjoys working with others? Youve come to the right place! Were looking for an outgoing, enthusiastic, and creative problem-solver to join our Customer Support team as a Technical Support Engineer (TSE). As a part of our CustomerSupport team, youll provide a service experience second to none as you help our customers tackle their problems head on and crush any technical obstacles in their path. And youll be supported internally by a best-in-class team as well, receiving ample training and development opportunities to help get you up and running and ready for primetime.

Employer extends a work culture unlike any other East Cost-based technology provider. We focus on hiring candidates who display our seven core competencies passion, drive, transparency, adaptability, empathy, kaizen, and customer commitment. If you eat, sleep, and breathe our competencies and desire to work in a casual yet results-driven environment that embraces innovation then youre just what were looking for!

Employer is a high-growth Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company thats voted one of the Best Places to Work in New Jersey. We are the industry's premier recruitment software provider delivering technology that supports approximately 3,500 organizations around the globe. We are growing fast, which creates a lot of opportunities for career growth within our organization. Come grow with us. Apply today!

Responsibilities
  • Use superior customer service skills by keeping a positive, caring, can-do attitude for our customers
  • Address and resolve customer concerns and issues in a timely manner
  • Document all events and interactions in SalesForce by creating, tracking, and closing cases when issues are resolved
  • Responsible for learning Employer platform and ancillary products quickly and providing accurate information about them to our customers
  • Independently collects and tracks information and details of the problem
  • Troubleshoot customer issues using remote desktop software
  • Interact with customers through phone and email to address and resolve concerns and issues
  • Dedicate yourself to the success and satisfaction of our customers
  • Attempt to resolve customer issues or escalate to advanced personnel if necessary
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with Employer policies, procedures, and core competencies
Qualifications
  • BA/BS or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of 0-2 years of technical support experience
  • Must be able to work nights and weekend shifts
  • Must have good working knowledge of Windows/Mac OS and its components
  • Strong customer relations skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Capable of multi-tasking in a fast-paced work environment
  • Ability to be flexible in work schedule; including nights
  • Strong knowledge of web-browser based technologies
  • Experience with system networking, TCP/IP and DNS
  • Experience with HRIS, CRM and / or ATS is a plus

Employer is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.title: Senior Consultant Big Data Management Products Specialist
job.description:
Our Team
Employer Professional Services provide the product expertise, and project management knowledge to deliver the most architecturally efficient and cost effective solution for our customers data integration projects. Because our practice serves the largest and most diverse Employer customer base, our work keeps us on the cutting edge of all forms of data management projects Big Data, B2B, Data Governance, Data Migration and Consolidation, Data Quality Management, Data Synchronization, Data Warehousing, Integration Competency Centers, Master Data Management, Product Information Management and Services Oriented Architectures. Whether it is a short or long-term engagement, we are dedicated to sharing our knowledge to ensure our customers continued success with our products.

Your Opportunity
The Employer Big Data and Cloud Team supports our Professional Services organization through enablement and leadership in targeted technology delivery. As a Big Data Management Product Specialist, you will gain valuable technical and consulting skills in the Employer Big Data Management Platform and related Employer products. You will deliver consulting assistance to critical customer projects providing deep technical skills and enterprise architecture advice regarding Big Data Management in a Hadoop environment. It is important that in this role that you possess technical aptitude, strength in written/verbal communications, ability to create and deliver technical education and strong client management skills to delivery successful projects in this highly visible and fast-moving market.

Your Responsibilities

Big Data Management Senior Consultant/Product Specialist is responsible for highly expert technical services, training and mentoring on Employer Big Data Management, which may include:
Providing input to Product Management to address product enhancements, evolve new capabilities for emerging customer needs, and assist with the roadmap for new products and features.
Execute billable project assignments in both strategic projects and customer escalations to ensure success rates for both customers and sales execution in the Big Data Management market
Participate in knowledge management activities to encapsulate knowledge and provide a foundation for successful Big Data Management integration project execution
Mentor less experienced staff to assist with technical and functional product related questions/issues and provide input for future training activities
Providing special services (for example, performance-related configuration or other proof-of-concept work) for Employer internal projects or for partners or for customers in billable or non-billable situations
Maintain the deepest skill level in Employer Professional Services on the Big Data Management platform
Develop customer implementation Architectures consistent with best practices around the use of Employer Big Data Management Platform

Your Qualifications
Bachelors degree required
Minimum 5+ years of consulting experience
Experience with the Employer Platform
Strong experience with building data integration processes in Employer Power Center, or similar technologies
Strong Linux/Red Hat Skills
Employer B2B, Business Glossary and/or Data Quality experience is preferred
Strong DBMS skills including SQL
Administration skills in Hadoop/Cloudera or strong desire/aptitude to learn these skills
Database appliance skills is a plus including Netezza, Greenplum, Teradata and Exadata
Able to present and address complex architectures and development issues
Ability to troubleshoot complex environments with multiple products used to achieve a solution
Experience leveraging new technologies quickly for customer success
Ability to execute in a quickly changing and dynamic environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Willingness to travel 50-75%
Ability to travel freely within North America including Canada
Possible international travel to support Worldwide customer engagements

job.title: Principal Engineer - Cloud Architect
job.description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for a Principal Engineer to help us move all our services from our own data centers into Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You will be the bridge between Marketo s development teams and the Google engineers who are helping with our migration. Help us transform our applications to leverage the GCP environment for maximum scale, efficiency and uptime.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the overall architectural plan for how we will migrate our services to GCP
  • Reporting to the Chief Architect, you will coordinate with development teams, our operations team and Google
  • Assure that migrated services will meet our operational standards
  • Provide expert guidance to teams creating new services that will run in GCP

Basic Qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience
  • 7+ years software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages
  • Experience designing/developing large scale distributed systems
  • Experience developing in Java, Scala or other JVM language
  • Experience designing and architecting applications for the cloud (GCP, AWS or Azure)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience running large scale distributed computing systems in a SaaS environment
  • Strong knowledge of containers and Kubernetes
  • Knowledge of the primary Google Cloud services (GCE, GKE, Spanner, Cloud SQL)
  • Infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting (E.g. shell, Python, Ruby, Powershell)
  • Proficient at SQL and at least one major RDMS
  • Experience with any of the following a plus: Spark, Mongo, Cassandra, Kafka, Zookeeper, MySQL, HDFS, Druid, Spring, Yarn

Marketo is an equal opportunity employer

job.title: Senior Technical Support Engineer
job.description:
Senior Technical Support Engineer

As a member of the Marketo Customer Support team, you will act as an Senior Technical Support Engineer for a portfolio of high profile enterprise customers. You will become their trusted technical advisor and you will ensure that they get the most out of their investment in the Elite Support service as well as the Marketo Subscription. You will manage the delivery of expert technical support for your assigned customers and the resolution of their issues. You will also analyze your customer s business requirements and map them to the Marketo platform, providing expert knowledge and technical best practices on how to configure, maintain and manage their implementation. This role is part Technical Support Engineer, Account Manager and Project Manager. Travel will be required for on-site visits.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage your Elite account(s) while ensuring the highest levels of customer satisfaction are met
  • Own and pro-actively manage the technical relationship
  • Position yourself as an extension of the customer s staff and be their advocate at Marketo
  • Document each account s business goals, process, environment and system configurations
  • Provide several educational sessions as well as quarterly support reviews to your customer(s)
  • Ensure prompt and complete resolution of technical challenges and business issues, drive other teams as required and set customer expectations
  • Establish strong relationships with Product Management, Education, Engineering, Operations, and Professional Services to drive end to-end success
  • Proactively identify and implement solutions and enhancements to ensure your customers long term success
  • Collaborate internally to ensure the product roadmap meets your customer s priorities
  • Work closely with the Account Management team for successful renewal for Elite Support customer s subscriptions

Required Skills / Experience:

  • BA/BS Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years Marketo product experience preferred
  • 5+ years Technical Account Management experience
  • 10-15 years of progressive experience diagnosing and resolving problems in complex software environment.
  • Excellent organizational skills -ability to prioritize, manage, multi-task and execute projects cross-functionally
  • Superior communications skills (presentation, written, and verbal) and demonstrated ability to communicate/present effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive level.
  • Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following additional areas: Database technology (SQL); Web technology (HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XML, PHP), Networking Technologies (TCP/IP, DNS)
  • Fluency in multiple languages a plus.

Marketo is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job.title: Application Administrator - Xcelys
job.description:
Implements, maintains, administers and supports a third-party application used in conjunction with business and IT critical systems. Completes assigned work to a third party application through configuration and/or coding. This position requires subject matter expertise (SME) with a third-party application and the ability to determine the best solution to meet specific customer and/or business needs utilizing the appropriate application.

Essential Functions:
  • Modify a third-party application, via coding or configuration, and perform initial testing to ensure the requirements gathered for implementation/enhancement are met.
  • Document modifications made for future reference.
  • Work with customers to perform end-user testing of modifications to third-party application.
  • Follow release management processes to promote modifications of third-party application to production environments.
  • Respond to emergency issues that arise with the third-party application, resolving the problem, determining the root cause of the issue and implementing preventative measures to keep the issue from reoccurring.
  • Perform routine and periodic patching and upgrades to the third-party application to ensure quality, security and support of the application.
  • Coordinate activities with Network, Server and DBA groups to make necessary modifications to meet the requirements.
  • Develop and document Standard Operating Procedures for each third-party application.
  • Plan and participate in disaster recovery activities to ensure continued availability of the supported third-party application.
  • Monitor servers where third-party applications are hosted for errors and usage capacity.
  • Work with the vendor of the assigned third-party application to ensure adherence to best practices and policies to ensure optimum performance and stability of the application.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Additional Responsibilities:
  • Review new technologies against business requirements to identify opportunities for improvements and to identify opportunities to reduce costs.
Candidate Education:
  • Preferred A Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology or related field
Candidate Experience:
  • Required 2 years of experience in Working as an administrator or implementer of third-party applications in an Enterprise environment
  • Preferred experience with Xcelys
  • Preferred claims knowledge
Candidate Skills:
  • Intermediate Demonstrated written communication skills
  • Intermediate Demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skills
  • Intermediate Ability to proof large bodies of materials
  • Intermediate Ability to work as part of a team
  • Intermediate Other Knowledge of Change Control Processes
  • Intermediate Other General knowledge of SDLC
  • Intermediate Other Proficient in troubleshooting issues
  • Intermediate Other Must be able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with non-technical staff and end-users for requirements gathering, testing, training, and outcome validation.
  • Intermediate Other Must be able to document and diagram solutions using standard formats. Documentation must be grammatically correct, factually accurate, and appropriate to the target audience.
  • Intermediate Other Must be able to understand and follow verbal instructions and written policies and procedures to ensure adherence to standards and to instructions from management.
Licenses and Certifications:
A license in one of the following is required:
Technical Skills:
  • Preferred Intermediate Microsoft Access

job.title: Manager IT Strategic Sourcing
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Responsible and accountable for the proper creation and execution of key outsourcing contracts and ensuring adherence to financial, operational, and legal standards. Creates and maintains a best in class governance team which delivers IT Solutions, while meeting the changing needs of Employer business. This position will have a direct impact on efficiencies by establishing and maintaining quality service provider relationships via defined processes, contract requirements and oversight practices.

Job Description

  • Creates and delivers solutions to bring best practices to sourcing for IT initiatives. Works with IT teams to elicit their requirements for sourcing.
  • Develops and implements program and profit/negotiation strategy to achieve best price and/or enhancement consideration with suppliers, supporting the specific needs of the client.
  • Develops, tracks, and manages vendor performance and metrics, including over 300 SLAs.
  • Manages contract audits and/or benchmarking activities to establish appropriate corrective and preventative actions for any significant contract or program related issues.
  • Manages IT Asset Management best practices and policies to drive integration, improvements, and content compliance/ accuracy in order for critical data to be available throughout the company.
  • Defines, implements, and continuously improves operational core competencies and processes with a focus on success and customer satisfaction through the implementation of metrics to ensure daily operations meet all customer and division requirements in a predictable and repeatable manner.
  • Pursues cost reduction through cross functional management of metrics, processes, reduced rework, reduced cycle time, etc. while fully achieving objectives.
  • Understands and applies disciplined root cause analysis techniques and designs and employs detailed monthly operations reviews that are dependent on an appropriate metric set to ensure fast, steady progress in operations performance and continuous improvements.
  • Liaises and promotes collaboration with all other functional elements of the business, specifically including IT operations, IT development/ test, and the PMO to drive service delivery to meet customer, system, and cost requirements. Leads the prioritization and work efforts for the vendor teams.
  • Manages escalations and disputes with the vendors and Employer business units to ensure focus on successful delivery and budget within the terms of the contract.
  • Develops and manages budget plans including tracking monthly charges, credits, and forecasts Provides input to annual budget planning.
  • Develops and implements tools, reports and processes to assist in the successful management of outsourcing agreements.
  • Ensures vendor compliance with all corporate policies and procedures, including SOX and security requirements.
  • Supports all sourcing negotiations and re-negotiations directly with vendors, in collaboration with procurement, legal, finance, HR, and risk management. Leads negotiations for any updates and changes to existing terms.
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Required

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Subject matter expertise in the Outsourcing and /or Offshoring industry (3+ years)
  • Understanding of Vendor landscape
  • Ability to interact at all levels of the business and vendor organizations
  • IT Development and Operations experience (10 years)
  • Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements
  • Exemplifies critical thinking, troubleshooting and strong analytical skills
  • Experience managing to and interpreting Contracts
  • Basic accounting and experience managing large budgets
  • Excellent written and verbal skills, ability to create and present proposals to Leaders (5 years)

Preferred

  • Experience with large-scale outsourcing contract management
  • Previous experience negotiating and transitioning an organization to a sourced or offshore model (2 years)
  • Ability to travel 10-20%

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Denver; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Nebraska-Omaha; US-Utah-Salt Lake City

job.title: Senior Software Engineer- Backend
job.description:
The Opportunity


People are receiving more than 2900 marketing messages every day. Marketo s challenge is to help marketers to breakthrough the noise with personal, targeted, intelligent email campaigns. Our powerful email engine includes features such as dynamic content, automatic trigger, segmentation, A/B test, and email action tracking.

As an engineer on this team, you will work on Marketo s email engine as well as other platform components and help take them to the next level of scalability and performance. We use proven technologies like Java and leading edge Big Data technologies like Spark, Kafka, Mongo and Scala.

If you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems in a dynamic, fast-paced, collaborative, and fun-loving environment, we think this is a good opportunity for you.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and test (including automated, continuous integration) key product features/components of our platform.
  • Develop systems that are highly reliable, scalable, but surprisingly easy to maintain.
  • Be independent in feature/component design and conduct effective peer code reviews where needed.
  • Be an active participant in the architecture and design discussions.

Requirements:

  • 3 to 10 years of industry software development experience.
  • Strong core Java, design patterns and OOD/OOP skills.
  • SQL proficiency
  • Experience in Big Data technologies highly desired
  • Testing frameworks like Junit
  • Experience with agile development methodologies.
  • Positive work attitude, self-motivator, quick learner, and a team player.
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience preferred.

It is great if you know:

  • Scala, Java, PHP
  • Hadoop, HBase, Spark
  • Yarn, Oozie, Zookeeper
  • MySQL
  • Cassandra, Redis, Mongo
  • Akka framework
  • Spring framework

Marketo is an equal opportunity employer.

job.description:
The Hyperion Lead Administrator / Developer will serve as system owner and subject matter expert for the Hyperion EPM suite of tools. This includes management, configuration/development, and operations support of the Hyperion EPM suite of which expertise is required in Hyperion Planning, Essbase, Financial Reporting and Data Integration (FDMEE) along with high, working knowledge of Hyperion Profitability and Cost Management (HPCM), Financial Management (HFM), Data Relationship Manager (DRM) and Hyperion Close Suite. The candidate is accountable for full lifecycle development that entails the analysis, design and development of all Hyperion v11 components in addition to proactively identifying enhancement opportunities to the Hyperion suite as implemented. Understand, interpret and transform business problems, opportunities and requirements for recommending solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.


Essential Functions:
  • Provide assistance to team members with their daily work assignments and issue resolution to achieve the business needs.
  • Assist management with prioritizing work assignments.
  • Interact with the Internal Customers in resolving issues related to their specific areas.
  • Interact with customers, either IT or Business users, to determine requirements related to needs of third-party applications. Follow-up on customer satisfaction.
  • Review new releases, patches, hotfixes, and security bulletins from Software vendors.
  • Interact with other departments and teams to coordinate work activities needed to accomplish the goals for all requested work.
  • Ensure that all provided solutions meet business needs for reliability, performance, and security.
  • Lead the development and documentation of solutions in order to provide guidance to the leadership team.
  • Modify a third-party application, via coding or configuration, to ensure the requirements gathered for implementation/enhancement are met.
  • Ensure testing of any changes or modifications to third-party applications is performed.
  • Follow release management processes to promote modifications of third-party applications to production environments.
  • Respond to emergency issues that arise with the third-party applications, resolving the problem, determining the root cause of the issue and implementing preventative measures to keep the issue from reoccurring.
  • Perform routine and periodic patching and upgrades to third-party applications to ensure quality, security and support of these applications.
  • Coordinate activities with Network, Server and DBA groups to make necessary modifications to meet the requirements.
  • Develop and document Standard Operating Procedures for each third-party application.
  • Plan and participate in disaster recovery activities to ensure continued availability of the supported third-party applications.
  • Work with vendors of third-party applications to ensure adherence to best practices and policies to ensure optimum performance and stability of these applications.
  • Mentor team members through training and support with complex tasks.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Additional Responsibilities:

    • Develops, implements, and maintains new Hyperion Planning applications, cubes, and process flows

    • Provides alternatives and recommendations based on best practices and Oracle Hyperion product suite features and functionalities (Hyperion Planning, Essbase, SmartView, FR, batch processing, etc.)

    • Ensures Production environment stability and performance are up to par and meet SLA agreements

    • Proactively build working relationships with the Finance and Accounting business units to deliver, maintain and enhance Hyperion functionality

    • Employs knowledge of Essbase to facilitate better deployment of Planning, application security and other interface tools

    • Provides timely response and resolution of emergency production questions, issues, and defects

    • Participates in requirements sessions and prepare detailed functional specifications, design models, and system workflows from which software applications will be developed and implemented

    • Develops test scenarios, test scripts and leads teams in unit, integration and acceptance testing

    • Facilitates Business end-user training and Help desk training as needed

    • Leads, mentors and assists software developers/engineers with technical Hyperion issues

    • Leads application development projects as assigned

Candidate Education:
  • Preferred A Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology or related field
Candidate Experience:

    • 5 years' experience developing Hyperion applications and acting as a design lead

    • Expertise in Essbase cube analysis, design and maintenance, Essbase database administration, upgrades, performance tuning and optimization.

    • Excellent technology skills related to full life cycle development with Hyperion EPM Suite (Planning, DRM, HFM, HPCM, DRM, FCM and FDMEE) in creating applications, managing the application security and administration.

    • 3 years' experience with HFM is required.

    • Must have built and implemented at least 3 full life cycle EPM suite implementations, upgrades and /or migrations involving - Planning, HPCM, HFM, FDMEE, DRM and Close Suite modules.

    • Experience with both Classic and EPMA methods of metadata management is highly preferred

    • Ability to write HFM rules files, develop data grids, financial reports, and utilize Smartview for Excel and Word.

    • ASO and BSO Essbase application development/configuration and support Outlines, dimensions, measures, members, metadata administration with ability to design databases and complex calculations including MaxL scripting.

    • Integration of Hyperion applications with existing processes, including budgeting and forecasting, data warehouse and management reporting; Knowledge of Oracle EBS preferred

    • Understands dependencies and interrelationships between functional components of Hyperion Planning among forms, business rules, calculation scripts, variables and Essbase databases.

    • Experience with Essbase Excel add in, Smartview and FR reporting.

    • Working knowledge on Financial Planning, Budgeting and Forecasting process and functions.

    • In-depth product knowledge with very strong business and technical expertise; problem solving/debugging skills.

    • Accounting knowledge a plus.

Candidate Skills:
  • Intermediate Demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skills
  • Advanced Ability to multi-task
  • Advanced Ability to work as part of a team
  • Advanced Demonstrated written communication skills
  • Intermediate Other Knowledge of Change Control Processes
  • Intermediate Other General knowledge of SDLC
  • Advanced Other Proficient in troubleshooting issues
  • Advanced Other Must be able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with non-technical staff and end-users for requirements gathering, testing, training, and outcome validation.
  • Advanced Other Must be able to document and diagram solutions using standard formats. Documentation must be grammatically correct, factually accurate, and appropriate to the target audience.
  • Advanced Other Must be able to understand and follow verbal instructions and written policies and procedures to ensure adherence to standards and to instructions from management.

Licenses and Certifications:
A license in one of the following is required:

*L1-AT1

*dice16

  • Required Other Appropriate system certifications
Technical Skills:
  • Preferred Intermediate Microsoft Access Must be intimately familiar with the operating environment
  • Preferred Intermediate Microsoft Word Must understand the overall architecture of the application platform
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Outlook Must understand various authentication mechanisms (Active Directory, local unix authentication, Database, etc)
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft PowerPoint Must be able to troubleshoot issues with very little information from users
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Visio Must understand role based security and security inheritance
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Project Must be able to determine which layer of security affects the various resources(databases, app servers, etc)
  • Required Intermediate Other Working knowledge of Windows and Linux Servers
  • Required Intermediate Other Must be able to communicate technical solutions to management for review and approval both verbally and in writing

job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER

We have an amazing opportunity for 2 Software Engineers to join our company. This role offers the opportunity to learn and grow along with our engineering team. As a Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to make a real impact on our success! You will work with a team to build and optimize highly scalable job advertisement web applications. To be successful in this role, you must be passionate about entrepreneurship and highly skilled at finding problems and implementing solutions to improve the product. If you are ready to work with and continually optimize a product that directly impacts our clients, we would love to talk with you.

This position works within our Austin, TX headquarters located at 360 and 2222, which is about 8 miles from downtown and beautifully situated on the edge of Central Texas Hill Country.

About Jobs2Careers

Jobs2Careers is the leading programmatic job advertising marketplace with more than 20 million registered users and over 2 billion monthly searches. What makes Jobs2Careers stand out? We re mission-driven: we help people find work. We connect the best talent with the right opportunities in the most efficient way possible. We believe that to be the best, we must hire the best - and help them become even better. At Jobs2Careers, you ll find an environment of collaboration, encouragement, transparency, and fun.

Required Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience building web applications and/or mobile optimized sites
  • Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or related Engineering degree, or higher
  • Proficiency in PHP or Java
  • Solid understanding of MySQL database design and development
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (React, Angular, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of MVC and OOP
  • Experience working in a Linux environment
  • Must be legally authorized to work permanently in the U.S. without employer sponsorship

Preferred Skills and Traits of a Highly Qualified Candidate:

  • The belief and understanding that good software engineers can make any technologies and code base look good
  • Curiosity to dig through the back-end when working on front-end, and vice versa
  • Internally driven self motivator who has a hard time stopping when there s an unsolved problem or unusual bug at the end of the day
  • Experience with Laravel or other web framework projects

Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Company-paid gym membership
  • Comprehensive, company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance premiums for you and all dependents
  • 401(k) retirement plan with 3% employer contribution
  • Paid company holidays, Vacation, and Sick Leave
  • Fully-stocked kitchen
  • Awesome company events

Jobs2Careers is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

job.title: Food Production Manager 2
job.description:
Unit Description

Employer is seeking a talented, experienced Production Manager to help oversee culinary operations at Oral Roberts University in Tulsa, OK.

Oral Roberts University is the premier Christian university in America's heartland with approximately 4,000 students and a 40+ year relationship with Employer! Part of the University's mission is to \"educate the whole person - spirit, mind, and body\", and Employer works closely with the school to ensure that students' needs are met at an exceptional level in every aspect. Employer also manages campus facilities on the ORU campus, including physical plant, landscaping, housekeeping, and general maintenance.

The Production Manager will play an integral role in overseeing the execution of menus that capture modern trends with a focus on health and wellness and \"clean\" food preparation. Solid classical training is a plus, with an emphasis on modern techniques, presentation, and demonstration cooking. As in most professional kitchens there are excellent opportunities to identify, educate, and retain quality staff! In addition to hands-on kitchen management the Production Manager will be responsible for inventory management and ordering, and will assist the Executive Chef in training and overseeing staff in record keeping for our HACCP program as well as food production.

The Production Manager reports directly to the Director of Operations, and in concert with the Executive Chef will oversee culinary operations for the Student Cafeteria, as well as all food items for Catering. The President's Office entertains frequently, and there are ongoing opportunities to assist in developing custom menus for those functions both seasonally and per-event. We host a number of major local events throughout the year that are catered for private clients, so there is a need to be competitive with other local caterers regarding food quality, menu options, and profitability.

ORU's dining operation is the crown jewel of the eastern Oklahoma region! If you are a talented and Chef with great energy and a passion for excellence in serving people, then ORU is the place for you! We look forward to meeting you!

Position Summary

Responsible for inventory management and procurement of food and supplies at an account/unit to ensure client satisfaction and retention for the Company. Manages food production through kitchen staff in a medium facility. Contributes to account revenue and operating profit contribution through cost containment and safety. Key Duties- Utilizes Employer resources, recipes, systems and programs to direct daily operations including; food production, inventory, product deliveries, invoices, and procurement operations.

- Ensures employees have appropriate equipment, supplies and resources to perform their job, and meet goals, cost controls and deadlines as assigned.

- Establishes and maintains a safe work environment including both food and physical safety in order to comply with all regulatory and Employer standards

- Complies with budget requirements by controlling costs (i.e. labor, inventory, equipment, materials) and making adjustments when necessary

- Supervises employees by delegating, assigning and prioritizing activities, and monitoring operating standards

Qualifications & Requirements

Basic Education Requirement - High School Diploma, GED or equivalent Basic Management Experience - 1 year Employer is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

job.title: Entry Level: Become a Customer Experience Rep - El Paso
job.description:
If you love providing world-class customer service, interacting with diverse customers, and are looking for a fulfilling career with immense opportunity, look no further! Employers 9 U.S.-based Customer Experience Centers provide award-winning service to millions of customers throughout the nation. Customer Experience Representatives act as excellent information resources for billing, programming and troubleshooting questions including suggesting ways for existing customers to get the most value and enjoyment from their Employer experience.Customer Experience Representatives are responsible for resolving customer issues, preventing future callbacks through amazing customer service and intuition into customer needs, and promoting the award-winning products (like the Hopper w/ Sling) and services (like PrimeTime AnyTime) while operating at maximum efficiency and with the utmost professional courtesy.Primary responsibilities fall within the following categories:Payments and Billing - accept payments by a variety of methods, offer self-serve payment solutions, explain charges and credits on the customers bill, and resolve complex billing scenariosProduct features - assist customers with pay-per-view orders, change programming packages, equipment upgrades, and educate customers about the many features of Employers award-winning productsSales - use a consultative approach to educate and offer existing customers additional programming, and promote products and services to enhance their Employer experienceA Customer Experience Representative performs the job duties and responsibilities above as well as the following essential job functions:Working flexible schedules including weekends, holidays, and eveningsRegular and predictable attendanceAbility to regularly sit for long periods of timeAbility to multi-task; speaking with customer while accurately logging and recording customer information in to call center databasesTake back-to-back phone calls from Employer internal customers nationwide and assist them with questions regarding work order modifications, equipment modifications, as well as activation of customer servicesMeet or exceed minimum performance standards including but not limited to Average Handle Time; Customer Satisfaction; Quality, Up-selling, etc. You will be constantly measured on these metricsDeescalate upset or irate customers in order to satisfactorily address their customer service needsSkills - Experience and RequirementsA successful Customer Experience Representative will have the following:High School diploma, GED, or equivalent experienceSix-months of related customer service experience and/or training preferredProficiently utilize Windows OS (XP, 7, 8, 10) and internet search enginesStrong organizational, time management, and problem solving skillsExcellent written and oral communication skillsStrong sense of professionalism and active listening skillsAbility to problem solve and use resources on proprietary software/tools to understand and craft the right solution across varying customer needs, business rules, and processes

job.title: Sr. Principal Systems Engineer
job.description:
GDMS has an immediate opening for a Senior PrincipalSystems Engineer to join our team. The position provides an opportunity to develop the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation's fundamental defense services. GDMS employees work closely with esteemed clients to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions. The selected candidate will work with collaborative teams to create and manage various GDMS and client technologies. In addition to receiving a competitive salary and generous health and personal benefits, the Advanced Systems Engineer will enhance their skill set among a talented and technically accomplished group of colleagues. The employee will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded.

Key Responsibilities
SeniorPrincipalSystems Engineer'sanalyze, design, develop and test GDMS systems to ensure the integration of software, hardware, reliability, maintainability, safety and other requirements in the total engineering effort. Additional Responsibilities include formulating operational concepts; performing mission, functional, cost-benefit and risk analysis; selecting systems architecture; and preparing specifications for GDMS operating systems to ensure designs meet applicable security specifications. These individuals may also be asked to document security on both new and fielded information systems or provide accreditation/certification evaluation and test support to ensure all technical security features are considered and functioning properly.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Exercise creative thinking and ideation to advance our business performance
  • Deliver innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet customers changing business needs
  • Support and engage in programs, projects and practices behind the GDMS culture and strategy, and comply with all policies and procedures
  • Follow industry and department trends and developments to ensure GDMSservices are consistent with, and/or superior to, industry best practices

PREFERRED DEGREE TYPES AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Computer Engineering
  • Experience in SIGINT and Space Payloads.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of DefenseTS/SCI security clearance is requiredat time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.


Associated topics: cloud architect, equipment, information architect, infrastructure architect, ip, maintain, maintenance, network, server, system architect

job.title: Lead Marketing Database Analyst
job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. More customers. More network. More locations. More opportunities for you. With a global presence in 60 countries, service to more than 350 metro areas domestically, and more than 200,000 miles of fiber; Employer is going places. At Employer, we believe in growth and innovation, for ourcustomers and our employees. Discover how Employer can expand your potential and take your career to new places if youre looking to join a company that celebrates diversity and creativity, with industry-leading benefits and commitment to employee advancement. Were committed to bringing great talent to our team to help us change the world. One network connection at a time.

Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

This position is critical in maintaining the quality and efficiency of information within Consumer Marketing infrastructure. Responsibilities include delivering code, conducting research, and checking quality control and assurances that will result in high quality data processing and data integrity.

This position will help incorporatethe processes that will result in accelerated sales, increased market awareness and high levels of customer loyalty. The position is instrumental in helping maximize revenue and profitability through contribution to or ownership of targeting strategies designed to acquire, grow and retain consumer customers.

Job Description

  • Responsible for supporting corporate strategy and managing marketing data marts.
  • Develops and enhances applications, whichsupport high-level objectives for acquisition, retention, and cross-selling.
  • Experienced translator of custom data requests into deliverable technical support.
  • Collects, adjusts, augments, and organizes large and detailed marketing requirements into logical technical requirements; manages a unified marketing data platform that will provide a comprehensive basis for lead generation, reporting and analysis.
  • Source data would include internal as well as external data sources that may contain demographics, product availability, customer subscription, and prospect attribute information.

Qualifications

Required

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and relevant experience
  • 6 - 8 years related experience.
  • 3 - 5 years experience in database marketing, in IT, preferably with BI applicationsenvironment
  • Advanced Skills in various Database extracts leveraging PL / SQL, Perl, Kornshell
  • High level knowledge of relational datamart strategy

Preferred:

  • 5+ years of database experience with a Master's Degree
  • 3 + years experience with Qlikview, Tableau, or other BI Dashboard
  • Ability to break down complex problems into manageable goals
  • Experience data modeling and analyzing data within a data warehouse environment to support specific marketing plans

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent in Marketing

Alternate Location: US-Arizona-Phoenix; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Florida-Apopka; US-Louisiana-Monroe

Requisition #: 164346

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at Employer style=\"color:black\">

job.minor_category0: [Information Technology] Business Systems Analyst And IT Consultant

job.title: LEAD PROJECT MANAGER
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

Develops, plans and manages implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for external/internal customers.

Job Description

Employer has an immediate need for a Lead Project Managerwith the Governance team, whose responsibilities include ensuringthat IT and business unit needs are fully aligned with the companys primary objectives while improving collaboration and strategic partnerships. This position is responsible for processing all IT intake for new efforts, managing the approval, prioritizationand Business Case process for IT investment work, Run the Business (RTB)requests, business case metrics reporting to all business units, and performing after action reviews for targeted programs.

  • Responsible for budget and expense control forprogram and strategic alignment of program to business unit objectives.
  • Analyzes work plans and schedules.
  • Develops methodologies, procedures, and systems to produce financial reporting.
  • Acts asprogram team leader for material change to programs after approval.
  • Developsprogress and status reports.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the companys IT investment budget is applied to system enhancements that align to corporate strategic initiatives and provide the highest return on investment.
  • Manage the companys business case approval process for IT investments while complying with corporate Finance approval standards and guidelines.
  • Lead regular meetings between cross-functional business and IT teams to review new IT program requests (intake), assess business purpose and benefits, and ultimately determine overall business priority.
  • Conduct financial after action reviews on targeted IT programs and present those findings to IT/Business Governance Director and senior management.
  • Analyze program worthiness by comparing financial metric information such as Net Present Value, Payback, Internal Rate of Return and others.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of the tactical and strategic business objectives of the company and be able to effectively communicate these to all levels.
  • Enhance the flow of information and communication across multiple organizational boundaries.
  • Demonstrate leadership to identify programs at risk and work with business and IT teams to mitigate with minimal budget and schedule impacts.
  • Lead ad hoc meetings between business and IT to expedite issue resolution and enable faster solution delivery.
  • Display basic knowledge and understanding of Software Development Lifecycle methodologies, concepts and best practices.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • 6 - 8 years of related experience.
  • PMP Certification or equivalent preferred.
  • Minimum of five years of program & portfolio management or IT Management experience.
  • Fundamental knowledge of financial principles such as NPV, Payback, IRR, ROI and others.
  • Minimum of three years experience coordinating and/supporting IT business processes.
  • Experience managing program schedules, budgets and communications.
  • Ability to negotiate and reach agreements between business organizations and IT.
  • Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
  • Ability to solve complex problems through analytical approach.
  • Ability to use web conferencing, teleconferencing, and video conferencing tools.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite.
  • Strong organizational, presentation, and customer relationship skills.
  • Process knowledge with regard to estimation, development methods such as Agile, Dev Ops etc and process improvement background a plus.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Data analytics and/or business objects skills a plus
  • Strong group presentation skills.
  • Some occasional travel may be required on a limited basis

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Broomfield; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Louisiana-Monroe

Requisition #: 172523

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at Employer
