job.title: Senior Data Scientist - Center for Analytics and Insights
job.description:
As Vanguard s needs grow and evolve, it s vital that we connect with Data Science experts to help identify innovative approaches and techniques. We re currently growing our analytics capabilities and will soon need professionals with vast knowledge in diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analysis who have experience using quantitative tactics to solve complex business challenges.

If you re interested in being considered for future Data Scientist openings within Vanguard, please submit your information to Vanguard s Senior Data Scientist requisition. Once a position becomes available, a recruiter will reach out to qualified candidates.

The Center for Analytics and Insights: The Center for Analytics and Insights (CAI) at Vanguard has been recently established as an enterprise center of excellence for advanced analytics and market research to transform how data, analytics and insights are used to support strategic decisions and serve Vanguard s clients.
The CAI s mission is to apply innovative analytical and research approaches to help tackle complex and strategically important problems facing Vanguard s businesses and clients; to become a hub for deep client insights; and to support, and enable, the entire organization to continuously develop new capabilities and solutions along the data analytics maturity curve.
The CAI hosts a team of highly talented, cross-disciplinary individuals including data scientists, advanced data analysts, data engineers, consultants and market researchers who work closely together in a dynamic environment to partner with leaders across Vanguard s Retail, Institutional, Intermediary and International businesses to drive innovation and transformation.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Leads and executes analytic projects to provide insight into client needs and behavior, supporting marketing and client servicing decisions. Serves as the analytics expert on cross functional teams for large strategic initiatives. Serves as own Project Manager and Relationship Manager for smaller projects.

  • Engages with project sponsors and stakeholders to understand each business question. Probes for hidden questions and goals. Brings structure to each request and translates requirements into an analytic approach.

  • Acquires structured and unstructured data and prepares it for analysis. Investigates, extracts, cleans, transforms, QCs and manages data. Identifies and diagnoses data inconsistencies and errors, forages to fill data gaps and blazes new data trails.

  • Analyzes data to describe client behavior and preferences, understand channel usage, diagnose client experience problems, size marketing opportunity, target clients for treatment and measure the impact of marketing and servicing initiatives. Identifies and utilizes appropriate analytic methods and specialized tools to generate insights, answer the business questions and fulfill project objectives. Seeks out innovative approaches and techniques.

  • Prepares and delivers insight presentations and action recommendations. Communicates complex material in layman's terms. Guides business partners on the interpretation, implications and use of analytic results. Consults on statistical problems (test design, significance testing, confidence intervals, weighting).

  • Develops and applies domain knowledge of Vanguard s businesses and data to shape the analytic road map.

  • Contributes to the growth of the analytic community. Mentors analysts.

  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.

Qualifications:

MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics, or other relevant scientific field. PhD degree preferred.


A minimum of five years general experience and five years relevant professional experience in progressive analytical roles.


Deep understanding and experience building models using Machine Learning & Optimization methods such as: Linear/Non-Linear/Integer programming, Deep Learning, Random Forests, GBM, Hidden Markov Models, SVM, Regression (Generalized linear models), MLE, Time-series analysis, Signal Processing, , Decision Trees (CART/CHAID), Neural Networks


Demonstrated industry experience applying the above methods to complex business problems thereby generating insights and providing best in class customer-driven solutions


Demonstrated experience in managing and leading large complex projects, including (but not limited to) formulating the business and analytical problem, extracting, cleansing, and manipulating large, and diverse data sets, building descriptive, predictive and prescriptive solutions and deploying these solutions in the cloud and/or on premise systems


Demonstrated experience in communicating complex analytical solutions, data relationships and results and their business impacts to multiple business partners and stakeholders, through superior data visualization and storytelling skills.


Strong proficiency in programming skills, such as SAS, Python, R, Spark, Scala.


Experience with data visualization tools such as D3.js, Tableau etc.


Knowledge of financial services and marketing.


Associated topics: business, business analyst, capital, consultant, credit, market, gs 0110 12, pricing, real estate, valuation

job.title: Head of Technology, CarConnect
job.description:
Located in Oakland s Jack London Square, A3Ventures is the innovation lab and capital investment engine of AAA. We anticipate needs and shape innovations to help people make sense of our rapidly changing world.

As a Head of Technology, CarConnect you will be a core part of an agile and passionate team charged with developing, incubating, and launching a portfolio of businesses that:

Embrace key megatrends, disruptive technologies, and business models;

Are collectively capable of generating ~$400+ million in revenue during the next

10 years; and

Leverage the privileged assets, resources, and distinctive capabilities of AAA.

Who You Are.

You are a technology leader with experience crafting and delivering connected experiences, leveraging software to create products and services that people love. Product leaders at A3V are communicators, decision makers and doers. We're looking for people with a broad base of skills, a track record of success, and a penchant for service design. You drive the development and execution of the IT strategy, bringing best-in-class products and experiences to our Members. You work with technical vendors and internal teams to drive large scale projects.

What You Will Do.

Product expert: Be the technical product expert and understand how our product fulfills consumer needs. Understand the details of the full technology stack, including its limitations and scalability.

Product development: Serve as technical product manager, working with other teams to understand their needs, build user stories, prioritize development efforts, and deliver new features.

Vendor relationships: Communicate functionality and design requirements to internal and external stakeholders; own relationships with technology vendors, ensuring ongoing alignment and accountability.

Data security: Ensure the continued protection of all consumer and enterprise data.

IT strategy: Establish enterprise technology roadmap, developing IT policies and systems to support the execution of business strategy. Assess build vs. buy opportunities, recommend vendor selection, and negotiate terms. Manage budget and optimize resources.

Ideate: Collaborate with a cross-functional team of designers, engineers, and marketers to come up with ingenious, innovative solutions to address new problems and opportunities. Leverage business acumen to create solutions that drive business outcomes.

Design: Understand the current and future needs of AAA Members; create and execute experiments and rapid prototypes to understand our members pain points and how to solve them.

Deliver: Articulate user stories, create mockups and identify metrics for pilot and product success. Operate hand-in-hand with distributed engineering teams to deliver new products and services. Understand and manage dependencies and the timing and feature mix of releases.

Roadmap: Own the vision and roadmap for your product. Manage your product roadmap to deliver the right features at the right time. Monitor the metrics to understand the success of those new products.

What You Have Done.

Product Management - Planning, forecasting, production, or marketing of a product or products at all stages of the product lifecycle. (Advanced)

Product Development - Skilled in the conceptualization, design, development and marketing of newly created or newly rebranded goods or services. (Advanced)

Vendor Management - Create and monitor vendor relationships. Negotiating and monitoring the length and substance of contracts. Stay up to date on new technologies. Maintain contact with current vendors and reaching out to new vendors. Supervise and direct the work of assigned occupational/leased employees. (Advanced)

Data Security - Ensure the continued protection of all consumer and enterprise data. (Advanced)

Strategic Planning - Formulates, sets goals, determines actions to achieve the goals, and mobilizes resources to execute the actions. (Advanced)

Project Management - Develop project schedules, defines project objectives, sets goals and determines measures to track progress. (Advanced)

Bachelor s degree in computer science or a related field (Required)

Advanced degree (Preferred)

8 years of Technical Product Management experience in a related industry

(Preferred)

4 years leadership using Agile development methodologies (Preferred)

2+ years of coding experience (Preferred)

Experience working with technical vendors and internal teams to drive large scale

(Preferred)

Why Join Us?

Impact. Reinvent AAA and the value propositions we will deliver to over 5.7 MM Members (57MM in North America) whose lives we help improve. Leverage the best of established corporate resources combined with start-up speed and agility to create real and meaningful impact.

Recognition. We offer a competitive total compensation package including base salary, both annual and long-term lucrative performance bonuses, benefits, and

401(k) Company match with additional discretionary contribution potential.

Lifestyle. We do honorable work, and we practice our values: respect, integrity, teamwork, and service.






About Us
For over a century, AAA has continued to redefine itself to become a multi-faceted leading provider of travel, insurance and auto services. We know you're as versatile as we are and that every aspect of your personality adds to the skills and knowledge you bring to AAA. That's what makes you so exceptional, and what you offer our Members and the communities we serve that much more unique. As an eligible Team Member, you have the chance to do honorable work, receive competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package and opportunities to grow your career.

The second-largest regional Member club of the national organization, and fastest growing mid-large size club in North America, AAA Northern California, Nevada & Utah is headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, and brings together:
  • An award winning work culture and environment
  • 2,800 employees to serve over 4 million Members
  • Over 75 branch offices across Northern California
  • Eleven branch offices across Nevada
  • Six branch offices across Utah

job.title: Sr Program Operations Manager
job.description:
Employer (NYSE:CTL) is a premier network solutions provider and trusted partner to our customers. As part of our recent acquisition of Level 3 Communications, our portfolio has expanded. More customers. More network. More locations. More opportunities for you. With a global presence in 60 countries, service to more than 350 metro areas domestically, and more than 200,000 miles of fiber; Employer is going places. At Employer, we believe in growth and innovation, for ourcustomers and our employees. Discover how Employer can expand your potential and take your career to new places if youre looking to join a company that celebrates diversity and creativity, with industry-leading benefits and commitment to employee advancement. Were committed to bringing great talent to our team to help us change the world. One network connection at a time.

Job Summary

We are in the process of filling open positions for the combined company following Employers acquisition of Level 3 Communications. All qualified candidates who express interest by submitting an application to an open posting will be considered. However, based on business needs, preference may be given to internal applicants on certain positions. We still welcome, and encourage, all application submissions while we continue our integration process. Internal applicants are current, active Employer employees, including Level 3 employees who have transitioned to Employer as part of the acquisition.

Job Description

The Sr. Program Operations Manager demonstrates leadership in communicating business goals / programs / processes focused around improving effectiveness and efficiencies of the pre-sales support roles (Sales Engineering, Sales Operations and Sales Support Associates). The Pre-Sales PMO Sr. Program Operations Manager will leverage effectiveness and LSS best practices to solve problems, develop and execute objectives for self and others, and have the ability to effect short-term and some long-term business goals.The Sr. Program Operations Manager will support initiatives enabling the pre-sales support roles to achieve operational excellence in order to gain overall competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide leadership and direction to cross-functional team empowered to execute process best practices (ex. LSS, STM, PM) for data quality & process improvement.
  • Working with pre-sales, sales and supporting organizational leaders to understand productivity challenges, propose approaches, and implement changes to improve pre-sales support role effectiveness
  • Deliver breakthrough levels of improvement in process and role capability, reproducibility of designs and business processes to reduce data defects and attain world-class levels of quality through completion of effectiveness initiatives
  • Facilitate, train, and coach team members in the use of pre-sales PMO best practices
  • Work with operating leaders and teams to uncover and assess lean pre-sales support effectiveness and improvement opportunities
  • Communicate teams' progress to Champions and Business Leaders
  • Identify potential process improvement projects and lead Pre-Sales PMO programs through managing, planning, and monitoring key initiatives from conception through implementation
  • Support Pre-Sales PMO projects / programs including but not limited to the management of all program management activities, oversight for program schedules and key milestones, reporting of program status, issue management, change management and risk management

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Experience developing strategic project portfolios leveraging improvement best practices such as Lean Six Sigma, PMP best practices, etc.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and manage though challenges in a data driven approach.
  • Ability to prioritize projects, navigate challenges, and communicate changes and support needed.
  • Strong executive-level presentation skills.
  • Strong change management and coaching skills.
  • Strong analytical ability.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence and build a collaborative environment.
  • Previous Sales/SE & Project / Program Management knowledge
  • Mix of pre-sales and post-sales experience
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem solving skills
  • Excellent leadership, mentoring, and coaching skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills as well as negotiation, coordination, organization, facilitation, and conflict management skills

Education and Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent education and experience. Typically with 5-7 years related experience
  • 2+ years previous manager level leadership experience preferred.
  • Certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt is a plus
  • Sales, Sales Operations, Order Management experience is a plus
  • Telecommunications experience
  • PMP Certification desirable but not required

Education

Bachelors or Equivalent

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Broomfield; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Missouri-St Louis; US-Texas-Dallas

job.title: Account Consultant
job.description:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information.

Job Summary

The primary responsibility of the Account Consultant is the sales and sales support of complex communication solutions (IP, data, cloud, hosting, voice, etc.). This is accomplished by understanding the customer's business needs and strategies, building relationships and long term partnerships with the customer and developing and applying Employer solutions to those needs and strategies. The position is responsible for positioning Employer with the customer and positioning Employer strategic products with the customers.

Job Description

  • Primary interface with both internal and external customers this positions requires a complete focus on customer service and perfecting the customer experience.
  • Responsible for attainment of revenue objectives and service quality objectives.
  • Responsible for input to and execution of account plans while leading and managing the development of the Service Plan segment for the overall Account Plan.
  • Actively engages and coordinates with customers in person and remotely, ensuring superior service levels are maintained and leading customer specific quality improvement plans as documented and identified in the Service Plan.
  • Actively works and coordinates activities in support of sales, with numerous teams that support the provisioning, design, installation and billing of sales to customers.
  • Interacts effectively as a team member to support achievement of sales objectives.
  • Makes accurate and timely decisions based on customer needs and business requirements.
  • Develops, maintains and manages customer relationships from the operational to executive levels throughout the organization.
  • Contributes to the attainment of revenue objectives by managing orders from the sales stage through to accurate billing and revenue recognition.
  • Represents Employer to multiple departments and levels within the Account, by understanding how Employers products meet their goals.
  • Assess customer needs and desires and suggest solutions and alternatives; this may involve product offerings, or improved ways of conducting business between Employer and the customer
  • Escalates proactively within interdependent departments to accomplish assigned responsibilities.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience supporting customers as it pertains to telecommunications products and services.
  • Experience supporting a sales team and/or sales support team in the area of Telecommunications solutions to include facilitation of proposals, product offering, agreements, contract review and support, and managing customer priorities with company initiatives.
  • Experience with all Employer Legacy systems including legacy Qwest Local, National and legacy CenturyTel products, processes including all billing care support.
  • Experience and/or technical knowledge in Network ordering, billing and provisioning processes and systems

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong interpersonal, communication, customer service, account relationship, time management, organizational and negotiating skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills, especially when dealing with incomplete or conflicting information
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
  • Some support activities requires work to be performed in the evening (network cutovers, voice migrations)
  • Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).

Alternate Location: Atlanta, GA;

job.title: Technical Analyst
job.description:
The Salesforce Technical Analyst supports the use and integration of Marketo s SFDC ecosystem, which includes the Marketo product suite and many other SaaS applications. This position requires a thorough understanding of SFDC s internal architecture and Force.com technologies.

Key Responsibilities

Technical

  • Responsible for Marketo s overall Force.com environment
  • Work with other Technical Leads to ensure the stability of the systems
  • Ensure that standards are followed by offshore developers and third-party consultants
  • Maintain proper change control over all Force.com objects
  • Provide input to architecture decisions and assists with SaaS product evaluations and selections
  • Provide assistance to SFDC super users throughout Marketo

Production Support

  • Perform basic administration of Marketo s SFDC instance including object and field definition, structure, documentation, long range requirements, operational guidelines, protection and licensing
  • Responsible for reliability of master data maintained on the platform
  • Formulate and monitor policies, procedures and standards relating to all platform usage and performance
  • Responsible for ongoing support requests and administrative needs of users
  • Define dashboards and processes to continuously monitor service quality, integrity and performance.
  • Direct and enforces security controls for all levels of security

Project Team Role

  • Define Technical Requirements and Technical Design
  • Ensure the development team adheres to the coding best practices
  • Review and sign-off on all technical deliverable

Required Skills

  • Completion of Dev 401 and ADM 201
  • Designing, configuring and customizing Salesforce.com CRM
  • Developing on the force.com applications using Visualforce, the Apex programming language and JavaScript
  • Hands-on knowledge and experience of Salesforce.com applications, APIs, and Force.com platform security
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated experience in unit testing and debugging techniques
  • Salesforce deployment using change sets and ANT
  • Development Apex, SQL, SOQL utilizing Eclipse and/or Mavensmate
  • Integration with third party apps and legacy systems such as Intacct

Desired Experience

  • Multiple implementations and projects
  • Development experience in an object-oriented language such as Java or C#
  • Hands-on experience using Process Builder
  • Lightning experience

The IT Support Professional is responsible for providing technical assistance and support related to computer systems, hardware, or software. They respond to queries, runs diagnostic programs, isolates problems, and determines and implement solutions.

job.title: Quantitative User Experience Researcher
job.description:
Located in Oakland s Jack London Square, A3Ventures is the innovation lab and capital-investment engine of AAA. We anticipate needs and shape innovations to help people make sense of our rapidly changing world.

As a Quantitative User Experience Researcher, you will be a core part of an agile and passionate team charged with developing, incubating, and launching a portfolio of businesses that:

  • Embrace key megatrends, disruptive technologies, and business models;

  • Are collectively capable of generating ~$400+ million in revenue during the next 10 years; and

  • Leverage the privileged assets, resources, and distinctive capabilities of AAA.

What You ll Do

Contribute to a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team effort to identify, scope, pilot and launch new products and services.

  • Research Planning. Plan and design primary user research that will generate insights about the market and customer fit of new concepts, products and services. Identify the key questions associated with developing, designing and refining all aspects of UX for business and product development, and recommend the right research methodologies to answer them. Be able to toggle between quick-turn usability and longer-term strategic understanding of our audience.

  • Research Execution. Design and launch surveys and other initiatives that will generate insights to inform product development, including testing and optimizing concepts, determining appropriate pricing, estimating product trial and usage, defining the appropriate customer target market, etc. using both traditional and innovative quantitative research techniques.

  • Prepare and Communicate Insights. Analyze research results, prepare report summaries and share research insights with project leads and other colleagues to help guide and refine the development of concepts, products and services.

  • Identify Opportunity and Mitigate Risk. Participate in ideation through launch of new products and services, using your skills and expertise to identify opportunity and mitigate risk. Using insights generated from quantitative studies and sound judgment, make strategic recommendations that ensure product development efforts are on track to develop products and services that address the needs of customer targets.

  • Manage Vendor Relationships. Manage relationships with external service providers as appropriate. Provide perspective on innovative tools and methods that add value and insight.

What You ve Done

Ideally, you will have at least 7 years of experience in primary marketing, UX, design or product research, with expertise designing and executing a broad array of quantitative research methodologies

  • Focus on Innovation. Experienced in new product innovation, conducting research to inform development at the beginning of the product lifecycle.

  • Research Planning. Strong strategic and technical research acumen, with the ability to identify key questions and develop sound research plans.

  • Quantitative Research. Experienced designing and executing quantitative research studies end-to-end (questionnaire design, monitor fieldwork, run analyses, develop report, present to the team), with the ability do the work yourself in-house or manage outside research vendors, depending on the scope and need.

  • Agency and Client Perspectives. Experience with both an agency and a client a plus.

  • Complement Qualitative Research. Worked closely with qualitative researchers to synthesize the insights from their ethnographic approach. Demonstrate a robust understanding of how quantitative and qualitative research complements the other.

  • Contextual Insight. Developed an understanding of the business space relevant to AAA NCNU, such as mobility, home, leisure/travel, insurance and financial services.

What You ll Need to Succeed

  • You are highly analytical, with the ability to contribute to methodology improvements for increased efficiency and better insights.

  • You have strong familiarity with statistical analysis tools such as SPSS.

  • You have strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to tell a story from large data sets.

  • You have exceptional organizational, planning, and project management skills.

  • You apply disciplined fact-based judgment, balance rewards and risks, deliver on promises, and stay humble.

  • You help build a performance organization with heart and you develop strong teams that embrace diversity.

  • You are a problem solver and you re able to make smart simplifying assumptions.

  • You know how to evolve your thinking and strategy based on research, data, and industry trends.

  • You have excellent interpersonal and leadership skills and the ability to work well with a range of people.

  • You maintain a thought provoking strategic mindset while demonstrating the appropriate attention to detail, follow-through, and accountability required to turn concepts into successful products.

  • You make sense of the ambiguous.

  • You have a bachelor s degree in a related field; an MBA would be an asset.

Why Join Us?

  • Impact. Help reinvent AAA NCNU and the value propositions we will deliver to over 5.7MM Members (57MM in North America) whose lives we help improve. Leverage the best of established corporate resources combined with start-up speed and agility to create real and meaningful impact.

  • Recognition. We offer a competitive total compensation package including base salary, both annual and long-term lucrative performance bonuses, benefits, and 401(k) Company match with additional discretionary contribution potential.

  • Lifestyle. We do honorable work, and we practice our values: respect, integrity, teamwork, and service.






About Us
For over a century, AAA has continued to redefine itself to become a multi-faceted leading provider of travel, insurance and auto services. We know you're as versatile as we are and that every aspect of your personality adds to the skills and knowledge you bring to AAA. That's what makes you so exceptional, and what you offer our Members and the communities we serve that much more unique. As an eligible Team Member, you have the chance to do honorable work, receive competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package and opportunities to grow your career.

The second-largest regional Member club of the national organization, and fastest growing mid-large size club in North America, AAA Northern California, Nevada & Utah is headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, and brings together:
  • An award winning work culture and environment
  • 2,800 employees to serve over 4 million Members
  • Over 75 branch offices across Northern California
  • Eleven branch offices across Nevada
  • Six branch offices across Utah

job.title: Senior Business Architect
job.description:
To provide clarity and structure to business objectives and operationalize business objectives into reality by influencing and leading creative solutions that enhance technology and process capabilities and business performance. Responsible for visibility into the future state of business strategies and identification of synergies between projects to ensure effective execution. To ensure collaboration between technology architecture and business leading to increased credibility with business partners.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Creates and influences strategic roadmaps in alignment with technology roadmaps and business priorities and strategies.
  • Partners with the process owners' to define the desired end state for each component of the investments lifecycle
  • Defines, manages, and governs business architecture principles, ensuring harmony with IT architecture principles and implementation via business processes and solution design
  • Recognized as an expert in Asset Management and Vanguard s processes and technology. Recognized Vanguard expert with Industry Best Practices
  • Identifies synergies between upcoming projects and in-flight projects and ensures clear communication with technology and BMO to ensure process/engineering builds are done effectively and efficiently. Ensures that the current initiatives are in line with the desired end state and/or IMG's flywheel
  • Develops and oversees heat maps/health of the business systems and processes by ideating and collaborating with Technology Solution architects to ensure consistency in delivery in accordance to business roadmaps and strategies. Ideates and collaborates with IMFS to ensure innovation is injected into the project/program delivery pro-actively
  • Maintains in-depth awareness and acumen of the investments industry trends
  • Ensures vendor's capabilities are used to full state and ensures appropriate decisions are made in conjunction with technology and business to build in-house vs. use vendor solutions and evaluate pros and cons of the build vs. buy
  • Influences vendors to develop capabilities that enhance Vanguard's desired end state. Review vendor release notes and analyze against desired end state roadmap to recommend next target release upgrade and other opportunities
  • Ensure roadmaps are documented and maintained for in-house applications
  • Oversees the underlying operating model
  • Participates in or leads special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree preferably in accounting, finance, economics, or related field. Graduate degree highly regarded.
  • CFA preferred. Certifications in Project Management, Six Sigma, Lean are highly regarded.
  • Minimum of fifteen years business experience, ten years plus project management & business analysis, seven years plus in business architecture experience in Portfolio Management and/or Trading, Risk Management and Data Management, and ten years plus leadership/crew development preferred.
  • Expert experience in business architecture, business requirements definition and process mapping skills.
  • Expert knowledge and understanding of the investment management lifecycle and securities markets and practices.
  • Understands the characteristics of and ensures the symbiotic relationship between business architecture, technical architecture, and application architectures to enable technical initiatives to be delivered efficiently.
  • Proven ability in business architecture design and concepts. Exceptional knowledge in process re-engineering, quality management framework required, ideally Six Sigma/Lean. Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office applications required.
  • Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, ambiguous environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities with varying scope and impact.
  • Proven ability to define/own global process and complex initiatives. Highly organized with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills. Exceptional conceptual thinking and technical skills. Exceptional analytical skills and understanding of processes and technology (SDLC). Strong persuasion and influence skills and ability to navigate and build buy-in across a matrix structure/multiple regions.
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate (written and verbal) at all levels including external providers and internal business clients and ability to navigate complex organizations.

Special Factors

Ability to work beyond regular business hours supporting global initiatives
Limited international travel may be required

job.title: Drivetrain Software Test Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Waterloo
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Drivetrain Software Test Engineer - 33843

Your Responsibilities

As a Drivetrain Software Test Engineer, located in Waterloo, IA at the Product Engineering Center, you will be accountable for software verification test planning and test execution for drivetrain software on current tractors and be engaged with migrating the test capability to AutoSAR on new tractors. The drivetrain subsystem controls transmission engagement as well as other powertrain auxiliaries (such as front- and rear power takeoff, mechanical front wheel drive, and differential lock). You will be integrated with and located in the Waterloo software delivery team which develops the drivetrain control software. In addition you will:

  • Create the drivetrain sub-system software verification test plan for the features being delivered and defects being fixed once per software planning session (that is, once every two-month period)
  • Define the appropriate level of regression testing required in each round of testing
  • Be accountable for software verification and test execution.
  • Be responsible for tracking metrics as defined by the Software Test Supervisor (requirements to test case coverage, test case data, test results, defects found, defects escaped)
  • Assure the availability of test environments (Model in the Loop (MiL), Software in the Loop (SiL), Hardware in the Loop (HiL), Vehicle in the Loop (ViL).) and define which test environments to use based on the test strategy
  • Transition the software test capability to more of a Model in the Loop (MiL) focus with the team as they switch the software over to AutoSAR controllers

Visa sponsorship is NOT available for this position.

What Skills You Need

  • 1 or more years of experience working in mechatronics; including a solid understanding of electrical and electronics, hydraulics, and mechanical systems
  • 1 or more years of experience with embedded systems in either product development or product test
  • 1 or more years of control system experience preferably related to propulsion systems and/or agriculture equipment
  • 1 or more years of experience with electronic test tools and simulation tools to assist in analysis and verification

What Makes You Stand Out

  • Experience testing drivetrain control software
  • Experience working with Model Based Software Design (MBSD) and/or system simulation (For example, experience using Matlab or Simulink)
  • Experience working with test case automation tools (For example, experience using ECU-Test or AllSim)
  • One or more years of experience with CAN bus and tools used for testing and analysis
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum software development environment
  • Experience operating Agricultural / off-road equipment
  • ISTQB (International Software Testing Qualifications Board) Certification or equivalent
  • Good interpersonal, oral and written communication skills

Education (or equivalent work experience)

  • Bachelors of Science in Electronics/Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Technology, or other relevant discipline

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

job.title: Senior Software Design Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - North Dakota (US-ND) - Fargo
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Senior Software Design Engineer - 36252

Your Responsibilities

As a Senior Software Design Engineer, for John Deere Electronic Solutions, located in Fargo, ND you will define, design, implement, test, deploy, and support new and existing functionality for PC-based software tool, used to automate creation of low-level software used in AUTOSAR-based products. In addition you will:

  • Perform requirements capture, analysis, design, programming, debugging, advanced coding, and highly complex testing and troubleshooting of a highly configurable tool designed for multiple products and stakeholders.
  • Understand key AUTOSAR interfaces and implement software tool features to automate the configuration and integration of AUTOSAR software projects using the appropriate scripting language and techniques.
  • Implement code using advanced programming techniques with hand-coding, open source, or off-the-shelf software packages; solve most tool suite set up problems. Solve integration issues that involve multiple code modules, code bases, and/or multiple developers and critically review others' code.
  • Lead resolution of tool or system defects. Support system integration, troubleshooting, and verification of end-to-end system performance; employ advanced troubleshooting strategies; quickly determine root cause with limited support from others and provide support in troubleshooting.
  • Review documentation produced during the Product Development Lifecycle that is generated by other engineering groups and verifies documentation is sufficient for product design. Generate support documents as needed.
  • Work closely with other project team members as needed to ensure the released software tool can be used to successfully build product software for each supported electronic control unit per the high level requirements.

*** U.S. visa sponsorship IS available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • Five or more years of experience in firmware (Embedded Software) development.
  • Five or more years of experience in C/C++, C# or Java programming languages.
  • Five or more years of experience with microcontrollers, ARMs, DSPs, and/or PSoCs.
  • Experience in roles that required an understanding of AUTOSAR architecture.
  • Experience in roles that required an understanding of microcontroller operation and memory organization.
  • Experienced in the operation and use of compilers, linkers and locators.
  • Demonstrated effective written and verbal communication skills.

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Experience with Vector DaVinci AUTOSAR Development Tools.
  • Experience with communication networks (e.g. CAN, LIN, Ethernet, FlexRay, etc.).
  • Experience with simulation and modeling tools (e.g. MATLAB, Simulink, Real-Time Workshop, etc.).
  • Experience with Microcontroller peripherals and systems (e.g. PWM outputs, boot loaders, A/D converters, watchdog timers, interrupt and trap functions, serial and parallel interfaces, etc.)
  • Experience with Agile processes.
  • Experience with Visual Studio 2010 or more current versions.
  • Experience with scripting languages such as JavaScript, Groovy, or TLC .

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Science in an Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Mechanical Engineering discipline.
  • Advanced degree in Engineering, desired.

job.title: Product Development Engineer
job.description:
Mechanical Engineer Kelly Services is currently seeking a Mechanical Engineer for one of our top clients in Raynham, MA. #KVETS4JJ Mechanical Engineer Product Development The design and development aspects of a series of projects through all phases of the product development process; planning and executing projects or portions of projects from concept through commercialization, and into post-market surveillance. Candidate will execute specific design projects based on surgeon inputs, and will work closely with sales and with cross-functional team members marketing, manufacturing, quality, regulatory, supply chain, etc. as well as with surgeons, to establish clinical inputs and solve design problems utilizing CAD techniques, rapid and conventional prototyping, and other available technologies. Position requires the ability to accurately capture and translate user needs and clinical requirements into innovative, novel, and robust design solutions that can be comprehensively validated. Candidate must be able to apply knowledge of mechanical design processes to develop concepts, generate designs, and facilitate the manufacture of medical instruments and implants to meet the needs of surgeons patients. The Product Development Engineer will develop layouts using CAD and tolerance analyses utilizing GD T, and will participate in design evaluations such as engineering calculations and FEA, simulated use testing, dry labs and wet tissue labs, etc. He/she will also support and generate the documentation of clinical and surgical technique observations, to create meaningful design solutions. This individual will also be involved with development and execution of design verification and validation plans and testing and will support regulatory review for US and global registration efforts as needed. Candidate will participate in the design and development of complex mechanisms and will work with manufacturing engineers and/or suppliers to optimize designs for manufacturability and assembly, and will produce functioning prototypes and supporting production documentation. This individual should have a demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and manage a varied workload, exhibit strong written and verbal communication skills and interface effectively with project teams, management and surgeons. A minimum of a Bachelor s of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering, or Biomedical Engineering or other technical discipline is required. An Advanced Degree is preferred. job.title: Quality Assurance/Validation Manager
job.description:
Validation Manager Monroe, NC Kelly Scientific is looking for a Validation manager for one of our top clients in Monroe, NC. This is a direct hire position Monday Friday. 1st shift. Responsibility: Provide support for all validation/qualification activities throughout the facility including new and existing products, process validation, equipment qualification, and software validation. Write, review, and execute protocols and final summary reports. Write and review documentation as required for validation activities including risk assessments, mitigation strategies, and investigations of nonconformances. Schedule and plan equipment, process, and software validations to meet approved timelines. Ability to handle multiple projects and work independently. Design and support FAT/SAT activities at vendor facilities as required. Coordinate all validation activities with other departments. Train other Validation personnel, QC personnel, and Production personnel as needed. Purchase supplies and equipment for validation activities. Maintain a working knowledge of critical plant utilities, equipment, and software systems. Support administrative duties as assigned Other duties as assigned. Authority: Cooperation with external suppliers and other companies are required. Quality representative in validation and qualification activities. Evaluation and disposition of products, including non-conforming product, according to valid QMI documents. Investigation and closure of QIRs and corrections in cooperation with QCM, as related to validation activities. Organize and perform special testing in cooperation with QCM, as related to validation activities. Perform final release of product and reviewing of documents according to valid TPs and SOPs as required for validation activities. Communication and information exchange with affiliated facilities. Editing and distribution of QC documents. Training of QC and production employees regarding procedures and use of equipment related to validations. Functions related to SAP QM module Key User. Write, review, and approve validation documentation. Job Requirements: Bachelors degree in Science, Chemistry, Engineering or a related field is required. Must have at least 3 years of experience in the medical device or pharmaceutical manufacturing environment (ISO 13485 preferred). Demonstrated experience validating a wide range of equipment and processes. Demonstrated experience and knowledge of qualifying changes to validated systems, processes, and equipment. Advanced knowledge of cGMPs, GDPs, and regulatory requirements as they relate to qualification and validation activities (IQ,OQ, PQ). Must have ability to interpret engineering drawings. Proficient Computer skills and MS office skills including word processing, spreadsheet, and database software. Must have knowledge of basic statistic and calculations Must have good communication and writing skills, including report writing. Proficient knowledge in applicable chemical calculations preferred Must pass pre-employment examination and qualification test. Physical Requirements: Must be able to stand and walk for up to 8 - 12 hours. Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. Must have appropriate vision to perform detailed quality inspection as outlined in SOPs and TPs. Why Kelly? Our connections can lead you to innovative scientific pursuits youll be proud to help advance. job.title: Junior Linux System Administrator
job.description:
The Opportunity

Marketo is looking for a Linux Systems Administrator that will work as part of a high-caliber team of experienced Linux System Administrators supporting multiple service stacks while ensuring uptime, availability, and performance SLAs are met in a SaaS environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Provided tier1 and 2 Linux Systems operational support and engineering in a SaaS environment.
  • Engage with systems application and engineering teams with service improvements, incident post mortems and new service projects.
  • Follow operations policies and procedures for production Installing, configuring, and maintaining production systems and applications.
  • Build and create tools, scripts, and operating procedures for continuous service improvements.
  • Deploy new releases and patches to test and production environments manually and with release automation.
  • Create, update service scripts and procedure development and documentation.
  • Supporting 24x7 On-Call rotation.

Required Skills/ Experience:

  • Working hands on experience of Linux Systems Administration (2 -3 years)
  • Operational experience supporting large, high-volume sites, ideally at a SaaS company.
  • Managing LAMP servers in a Highly-Available, 24x7 production environment (1-2 years)
  • Experienced with hosting Java application servers (Tomcat, JBoss, etc) in a highly available and high throughput environment.
  • Experienced scripting skills using Unix scripting toolkits (bash, sed, awk, etc)
  • Demonstrated experience working with monitoring and analytics tools (e.g. Nagios, Cacti, Splunk)
  • BS degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience (Computer Science or Computer Engineering is preferred)

Nice-to-haves:

  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience.
  • Storage administration experience, especially with NetApp filers
  • MySQL database administration experience
  • Virtual systems build and management utilizing VMware, KVM, Xen, etc.

Marketo is an equal opportunity employer

job.title: Embedded Security Architect
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa (US-IA) - Waterloo
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Embedded Security Architect - 32863

Note: This position s location may be flexible or located at Waterloo, IA per the hiring manager's discretion. This may be dependent on the successful candidate's background, experience, and proficiency.

Your Responsibilities

As an Embedded Security Architect for John Deere, you will be an expert user of worksite security technologies and strategies and apply security technologies and architectures to product designs. In addition, you will:

  • Work with mixed electronic systems of new, legacy, and 3rd party electronic components and be able to recommend security strategies
  • Lead product groups through security reviews to identify security risks and assets to protect
  • Work with product groups to calculate metrics around product security for EPDP reporting
  • Create and perform security penetration testing on products with security deployed
  • Perform training for EPDP teams on security and EPDP security processes
  • Collaborate and participate in security architecture development
  • Collaborate and participate insecurity design and process development
  • Research the industry and experts for innovations and trends related to product security

U.S. Visa sponsorship IS available for the role.

What Skills You Need

  • Technical skill and knowledge in electronic systems engineering or electronic/technology/software architecture
  • Knowledge in engineering principles, theory and practice as well as product knowledge
  • Understanding of engineering principles as they relate to the company product
  • Ability and willingness to travel, up to 35% (primarily domestic within the IA/IL area)

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • Knowledge of machine security architectures
  • Technical skill and knowledge in electronic security

Education (or equivalent work experience)

  • Degree in Engineering/Technology, Science, or a similar discipline or equivalent experience

What You'll Get

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package.

The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.

John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

job.title: Software Design Engineer
job.description:
There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we re all about at John Deere. And it s why we re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world s brightest minds are tackling the world s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - North Dakota (US-ND) - Fargo
Function: Product Engineering
Title: Software Design Engineer - 36410

Your Responsibilities

**Please note: This posting may serve to fill multiple positions. **

As a Software Design Engineer, you will design new and existing embedded software controls for robust on/off-road vehicles and harsh environments focusing on AUTOSAR BSW software. In addition you will:

  • Develop complex architectural, detailed design/analysis, coding, and/or automated Hardware-in-the Loop (HiL) and Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) testing, troubleshooting of firmware (embedded software) systems.
  • Configure AUTOSAR BSW (Basic Software) and MCAL (MicroController Abstraction Layer) and integrate for variety of electronic controllers; support application team members as needed.
  • Work in a highly skilled software team to deliver high-quality software work products utilizing software development processes.
  • Travel as needed domestically and internationally to accomplish the tasks required.

*** U.S. visa sponsorship IS available for the role. ***

What Skills You Need

  • One or more years of experience with AUTOSAR standards and/or architecture and configuration tools for BSW and/or MCAL.
  • Three or more years of experience in embedded system development.
  • Two or more years of experience in embedded software development for 32 bit microcontrollers, C or C++ languages, compiler, linker, and locator tools chains.
  • Experience with development and debugging tools (such as Software Configuration Management, debuggers, oscilloscopes, timing analysis, static analysis, logic analyzers, multi-meters, etc.) to perform development and troubleshooting.

What Makes You Stand Out

Other areas of experience or interest that will help us place you on the right team include:

  • One or more year of experience with design, develop, and/or test input/output hardware abstraction, complex device drivers (CDD) for AUTOSAR basic software (BSW) and configure for applications.
  • One or more year of experience with Test automation utilizing HIL and/or SIL systems, and/or Test script development using Python.
  • Experience to configure various AUTOSAR BSW stacks and services creating or utilizing automated scripting tools and automated test system.
  • Experience using Vector tool chain (such as PREEVision, DaVinci tool suite, CANdelaStudio, CANape etc.)
  • Experience with CMMI or other mature development models.
  • Experience with NI or ETAS or ECUTest HIL automation system.
  • Experience with communication networks (e.g. CAN, LIN, Ethernet, etc.) and protocols (e.g. UDS, XCP,J1939, ISO11783, TCP/IP, etc.)

Education

Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent work experience in the following:

  • Bachelors of Science in an Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering discipline.

job.title: Senior Front End Developer - Accessibility
job.description:
Did you know that Vanguard has a program that focuses on making our existing and new applications as accessible as possible? Accessibility ensures all users have equal access to information and functionality regardless of ability (visual, hearing, motor, cognitive, and color perception). The Accessibility program is working with all of the IT sub-divisions to evaluate and improve the web experience for all of our clients. Being a virtual company, this is so important!
The Accessibility Developer will work with the project teams across IT to support in implementing accessibility standards, build out training materials for teams to use along their accessibility journey, and contribute to office hours and other forums to further educate the developers at Vanguard. Front-End/UI skill-sets, relationship management, and leadership impact are the primary tools needed for success in this role.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provides senior level system analysis, design, development, and implementation of applications and databases for client/server-, Web-, and/or PC-based software or middleware. Integrates third party products.
  • Translates technical specifications, and/or logical and physical design into code for new or enhancement projects for internal clients. Develops code and test artifacts that reuse subroutines or objects, is well structured, backed by automated tests, includes sufficient comments and is easy to maintain. Writes programs, appropriate test artifacts, ad hoc queries, and reports. Employs contemporary software development techniques to ensure tests are implemented in a way that supports automation.
  • Elevates code into the development, test, and Production environments on schedule. Provides follow up Production support. Submits change control requests and documents.
  • Thoroughly understands software development methodology. Thoroughly understands architecture standards. Trains and mentors staff with less experience. Resolves issues elevated from staff with less experience.
  • Participates in design, code, and test Inspections throughout life cycle to identify issues. Explains technical considerations at related meetings, including those with internal clients.
  • Performs systems analysis, including system requirements analysis and definition (e.g., prototyping), and logical and physical design.
  • Writes the system/technical portion of assigned deliverables. Assists technical team members with the system/technical portion of their deliverables (e.g., systems testers, test plans). On small teams, the developer may write these items.
  • Thoroughly understands client business functions and technology needs. Has a broad understanding of Vanguard s technologies, tools, and applications, including those that interface with business area and systems.
  • Is highly functional on large, matrixed project teams. Interfaces with cross functional team members, including database administrator, IT security, project manager, technical writer, and clients. Communicates systems issues at the appropriate technical level for each audience.
  • Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established milestones. Thoroughly understands and complies with all Information Security policies and procedures, and verifies deliverables meet Information Security requirements.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Education & Experience (Qualifications):

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum of 5 years developer or systems analyst experience.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong, demonstrated analysis and problem solving skills.
  • Strong planning and organizational skills. Knowledge of or ability to learn the Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0 level A and AA) and mentor other crew.
  • Assistive technology knowledge and experience is a plus (JAWS, NVDA, WindowEyes, ZoomText, VoiceOver).

Advanced knowledge of one or more development tools and programming languages:

  • HTML 5, CSS 3, and JavaScript
  • Angular, Node, and JQuery, frameworks
  • Testing Frameworks such as: Protractor, Selenium, and Cucumber
  • IDE s: SpringSource Tool Suite (STS), and Webstorm

**Vanguard is not offering Visa Sponsorship for this position**

job.description:
Test Engineer III- Frisco, TX Kelly Services is currently hiring a Test Engineer to support a leading pharmaceutical and healthcare services company in Frisco, TX. Length: 6 Months + Pay: Negotiable Must have: 2 years + Identity and Access Management (IAM) testing experience 3 years + experience with test automation (preferably Selenium/Java). Extensive experience in testing tools TFS and ALM ********************************************************************************************** Description: Responsible for leading the testing of Identity and Access Management solutions that interface with various software and hardware devices in an integrated test environment. This resource will work closely with project management and development to plan and execute comprehensive testing strategies (Manual and/or automated) for IAM product software, hardware, firmware, security and databases before releasing to our customers. This position will also manage the set-up of test bed/systems and scenarios to replicate customer production environment and assist in review and implementation of structured system testing practices. Lead the creation and execution of test plans and procedures and accountable for the entire testing life cycle of the IAM solutions including testing and documentation. Develops and performs regression testing of existing software. Coordinates with end users to plan user acceptance testing, alpha and beta. Responsible for configuration management of software builds and documentation; supports the change management process with a focus on smooth implementations and/or changes. Reproduces customer issues when needed to support the service department and the development group. Responsible for reporting application defects along with required details. Coordinate with offshore and onsite project resources on analyzing, verifying and closing defects. The resource will be responsible to manage QA tasks for multiple projects within IAM capacity. Resource will be reporting progress/issues to project management and leadership on daily basis. Skill Sets: 2+ years of proven hands-on experience working on testing Identity and Access Management solutions. Thorough working knowledge of user and access provisioning, Active Directory, Access certifications and Privileged Access Management products. Nice to have experience with OIAM (Oracle Identity and Access Manager)Experience with SSO and Multifactor Authentication is preferred Minimum 3 years of strong experience with test automation preferably Selenium/Java. Extensive experience in testing tools like TFS and ALM to support and assist the testing efforts. Experience in SQL/DB Scripting. Minimum 5 years of experience in QA including working with offshore teams. Strong understanding of complete Software development of Life Cycle Experience in waterfall, agile or iterative development and testing methodology. Strong analytical, problem-solving, conceptual skills and a good communicator; Excellent organizational skills; attention to detail; Ability to prioritize work load and consistently meet deadlines.
